Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Grenache is not known as the most ageworthy wine, but this bottling boasts all the bones to make it happen. Elegant aromas of boysenberry, lavender and dried red flowers lead into a tightly woven palate that combines ripe berries with gravelly minerality and stiff tannins. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Caliza 2016 Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This twist-top bottling is an easy, fun and very likable wine, starting with fresh aromas of sour cherry, gravelly minerality, wild thyme and dried sagebrush. Ripe red plums and strawberries make for a lush palate yet it's restrained with a chalky streak.
Name: Sculpterra 2016 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of this 100% varietal leap up with compelling notes of kirsch, plum, pomegranate, strawberry, white pepper and herb. The palate brings a beautiful sense of texture, layering and richness, followed by a hyper-extended finish. It's a knee-buckler.
Name: Latta 2015 Upland Vineyard Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A pretty pale copper color and 100% varietal, this is elegantly balanced between ripe peach and tangy acids. There's a lively tension that energizes the wine, lifting it along and through a delightfully extended finish. Fermented entirely in stainless, it's one of three exceptional rosés from Quady North.
Name: Quady North 2018 Rosé of Grenache (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's incredible elegance and layers to this cool-climate bottling, starting with cinnamon, clove and red cherry on the nose. There is a nice bounce to the palate of berries, pepper and dried herbs, with a tension that keeps the sip dry and tight.
Name: Chamisal Vineyards 2016 Grenache (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Soft aromas of baked red cherry, crushed clove, star anise and gingerbread make for a very spicy expression of Grenache from this warmer vineyard in the foothills. There is great grip and texture to the sip, where a core of red fruit and baking-spice flavors hide behind the tannins and fresh acidity.
Name: Mesa Del Sol 2015 Grenache (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-raspberry, clove, star anise, vanilla and pie crust aromas all show on the lush and rich nose of this bottling by Grenache-lover Mikael Sigouin. It's soft and plush on the palate with loads of baking-spice and ripe cherry flavors, like drinking a hot pie fresh from the oven.
Name: Kaena 2016 Clone 362 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried black cherry, muddy earth, star anise and black-plum paste aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There are strong spice tones to the palate, where star anise and dried ginger powder meet with bright and fresh flavors of strawberry sorbet.
Name: Le Vigne 2016 Di Domenico Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Baked black-cherry aromas meet with cinnamon stick and nutmeg on the rich spicy nose of this bottling by Tyler Russell. Black cherry also forms the core of the palate, which is balanced by fresh acidity and finished on a French toast flavor.
Name: Nelle 2016 Grenache (California)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Robust fruit shows on the nose of this medium-bodied, relatively weighty wine, sweetly creamy and lush on the palate in a layering of peach and candied lemon.
Name: Clif Family 2018 Rosé of Grenache (Mendocino)

Appellation: Ventoux, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Made from 90% Grenache and 10% Syrah, this massive, intensely fruity red offers loads of juicy black-cherry and plum flavors. The palate is warm and supple, accented by spicy tones of anise and cinnamon. These are balanced by fresh notes of lavender and violet as well as firm, finely edged tannins that structure the finish.
Name: Marrenon 2016 Orca Grenache (Ventoux)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pale-pink in the glass, this rosé of Grenache offers aromas of lemon glace, light strawberry and melon on the nose. It's taut on the palate, where strawberry and lemon peel flavors ride a well-constructed mouthfeel.
Name: Kaena 2018 Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Light in citrus tones, herb de Provence and earth, this refreshing wine has a grassy, floral element that's pretty and inviting.
Name: The Grenachista 2018 Rosé of Grenache Noir (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A yellower shade of pink, this bottling offers yellow-grapefruit rinds, rose petal and crushed chalk aromas on the nose. The palate shows nectarine, yellow-apple rinds, a taut texture and bright acidity.
Name: Kaena 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pale-pink in the glass, this bottling begins with very delicate aromas of pink lime, pluot, nectarine and the slightest bubblegum. There is strong acidity on the sip, where pink melon and steely minerality make for a clean and crisp style.
Name: San Simeon 2018 Stefano Vineyard Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Buttery baking-spice aromas and flavors make this full-bodied wine taste almost sweet. It shows ripe plums and raisins on the palate and has a good, lightly gripping texture.
Name: Le Casque 2016 Grenache (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: From a vineyard in the Antelope Valley, this bottling is very unique, starting with green-herb aromas of bay leaf, moss and dewy tarragon, with a touch of raspberry as well. The funky herbs show on the palate as well, where green olive plays against brighter red fruits. The structure and acidity are solid.
Name: Cavaletti 2017 Swayze Vineyard Grenache (Los Angeles County)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Flat berry aromas are pretty heavy, while this Garnacha is so full in body that it's a bit over the top for what it is. Ripe, candied flavors of baked black fruits and chocolate finish with bulk.
Name: Breca 2016 Garnacha De Fuego Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Peppy red plum and currant aromas are anything but serious. This Garnacha feels sticky and fairly flat. Candied cherry and raspberry flavors finish heavy and a bit cloying.
Name: Xucrogas 2016 Her Soul Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gaseous plastic-like aromas share the nose with olive and blueberry notes. The palate is full of both acid and pulp, but it's not integrated. Scattered flavors of plum and berry close down on a rough, skinned finish.
Name: Ignacio Marín NV El Gordo Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Heavily oaked aromas of milk chocolate and rubber eraser gives this Garnacha an “overworked” nose. The palate is big, thick, scratchy and edgy, with a heavy coating of chocolaty oak applied to sappy black plum flavors. When clove and vanilla hit like thunder on the finish, it's just too much.
Name: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Viñas Viejas de Paniza Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented 40% whole cluster and then given time to age in neutral barrels, this is a brawny, exotic and boldly flavorful wine. Black licorice, grilled meat and baked strawberry and cherry give it a complex lift of intrigue and succulence. The tannins are firmly structured and supportive.
Name: Jeff Cohn 2016 El Diablo Vineyard Grenache (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied Bing cherry, rose petals, potpourri and spice-rack flavors show on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. There is a compelling grip to the palate, where candied rose and berry flavors meet with turned earth, gravelly sandstone and light clove flavors.
Name: Nelle 2016 Wills Hills Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Structured aromas of blackberry sorbet, dark hibiscus and crushed granite show on the nose of this very compelling take on Grenache. There is a very strong tension to the palate, carrying dynamic flavors of black raspberry, tarragon, mint and candied rosewater.
Name: Zaca Mesa 2016 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This old-vine Grenache delivers aromas of strawberry and rose jam that is hard to resist. Red licorice, green herbs and white pepper are also there, paving the way for a light, silky, juicy palate that shows off delicate red fruit and a bright line of acidity. The tannins bring an earthy, savory quality to the mix.
Name: Angove 2016 Warboys Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A beautiful pale pink in color, this rosé, which includes 10% Grenache Blanc, shows lovely aromas of bubblegum, strawberry and wet cement on the nose. There is a great sizzle to the palate, where citrusy energy delivers rounded flavors of plum and strawberry.
Name: Brick Barn 2017 Rose of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Drake Whitcraft is pushing the earlier-pick, low-alcohol styles like few others, and this almost rosé-like Grenache is an extreme example. Transparent in the glass, the wine shows aromas of fresh strawberries, cinnamon, rose and tarragon. It's bright on the sip with cran-raspberry flavors and a simple touch of minty herbs. It's a great red wine for the beach.
Name: Whitcraft 2017 Stolpman Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Having had to skip a vintage in 2015, this wine is back with a pleasing vengeance, and is cofermented with 15% Mourvèdre. Strawberry, cherry and earth give it a bold, fresh flavorful complexity with depth and surprising freshness. It lingers in cherry cordial and cedar.
Name: Carlisle 2016 Rossi Ranch Grenache (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This biodynamic winery has produced a bright and bouncy wine that is grown at 278 feet above sea level, higher than most of McLaren Vale. Like sipping fresh strawberry or cherry juice—with crushed rose petal and white pepper spice in the mix—it's rounded out by soft, sandy tannins and plenty of acidity. Drink chilled in the summer with a cheese or meat platter.
Name: Paxton 2017 Thomas Block Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a fine example of how well this variety does when made into a lighthearted light-bodied quaff of a wine, with an inviting a bouquet of peach and strawberry. Dry, tangy and refreshing in acidity, it sizzles on the palate with verve and energy.
Name: Anaba 2018 Rosé of Grenache (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This new southern Oregon winery sources Jaxon Vineyards fruit and uses it well. This fresh, lively, fine-tuned Grenache bolsters the region's claim on the grape, which seems like a natural fit for the hot-climate Rogue Valley. Zin-like raspberry fruit, sappy acids and excellent concentration are the hallmarks.
Name: Goldback 2016 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Grenache rarely attains this sort of high alcohol concentration without feeling overblown, but here it works. High toned and deeply saturated, this black-purple wine clobbers the palate with thick, lush, explosively fruity blueberry and blackberry fruit. Jammy and potent, it was fermented whole cluster and kept in neutral oak for 16 months. If you love Grenache, this shows some of the best of what's being done with the grape in southern Oregon.
Name: Simple Machine 2014 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: In typical Grenache fashion, this is a fragrant, fruity wine that charges out of the gate with ripe red berry fruit, red licorice, orange zest, crushed flower and soft peppery spice. The palate is held together by savory tannins and mouthwatering acidity, which balances the slightly syrupy fruit.
Name: Chapel Hill 2017 Bush Vine Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 13% Syrah and 12% Mourvèdre, this wine is pale in color, showing some bricking at the rim. The aromas are a bit hard to tease out, with notes of cranberry and spice showing over time. The palate is elegant and transparent in style, with plentiful strawberry and raspberry flavors. The concentration is light initially, fleshing out a bit over time. What's there is lovely.
Name: Gramercy 2016 The Third Man Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This starts out with a fragrant, intriguing nose of herbal tonic, red fruit, rose petal, a copper penny tang and a damp earth core. The acidity on the palate is a little surprising and unexpected for this grape variety. It's crisp and makes the fruit feel a touch tart. But there's also a lovely, sandy-textured palate wound with soft tannins. Sip slightly chilled on a warm day.
Name: Mitolo 2017 Jester Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: A light- to medium-bodied Grenache boasting many of this variety's typical aromas: red currants, raspberries, florals, olives, peppery spices and a savory spine. The fruit on the sandy-textured palate is tart and juicy, wound with silky, savory tannins. The finish is a touch bitter.
Name: Blackbilly 2016 Old Vine Single Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Light in color and showing some bricking, this wine has aromas that offer notes of sandalwood, flower, white pepper, spice, herb and raspberry. Light, delicate smoked meat and spice flavors follow. This one is all about elegance and delicacy, but it brings both in abundance.
Name: Hood Crest 2016 Grenache (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strongly extracted cherry and mulberry aromas meet with sandalwood and pine-forest aromas on the nose of this bottling. The ripe berry and licorice flavors of the palate are very powerful.
Name: Vie Winery 2014 L'Imagnaire Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Lighter in color, with aromas of freshly squeezed Satsuma orange, raspberry and potpourri that lead to quite lightly styled fruit flavors. The concentration is light, but what is there intrigues.
Name: Aubichon Cellars 2016 Reserve Grenache

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This appetizing and full-bodied wine is worth searching out. It combines the varietal's ripe, generous aromas with an almost sinewy, tangy mouthfeel that brings out savory woodsy mineral flavors. It has very good balance, firm tannins and bracing acidity along with ripeness and roundness on the midpalate.
Name: Sol Rouge 2015 Grenache (Red Hills)

Appellation: Lirac, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Prominent accents of sweet spice and vanilla lend an extravagant flair to this bold, big-bodied varietal Grenache. Richly concentrated and opulent in texture, it's irresistibly hedonistic but nuanced too, shaded by savory notes of black pepper and earth. The long finish is marked by ripe but persistent tannins. It's ready now but the wine should improve through 2026.
Name: Domaine Maby 2016 Bel Canto Grenache (Lirac)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine offers abundant plum, berry and new-oak aromas. Mouthfilling fruit flavors develop on the palate, with a smooth texture to carry them along. It is rich, lightly tannic, full bodied and satisfying.
Name: Brassfield 2016 Grenache (High Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This appealing and well-balanced wine checks all the boxes for rosé. It is crisp, lively and lightly fruity. The color is light salmon, the aromas are full of peaches and tangerines and the flavors are dry, tangy and just fruity enough.
Name: Campovida 2017 Trails End Vineyard Rosé di Grenache (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône Villages, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This varietal Grenache sourced from vines dating to 1895 is a lavish explosion of black-cherry, strawberry-jam and jelly flavors accented by vanilla and spice. Plush and easy on the palate, its fruity and forward style is accentuated by soft acidity and fine-grained tannins. This hedonistic wine is ready now but should hold well through 2022.
Name: Château Maucoil 2016 1895 Grenache (Côtes du Rhône Villages)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône Villages, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Sourced from vines averaging more than 60 years in age, this is an intensely concentrated, succulent wine. Black-cherry and raspberry flavors are plush and open-knit, with a roundness accentuated by yielding acidity. It's a juicy, hedonistic sip structured by a slight grip of tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2022.
Name: Domaine Fond Croze 2016 Cuvée Romanaise Grenache (Côtes du Rhône Villages)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is light enough in color to pass as a rosé, and shows good, fresh red-fruit flavors along with good balance. Brisk acidity and light tannins give some grip on the palate, while raspberry flavors last through the tangy finish.
Name: Passaggio 2016 Heringer Estates Grenache (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, this is a blend of fruit from Upland, French Creek and Elevation vineyards. The aromas offer notes of cherry Jolly Rancher, white pepper, potpourri, blueberry and herb. Black and green olive notes emerge over time. Elegant, not fully concentrated fruit and savory flavors follow. Give it time to open up.
Name: Sleight of Hand 2016 The Sorceress Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Terra Alta, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Aromas of leather, cherry and berry aromas come with additional notes of dried herbs, grainy oak and animal hide. The medium-bodied palate is straightforward and lifted by bright acidity. Flavors of cherry tomato, red plum, raspberry and vanilla finish with springiness and punch. Drink now.
Name: Cellers Unió 2016 Clos Dalian Crianza Garnacha (Terra Alta)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a full-bodied wine that's pleasant and soothing to drink, and rather light in terms of flavor and tannin. It has a light-garnet color, fresh plum and raspberry aromas and mild, tasty, spiced-plum flavors.
Name: Campovida 2015 Dark Horse Ranch Grenache (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of raspberry candy, cranberry preserve and herb are followed by ripe, plump, fruit-driven flavors that have a pleasing yum factor. Pair it with pizza.
Name: Idilico 2015 Garnacha (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is appealing for its forward-fruit aromas, good balance despite full body, and well-concentrated flavors of red cherry, sour cherry and cedar. Moderate tannins keep the texture lively and gripping.
Name: Iron Hub 2015 Grenache (Amador County)

Appellation: Catalunya, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Foxy berry aromas are jammy and fleshy, while this Grenache shows rubbing tannins and bold acidity. Tomato, plum and oaky flavors have an herbal element, while this deals an additional hit of oak on a finish with scratchy residual tannins.
Name: Alta Alella 2017 GX Organic Garnatxa (Catalunya)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is rich and soothing, showing distinctive floral, grapey aromas, a broad mouthfeel and ripe concentrated plum and prune flavors. It feels quite full bodied but not very tannic, and leaves a lingering finish.
Name: Langman Estate 2016 Grace's Grenache (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Herbal red plum aromas come with an animal note. A tight, pulling palate features rough tannins, while this tastes of sappy plum and raspberry. A hollow but fresh finish leaves behind scrubbing tannins.
Name: Bodegas la Casa de Lúculo 2017 Cátulo Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Montsant, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Stalky red berry aromas are low on fruit, while this Catalonian Garnatxa feels grabby but short on depth. Oaky, pasty flavors outweigh modest fruit notes, while this feels grainy, gummy and slightly hot.
Name: Vinedos Singulares 2016 El Veïnat Garnatxa (Montsant)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine tastes mature and mellow, exhibiting aromas of tamarind, vanilla and vermouth, and oaky dried-fruit flavors. It's full bodied and well aged.
Name: Calavera 2014 Dalton Vineyard Grenache (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Initial gaseous aromas of sulfur, latex and rubber blow off and get replaced by generic berry scents. This standard Garnacha feels pulpy but soft. Candied cherry flavors are on the sweet side and play out on a plump finish.
Name: Sierra de Viento 2017 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Red fruit flavors of pomegranate and raspberry are candied, while this Garnacha feels bumpy and rough, without much structure or stuffing. Fresh but candied cherry and raspberry flavors suggest hard candy, while this is entirely basic on the finish.
Name: Legado del Moncayo 2017 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of clove and red fruits are pushed by boisterous oaky tones. Clove and baking spice notes on top of easy berry fruit flavors are smoky and forced, while clove, campfire and barbecue flavors are more than a Garnacha of this quality can handle.
Name: Bodegas Aragonesas 2017 Aragus Made with Organic Grapes Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Rubbery berry and cranberry aromas come with grassy field notes. This Garnacha has a clampy, raw, tannic mouthfeel and pointy flavors of plum and berry fruits. A lean, grabby, rubbing finish gets the job done, but barely.
Name: Agronavarra 2017 Ventana Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Rubbery, medicinal berry aromas open this basic Garnacha that's narrow on the palate. Berry flavors come with hints of vinegar and butter, while this feels a bit sticky and hot on the finish.
Name: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2017 Menguante Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy black fruit aromas are soft and dull. In the mouth, this marginal Garnacha feels sappy and heavy. Flat berry flavors are soupy and taste of barbecue sauce, while this draws down on a finish with sketchy balance.
Name: Bodegas San Valero 2017 Particular Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich, voluptuous and luxurious on the nose, this bottling shows aromas of Luxardo cherry and star anise. The palate is bound together with ripe flavors of kirsch, gingerbread and roasted pork in a caramelized marinade.
Name: Lost Blues 2014 High Horse Grenache (Central Coast)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Made from a single plot of organically farmed old vines, this wine offers lively tones of red berry, rose, violet and herbal tonic, backed by cinnamon and clove spice. It's light, bright and easy to knock back, which belies just how well structured and complex it really is. This is a beautiful example of the variety McLaren's Vale does best.
Designation: She's Electric Old Vine Single Vineyard
Name: Thistledown 2017 She's Electric Old Vine Single Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Quite dark in the glass and adorned with a hilariously awkward portrait on the label, this rich take on Grenache starts with aromas of concentrated black plum, licorice, clove and roasted meats. It's soft and luxurious on the palate, with rich, thick flavors of black cherry, oozing caramel, toasted tobacco and root-beer spice.
Name: Herman Story 2014 Late Bloomer Grenache (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: It's rare for a Grenache to be deemed cellar worthy, but this beauty, which is strategically bolstered by 4% Syrah, packs the right mix of tannin, alcohol and acidity to do the trick. Baked red cherries, clove and gingerbread show on the nose, while the sip grips the palate with chalky tannins, showing flavors of plum, cranberry, orange rind and baking spice. Drink now through 2028.
Name: Epoch 2015 Sensibility Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely fresh and snappy on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of raspberry, sage, mint and white pepper, and the underlying tension is quite apparent. The palate is tightly wound and energetic with flavors of cranberry and more raspberry.
Name: Peake Ranch 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This vintage expresses the variety's typical bright raspberry, cranberry, blueberry combo but laced with notes of dried leaves, nutmeg, cumin, white pepper and graphite. The palate is restrained and beautifully balanced, with soft, savory, sandy-textured tannins, a tart raspberry crunch and a mineral, hot stone spine. Drink now–2029.
Name: John Duval Wines 2016 Annexus Grenache (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Ventura County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling shows immense promise for vineyard potential in Ventura County, which has struggled with Pierce's disease over the years. Aromas of rose water, red plum, light cherry and cinnamon spice lead into a palate that's fresh with flavors of pomegranate and rose petal, yet grippy with tannins.
Name: Topa Mountain Winery 2016 Rich Vineyard Grenache (Ventura County)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine starts a little bombastically, with ripe, borderline candied fruit. But give it time in glass and it will keep changing for the better, getting prettier and more ethereal. It's dominated by raspberry compote and rhubarb aromas but then orange peel and violet notes emerge along with something savory, herbal and almost smokey. The palate is light to medium-bodied and those tart orange citrus characters really stand out here, backed by tight-grained yet satiny tannins and a herbal tonic finish.
Name: Thistledown 2016 The Vagabond Old Vines Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: From biodynamically farmed, old vines, this is a brilliant example of why this region and variety are gaining such renown. Aromas of bright red berries, florals, tar, white pepper and herbal tonic lead into a silky yet structured palate that is light to medium-bodied. The aromas carry through to the palate, knitting them together with spicy, earthy tannins and crunchy acidity. It's refreshing, austere and joyful all at once.
Name: Yangarra Estate Vineyard 2016 Old Vine Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is a lithe, bouncy small-batch, single-vineyard Grenache made with minimal intervention using grapes from a single vineyard. The nose is a delicate medley of bright cranberry, red currant and rhubarb smudged with cinnamon, thyme and graphite. The palate is light bodied and crunchy-fruited, boasting a touch of herbaceousness slithering along a savory spine.
Name: Year 2017 Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Made in painfully small quantities (400 bottles total), this wine offers aromas of cherries, red currants, blueberries and violets that cascade from the glass, all backed by a cinnamon stalkiness and touches of white pepper and cumin. The palate is threaded by laser sharp acidity and earthy tannins, backed by a peppery, herbal spine and finishes long and tangy.
Name: Thistledown 2017 Clarendon Smart Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Roasted blackberry and charred meat aromas show on the nose of this Grenache, which is superripe and extracted in the winery's style, but retains a compelling degree of balance. The palate shows rather elegant touches of star anise and clove against a backdrop of roasted cherries, plums, sagebrush and cola.
Name: Herman Story 2015 On the Road Grenache (California)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this delicate bottling offers aromas of aromatic herbs such as mint and tarragon along with lightly roasted Rainier cherry and red-melon touches. The palate is light and tart with flavors of watermelon, clay and crushed herbs.
Name: Ojai 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color with some bricking at the rim. The aromas offer hyperappealing notes of fresh ripe raspberry, white pepper, smoked meat, potpourri and dried herb. It dances on the palate with light, showy, elegant, juicy flavors that display a lovely sense of intensity and balance. A long finish caps it off. This one is all about delicacy.
Name: Two Vintners 2016 Claire Boushey Vineyard Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine is luscious and fruit forward, with less savory, stalky notes than its counterpart single-vineyard bottling, Clarendon Smart. Notes of ripe cherry, raspberry, flowers, dried herbs and just a touch of smoked meat lead onto a palate that shows plenty of fruit weight but also a good lick of acidity. It's tasty now but it's likely this wine's best is yet to come. Drink now–2025.
Name: Thistledown 2017 Blewitt Springs Schuller Rd Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from a vineyard that sits next to Highways 101 and 154 is extremely light in the glass, and shows intriguing aromas of grenadine, red melon, gingerbread spice, leather and cola. There's a dried ginger bite to the palate, where clove and sandalwood flavors mix with fleshy red fruit until the vanilla-kissed finish.
Name: Saarloos & Sons 2015 Broer El Camino Real Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Barossa, South Australia, Australia
Description: Strawberry in hue and in flavor, too, it's hard not to emit a grunt of pleasure upon first smelling and tasting this wine. It's light, bright and aromatic, bursting with plump red berries, orange peel, cumin, white pepper, stalks and a herbal tonic tone. Medium-bodied and silky smooth, it's seriously fruity but steers clear of being syrupy. Drink now–2026.
Name: Yalumba 2016 Old Bush Vine Grenache (Barossa)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine is named in honor of the historic winery's 90-year-old basket press. The nose offers up heady aromas of bright cherry, red currant, clove, fresh rose petals and graphite. These follow onto the palate where crunchy acidity and sandy, fine-grained tannins knit the bright fruit and floral flavors together.
Name: Kay Brothers 2017 Basket Pressed Amery Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of caramel-soaked cherry, vanilla candy and toasty oak show on the nose of this bottling. Those vanilla and caramel elements pop on the palate, which then leads into rounded red-fruit flavors on the midpalate, with hints of wild thyme and pepper on the finish.
Name: Broken Earth 2016 Limited Release Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is a light- to medium-bodied wine, with ripe plum, dark cherry and a bit of earthy funk. Green herbs and rose petals are also in the mix on the nose. The fruit is plush and borderline jammy on the palate, with soft, savory tannins, a fine line of acidity and a peppery, herbal finish. Drink now.
Name: Mitolo 2016 Jester Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is a dense, chewy wine—a Grenache for big red lovers. There's a wealth of aromas on the nose: cranberry, raspberry, oatmeal, cumin, dried herbs, black olive and dried rose petal. The palate is rich in feel, with sinewy, mouthfilling tannins that work alongside a currant flavor and tangy acidity. Drink through 2029.
Designation: Edgar Schild Reserve Old Bush Vines
Name: Schild Estate 2016 Edgar Schild Reserve Old Bush Vines Grenache (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe, syrupy plum and berry aromas are jammy and dense. This is a full-bodied Garnacha with 16% declared alcohol by volume. Candied black plum, cassis and brown sugar flavors are far from light and feminine, while this is chocolaty, calm and collected on a very ripe finish.
Name: Brega 2015 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe, dark blackberry aromas border on prune. A fleshy, full palate offers layering and tannic structure, while this old vines Garnacha tastes toasty and heavily oaked, with blackberry flavors resting comfortably under a woody blanket. Coffee, chocolate and tobacco flavors are ramped up on a hot finish.
Name: Ignacio Marín 2015 Old Vines Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Barossa, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine offers a perfumed nose of ripe strawberry, cherry and blueberry fruit, with additional notes of herbs and black peppery. The palate brings bright fruit backed by soft, sandy tannins.
Name: Thistledown 2016 Thorny Devil Old Vine Grenache (Barossa)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Exotic aromas of cranberry, Luxardo cherry, star anise and white sage are fairly rich on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with smoke and tannins, offering flavors of tangy red plum and tart raspberry that ride a sizzling acidity.
Name: Scratch 2014 Ventana Vineyards Grenache (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Fruity complexity in the flavors and a firm but velvety texture make this full-bodied wine very appealing and interesting. It starts with red-cherry and cranberry aromas then brings in darker deeper cherries on the palate.
Name: Ledson 2016 Ricetti Lane Grenache (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine is lively, well-balanced and complex in flavor, showing fresh raspberry and cranberry notes backed by light spicy oak nuances and framed by firm tannins.
Name: Graziano 2014 Grenache (Mendocino)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy and detailed, the mix of cranberry, pomegranate and raspberry fruit carries this wine through a firm, medium-bodied finish. Just a hint of pepper adds further interest.
Name: Jaxon 2016 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intense aromas of cherry cola and rosewater meet with crumbled sage and vanilla cookie on the nose of this bottling. It's quite light and even a tad thin on the palate, yet the flavors are bursting with cherry and roasted strawberry.
Name: Chamisal Vineyards 2015 Califa Grenache (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Lightly floral and airy raspberry and red currant aromas are slightly leathery. Typical of Garnacha from Aragón, this feels round and jammy. Candied red fruit flavors are steady on the finish, and overall this shows Garnacha in a fresh and flowery way.
Name: Xucrogas 2014 Her Essential Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Alicante, this has aromas of red-skinned berry, baking spice and tilled soil. The straightforward palate offers cranberry, white pepper and clove alongside round tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Tommasi 2015 Alicante (Toscana)

Appellation: Spain, Spain Other, Spain
Description: Leather and spiced berry aromas are capped and jammy. In the mouth, this high-alcohol Garnacha feels soft and somewhat flat, not a surprise given its 16.5% declared weight. Chocolaty blackberry flavors also taste of clove and bacon on a syrupy finish.
Name: Pallas 2014 Reserve Old Vines Garnacha (Spain)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine offers a pile of ripe cherry fruit and florals on the nose. The palate is medium-bodied and lush, dominated by juicy fruit, but with a savory edge that creeps in on the finish. This is nothing overly complex, but easy to like.
Name: An Approach to Relaxation 2016 Sucette Grenache (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: America, US
Description: Aromas of black pepper, green tobacco, black cherry and raspberry mix with a hint of violet. It is juicy on the palate, with a cranberry flavor alongside tingling acidity and sandy tannins. Flavors of cinnamon and cedar mark the finish.
Name: Vara NV Tinto Especial Lot #014 Garnacha (America)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: After some swirling, this wine reveals aromas of ripe red berries, florals and pepper, along with notes of green bell pepper and oak spice. On the palate, there's a nice grip of smooth, savory tannins and a decent lick of acidity, but the fruit is a touch sour and the finish is short.
Name: Cirillo 2016 The Vincent Grenache (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This remarkable wine impresses in quality and price, made in tiny amounts but well worth seeking. A bright, earthy entry of wild strawberry and raspberry fill the full-bodied palate that's grippy in tension and powerful in weight.
Name: Thirty-Seven 2015 Grenache (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: As light in color as a Pinot Noir, this nonetheless delivers potent flavors of red and blue plum. There's an almost foxy character to the flavor, and a luscious finish loaded with sweet tobacco and baking spices.
Name: Cowhorn 2015 Grenache 53 Grenache (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Rasteau, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Made entirely from Grenache, the Fleur de Confiance offers luscious mulberry and black-currant flavors muted by notes of crushed stone and dried herb. It's bold and silky yet held upright by ripe, persistent tannins. This decadent yet freshly composed wine should improve through 2026.
Name: Domaine la Soumade 2016 Cuvée Fleur de Confiance Grenache (Rasteau)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fairly light in the glass, this single-vineyard expression offers aromas of candied cherry, caramel and hickory smoke on the nose. It's light in body but with immense amounts of tannic tension, showing flavors of smoked cherry, savory roasted pork and cranberry sauce on the palate.
Name: Saarloos & Sons 2015 Broer Windmill Ranch Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Fountaingrove District, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is the first vintage of this wine, and it was made in minuscule amounts. It opens awash in fresh strawberry, white pepper, citrus and flowers, aromatically inviting and fruity. A touch of grit and oak provides backbone amidst a textured, balanced palate of great beauty.
Name: Sheldon 2017 Luc's Vineyard Grenache (Fountaingrove District)

Appellation: Gigondas, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Luscious describes this rich, palate-clinging Grenache. Black cherry and mulberry flavors are lavishly ripe but pristine, accented by sweet spice and chocolate. It's full bodied and unctuous yet freshly composed, fringed with fine, feathery tannins. Enjoy this forward but elegant wine now through 2025.
Name: Arnoux & Fils 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Gigondas)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cola and Dr. Pepper aromas meet with dark plum and black cherry on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The intense Dr. Pepper flavors also show on the palate, where tense tannins also deliver floral flavors of lilac and rosewater. It's quite an intriguing and full sip.
Name: Bolt To Wines 2016 Sidekick by Karin Langer Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Châteauneuf-du-Pape, Rhône Valley, France
Description: A slight bricking on the hue and savory notes of barley, earth and dried herbs suggest maturity in this late-release wine tasted six years after bottling. Black-cherry and raspberry flavors are still concentrated but elegantly muted by earth tones. It's a stately wine, with a silky, mouthwatering palate. Although it drinks well now, it should hold till 2022.
Name: La Célestière 2012 La Croze Grenache (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a classic version of the variety, the grapes grown at the Four Brothers Vineyard (winemaker Mike Sullivan is among the brothers). Smoky tar, oak and tannin grip a softly layered, structured mingling of lavender, white pepper, strawberry and leather.
Name: Benovia 2015 Grenache (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This carbonically fermented bottling shows plenty of herbal kick to the nose (from sagebrush to wild thyme), which is set against the light, tart red-fruit aromas. The palate is framed by a cranberry and cherry backdrop that allows the herbaceous side to shine, from potpourri to tea leaves. This is a great food wine.
Name: Saarloos & Sons 2014 O.G. Windmill Ranch Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: Tightly wound in its youth, this wine is rich and full bodied, with a baked quality to the wild strawberry and black cherry. Meaty and syrupy in thickness, it is layered and voluptuous, with finishing touches of meat and white pepper.
Name: Lampyridae 2017 Grenache (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Rasteau, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Ripe black-cherry and plum notes are shaded by licorice and cacao in this lavishly styled Grenache. It's a forward, richly concentrated wine with bold tones of vanilla and anise. Robust and mouthfilling, it offers a chalky but densely gripping finish.
Name: Domaine Fond Croze 2016 Le Haut Plateau Grenache (Rasteau)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fruity and robust, this big-boned, ripe varietal wine is softly layered in baked strawberry, vanilla and cola. The oak is supportive and smoky.
Name: Kokomo 2016 Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Smooth, fragrant and utterly delicious, this opens with heady aromas of vineyard dust, blue flower and wild berry. The savory juicy palate doles out succulent Marasca cherry, blackberry, baking spice, star anise and Mediterranean herb alongside lithe polished tannins. It's not complex, but it's silky and chock-full of flavor.
Name: Mora & Memo 2017 Nau  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This delicious, polished red shows more body and structure than most wines made with Cannonau. It opens with inviting aromas of wild red berry, Mediterranean brush and ground pepper that follow over to the savory juicy palate along with clove and a savory hint of saline. Smooth tannins provide lithe support.
Name: Vigne Surrau 2015 Sincaru Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Mouthwatering aromas of ripe wild berry, dark baking spice, Mediterranean scrub and a whiff of sea breeze shape the nose on this inviting red. Smooth and full bodied, the juicy palate doles out raspberry compote, ripe strawberry, clove and ground pepper alongside polished fine-grained tannins.
Name: Argiolas 2014 Senes Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Grenache is elegant and light, starting with aromas of rose hips, hibiscus extract and rooibos tea. The palate is energized, tense and quite quaffable, with plummy fruit-punch flavors that are lifted by star anise and other baking spices.
Name: Margerum 2016 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted red and black cherries meet with hickory and nutmeg on the rich nose of this bottling, which is given color and depth thank to 10% Petite Sirah. A chalky mouthfeel carries flavors of rich red cherry, framed by tense tannins and decent acidity.
Name: Sculpterra 2015 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rarely is Grenache the best grape to lay down in the cellar, but this bottling has the bones and pedigree to qualify. Plump berry, cherry and red-currant fruits have a floral edge on the nose, while the palate is very grippy with tannins that hold the sumac and tart cherry flavors tightly. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Jaffurs 2016 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: You'll find aromas of wild red berry, dark spice, leather and a light whiff of game in this juicy red. The savory, supple palate doles out crushed raspberry, ripe strawberry, baking spice and just hint of salted game alongside lithe tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Sella & Mosca 2015 Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Clare Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This pale, nearly translucent wine, which could almost be mistaken for a rosé, takes Grenache to the far opposite end of the spectrum. Aromas of rose water, strawberry juice and touches of meat and white pepper lead gently into a softly-textured palate of ripe but still delicate fruit and florals. Drink chilled on its own or with a cheese and fruit platter.
Name: Koerner 2017 Cannonau Grenache (Clare Valley)

Appellation: Vinos de Madrid, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Fresh berry and plum aromas are lightly spiced. This Garnacha comes from the high-elevation Gredos Mountains, and it's rubbery, powerful and grinding on the palate, so food will be of great help. Slightly medicinal red plum and cherry flavors show modest oak spice prior to an edgy but long finish. This is an intense wine from interior Spain with a lot to offer.
Name: Las Moradas de San Martín 2014 Senda Garnacha (Vinos de Madrid)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A dance between tangy acidity and a creamy texture plays out wonderfully in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It offers fresh citrus aromas and generous apple and honeydew melon flavors while the mouthfeel is broad and smooth.
Name: Binz 2017 White Grenache (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Scorched earth, underbrush, leather, Mediterranean scrub and mature black-skinned berry aromas lead the nose. The full-bodied palate offers dried Marasca cherry, prune, clove and a hint of espresso set against fine-grained tannins.
Name: Siddura 2015 Fòla  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of wild herb, Mediterranean scrub, prune and leather slowly take shape in the glass. The round full-bodied palate offers black cherry marinated in spirits, licorice and a hint of game alongside velvety tannins. It closes on a saline note. Drink through 2022.
Name: Vigneti Zanatta 2014 Tararà Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine offers a summer fruit salad of blueberries, watermelons and strawberries beneath a cherry blossom note. Thanks to bright acidity it's also fresh, juicy and light on its feet, wound with lithe tannins to keep it from veering into flabby territory.
Name: Tim Smith 2017 Grenache (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Wild berry, clove and graphite aromas lead the nose on this easy-drinking, plump red. It's polished and savory, offering crushed raspberry, strawberry compote and white pepper. Rounded tannins provide light support.
Name: Vigne Surrau 2016 Sincaru  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of three properties from up and down the Central Coast (64% Rancho Solo, 24% Alta Loma and 12% Shokrian vineyards) is a bit gamy at first, but the red fruit and flower aromas emerge from the reductive veil with time. The palate offers flavors of roasted pork in a red-plum sauce, with a touch of oak.
Name: Bonny Doon 2016 Grenache (Monterey County)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Pale rose in color, this is a light, aromatic version of South Aussie Grenache, swimming in tones of ripe red cherries, strawberries, rose petals and cinnamon. The light-bodied palate offers an earthy core and soft, rounded tannins for structure, with juicy fruit and salt running from start to finish.
Name: Geyer 2017 Sands Grenache (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of red berry, Marasca cherry and ground pepper follow over to the juicy easygoing palate. Smooth tannins lend gentle support.
Name: Mesa 2016 Primo Scuro  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Barossa, South Australia, Australia
Description: Pale strawberry-hued, this wine flutters in tones of bright cherry, raspberry, florals, cracked pepper and allspice. The palate is silky in feel, with crunchy fruit and a decent streak of acidity.
Name: Running with Bulls 2017 Garnacha (Barossa)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of wild red berry, Mediterranean brush and a hint of baking spice. The soft straightforward palate offers juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry and a hint of white pepper alongside round smooth tannins. Drink over the next few years.
Name: F.lli Puddu 2014 Nepente di Oliena Carros Classico  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: La Mancha, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Baked, earthy black fruit aromas come with a heavy topping of cola and root beer scents. Old-vine Garnacha in a warm, dry year like 2015 equals weight and aggressive tannins on the palate. Pulpy blackberry, salt and toast flavors finish chocolaty, with clawing dryness.
Name: Familia Bastida 2015 Paraje de Tito Garnacha (La Mancha)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This fragrant red offers enticing scents of eucalyptus, mature black-skinned berry, Mediterranean brush and carob. On the full-bodied, chewy palate, velvety tannins wrap around blackberry, prune and licorice. You'll also notice the warmth of evident alcohol before the dusty drying finish.
Name: Ferruccio Deiana 2015 Sileno Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark red-cherry, boysenberry and rosebud aromas make for a deep and expressive style of Grenache on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong herbal touch to the palate, where thyme, sagebrush and cinnamon meet with snappy black-raspberry flavors.
Name: Figge 2016 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Prune, exotic spice and Mediterranean-scrub aromas lift out of the glass. The rounded palate is rather evolved, evoking dried cherry, blueberry and clove alongside dusty tannins that leave a drying close.
Name: Gabbas 2013 Arborè  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, fermented in amphora and aged in both French and Slavonian oak barrels, this opens with aromas of French oak, coconut, exotic spice and plum. Smooth and chewy, the full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean alongside rather close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.
Name: Olianas 2015 Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of red and black raspberry, cigar box, mandarin orange, dried herb, flower, white pepper and gummy bear are followed by light, soft, red fruit flavors. It has a pretty, elegant styling, with a lingering finish.
Name: Palencia 2016 Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This opens with earthy aromas of scorched soil, leather, game and a whiff of barnyard. The aromas carry over to the juicy palate along with fleshy black cherry and clove while rounded tannins offer gentle support before it closes on a drying note. It has a rustic charm but is full of personality.
Name: Pala 2015 Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of pomegranate and cherry meet with licorice on the nose of this bottling. Cola-spice and strawberry-juice flavors make for a pleasant fruit-punch-like sipping experience.
Name: Europa Village 2015 Bolero Cellars Garnacha (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This rounded red opens with subtle aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, scorched earth and a whiff of grilled herb. The straightforward palate reflects the nose, offering black cherry, white pepper and a hint of clove alongside light loose tannins before a rather dusty close.
Name: Pala 2017 I Fiori  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Wild berry, violet and Mediterranean-brush aromas shape the nose. The smooth easygoing palate offers dried cherry steeped in spirits, clove and ground pepper alongside polished tannins. Drink soon to capture the fruit richness.
Name: Ledda 2015 Tenuta Monte Santu Ceràsa  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Spain, Spain Other, Spain
Description: Up front, this Garnacha is challenging; the aromas are reedy and oddly citric. In the mouth, this is much fuller and fatter, with chunky weight that collapses the palate a bit. Flavors of minty berry fruits finish chewy and gummy. This is a nonvintage wine with no specific regionality noted on the label.
Name: Lo-ve 5 NV GRN 5 Garnacha (Spain)

Appellation: Valencia, Levante, Spain
Description: Dry spice, bacon, rubber and red fruit aromas comprise the nose on this tight, prodding Garnacha with bright acidity. Red plum and pomegranate flavors finish with a note of salt on a long finish with raspberry shadings.
Name: Rafael Cambra 2014 Soplo Garnacha (Valencia)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This easygoing red has aromas of wild red berry and baking spice. The aromas carry over to the bright rounded palate alongside soft tannins. It's made to be enjoyed young so drink soon.
Name: Cantina Santa Maddalena 2017 Le Bombarde  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of wild red berry, exotic spice and a whiff of sea breeze lift out of the glass. The somewhat lean-bodied, straightforward palate reflects the nose, offering strawberry compote, white pepper and a hint of saline alongside rather fleeting but dusty tannins that leave a drying finish.
Name: Cantina Pedres 2016 Cerasio  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of crushed mint, grilled mushroom, vanilla and a whiff of cellar floor lead the nose. The palate evokes raspberry, oak-driven spice and a hint of coffee alongside close-grained if rather fleeting tannins that leave a dry dusty finish.
Name: Gabbas 2014 Dule  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of wild berry, dark spice, leather and a whiff of farmyard lead the nose. The easygoing if slightly rustic palate reflects the nose, evoking raspberry, game and clove alongside pliant, rather fleeting tannins.
Name: Vigneti Zanatta 2016 Salana  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Spain, Spain Other, Spain
Description: Gritty red-berry aromas announce a Garnacha that's not overly ripe and definitely not heavy or jammy. A lean palate is slightly raw, acidic and tannic, while this tastes of red currant and plum. Hard tannins circle back on a finish with mild heat.
Name: Altovinum 2016 Evodia Garnacha (Spain)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals aromas of dark-skinned fruit and cake spice. The buffed, smooth palate offers dried cherry and star anise while soft tannins offer light support. Drink soon.
Name: Mandrolisai 2014 Kent'Annos  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This fragrant rounded red has aromas of fleshy red berry and baking spice. On the straightforward palate, soft tannins lend light support to juicy red cherry, raspberry and clove.
Name: Nuraghe Crabioni 2016  Cannonau di Sardegna

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine hails from a new growing region near Lake Chelan referred to as Rocky Reach. The aromas offer notes of raspberry, pencil eraser, fresh tobacco, herb, strawberry and cherry gummy bear. The palate is elegant, with the concentration seeming a bit light. Tart acidity provides the frame. It's interesting but doesn't all come off.
Name: Rocky Pond 2016 Double D Vineyard Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of exotic spice, leather, Mediterranean herb and a whiff of tar shape the nose. The densely concentrated and evolved palate offers dried black cherry and incense but is dominated by the heat of extremely evident alcohol. Close-grained but fleeting tannins dry out the finish.
Name: F.lli Puddu 2011 Pro Vois  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of new leather, pressed violet, overripe black-skinned fruit and a whiff of barnyard lead the nose. Boasting a rustic charm, the earthy aromas follow over to the no-frills palate along with raspberry jam and light, rather dusty tannins.
Name: F.lli Puddu 2016 Nepente di Oliena Tiscali  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This über-simple red has aromas and flavors of raspberry, strawberry and a hint of white pepper. It's easygoing, with light fleeting tannins. Drink now.
Name: Gabbas 2016 Lillovè  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Spain, Spain Other, Spain
Description: Cooked, raisiny aromas signal a wine of low quality. A heavy, plodding palate seconds that motion. Matching the nose, this boxed Garnacha tastes much like prune juice.
Name: Breca 2016 Zabrin Garnacha (Spain)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is nervy in a good way, showing good acidity to match generous alcohol and a fine mixture of complex aromas and flavors ranging from mineral and dried herb to cherry, iron and beef juices. The color is in the natural lighter end of the garnet range, the aromas bring a wide variety of nuances, and the fruity threads weave in and out of savory ones on the palate and finish.
Name: Amador Cellars 2015 Estate Reserve Grenache Noir (Amador County)

Appellation: Gigondas, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Dripping with sun-drenched blueberry and plum flavors, La Colline is Bosquets' expression of pure Grenache. It's a fleshy, opulent wine marked by earthen tones of crushed clay and smoked herb and a delightfully clingy texture. Its soft tannins and juicy constitution make it ready to drink now, but it should gain depth well through 2028.
Name: Domaine des Bosquets 2016 La Colline  (Gigondas)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright and radiant aromas of cherry, strawberry and raspberry meet with rose petals, spice cake and a touch of bubblegum on the nose of this bottling by winemaker Angela Osborne. There is firm structure to the palate at first, then comes tart cherry and hibiscus flavors—altogether quite refreshing.
Name: Folded Hills 2015 Grant Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black raspberry, red plum candy and a hint of hibiscus show on the nose of this bottling from a new winery owned by Andy Busch of the Anheuser-Busch family. There are intense streaks of red flowers and rosewater on the palate, alongside notes of plum and cinnamon.
Name: Folded Hills 2016 Grant Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Vacqueyras, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Fragrant whiffs of black-tea leaf, bramble and sandalwood accent this opulent Grenache. It's intensely fruity, offering generous layers of ripe black plum and cherry flavors. Fresh acidity and fine, integrated tannins lead a long, supple finish. An open-knit yet complex wine to enjoy now–2028.
Name: Domaine de la Charbonnière 2015 Cuvée Spéciale Grenache (Vacqueyras)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Plummy and generous on the nose, and equally rich and expansive on the palate, this wine is smoothly textured and full bodied. Light tannins add a little grip to the plush sensations of black plums, strawberries and a dash of dried herbs.
Name: Lava Cap 2016 Estate Bottled Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Vacqueyras, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Made from 100% Grenache sourced from vines averaging 75 years in age, this is a richly textured yet vibrant biodynamic wine. Black raspberry and strawberry preserve flavors are concentrated on the palate, accented by hits of crushed violet and earth. The finish is long, marked by very fine but persistent tannins. Enjoy now–2028.
Name: Domaine la Ligière 2015 Cuvée Point G Grenache (Vacqueyras)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A pretty and clean color of pink, this Grenache-based rosé by Josh Phelps shows fresh aromas of strawberry, watermelon, wet stone and pink blossoms. The palate's light cherry flavors are offset by just enough textural tension.
Name: Grounded Wine Co. 2017 Space Age Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a bold full-bodied wine that's well oaked and has plenty of black-fruit flavors too. Firm tannins support ripe black-cherry and blueberry flavors while tempting baking spices and wood-smoke accents add extra interest. It's made from 79% Grenache and 21% Syrah.
Name: Prospect 772 2015 The Brat Grenache (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated aromas of pomegranate and cherry meet with more complex aromas of crushed rocks and wet wood on the nose of this estate bottling. There is brightness and lightness to the elegant palate, where rose, hibiscus, red fruit and cedar flavors intermingle.
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Estate Grenache (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is intense color and even a dark-chocolate kick on the nose of this bottling, along with more usual aromas of baked berry, plum jam and clove. The tannins are a tad sticky on the sip, carrying boysenberry flavors and plentiful acidity.
Name: Balderdash 2013 Trademark Red Grenache (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Lean and appetizing in character, this medium- to full-bodied wine blends mild raspberry and forest-floor aromas with meaty, slightly peppery flavors. It has a tangy texture that leaves a clean aftertaste.
Name: Townley 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Grenache (Mendocino)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A beautiful shade of light purple in the glass, this first estate bottling off of this new property in the southwest corner of the appellation shows red currant, cherry and star anise on the nose. The palate starts with tangy black-raspberry fruit, but the focus is the compelling tannic tension and bright acid.
Name: Folded Hills 2016 Estate Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright aromas of pomegranate, raspberry sorbet, ripe cherry, rosewater candy and vanilla show on the fresh yet luxurious nose of this bottling. It's light in feel, with a tense in structure that carries flavors of strawberry, cinnamon and dried ginger.
Name: Croma Vera 2016 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark cherry and boysenberry aromas meet with a hint of anise on the nose of this bottling from Paso Robles' Westside. Flavors of strawberry compote and boysenberry paste are lifted by clove and gingerbread on the rich palate.
Name: Dunning Vineyards 2015 Reserve Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from Boushey, Olsen and Sagemoor vineyards. The aromas pop, with appealing notes of raspberry, smoked meat, herb, white pepper, potpourri and mountain blueberry. Textured, swoon-worthy blue fruit and savory flavors follow and persist through the lingering finish. It's a thoroughly captivating wine, with a lovely sense of freshness.
Name: Sparkman 2016 Wonderland Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The winery has dropped “Barrel Select” from the label, but this remains a barrel selection. In 2015 the finished wine pushes hard against 15% alcohol, and it's fully ripened and then some, with deep plum and black cherry fruits at the core. The tannins bring black tea, smoke and tobacco notes, with a strongly astringent aftertaste.
Name: Abacela 2015 Garnacha (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine is bursting with ripe, almost confected plummy fruit, banana candies and vanilla. There's a decent lick of acidity and a fine line of chalky tannins to balance all that abundant fruit.
Name: Dandelion 2014 Menagerie of the Barossa Red (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: From 80-year-old vines in the Blewitt Springs subregion of McLaren Vale, this Grenache ambles along unassumingly on the nose. Likable notes of blueberry, rhubarb, cherry cola and vanilla are in the driver's seat. But the palate shifts things into high gear, with full throttle tannins that lasso your tongue into submission. A juicy, umami tang sneaks back in on the finish, making it easier to take another sip.
Name: Blackbilly 2013 Old Vine Single Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: From 80-year-old Grenache vines (with a touch of Tempranillo), this supple, juicy wine is a crowd-pleaser, if not as multifaceted as one would hope from old vines and five years of age. Nevertheless, it's bursting with ripe red berries, watermelon and vanilla notes, along with a soft-sided palate and gentle, slightly savory tannins. Drink now.
Name: Woodstock 2013 The Octogenarian Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Montsant, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Ripe berry and plum aromas are thick and a bit strained. On the palate, this Grenache is tannic and rubbery in feel. Baked berry and raisin flavors show a chocolaty richness on the finish. Overall, this is mostly good but a little lacking in top-to-bottom balance.
Name: Cellers Unió 2016 Perlat Garnatxa (Montsant)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite showing on the nose, this Grenache-based rosé offers strong aromas of passion fruit, orange and guava juice. It tightens a bit on the sip, but that tropical-juice combo remains, proving very flavorful and likable for those seeking a pink wine with clout.
Name: J. Lohr 2017 Gesture Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Woody aromas meet with primary dark-berry fruits and grape seed on the nose of this bottling. It's rather floral on the palate and offers very ripe berry fruits, yet is cut with strong acidity as well.
Name: Alara 2016 Grenache (Central Coast)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gritty plum and raspberry aromas suggest asphalt. In the mouth, this is mild, fresh and highly basic in structure and feel. Plum and raspberry aromas are floral, while this is fleshy on a simple finish.
Name: Campo Viejo 2016  Rioja

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Medicinal, rubbery berry aromas require airing to settle. In the mouth, this Rioja Garnacha is plump and round but with only medium-level concentration. A rubbery flavor is attached to plum and berry notes, while this is standard on the finish.
Name: Rafael Cambra 2016 Mateo Cambra  (Rioja)

Appellation: Priorat, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Rubbery aromas of latex and sulfur give way to jumpy red-berry and animal notes. A jammy sappy palate requires airing to show its best, while this varietal Garnatxa tastes of herbal raspberry and red plum. A rubbery grating finish fits the overall package.
Name: Scala Dei 2016 Garnatxa (Priorat)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Considering Grenache's soft and cuddly reputation, this rendition is rather hard-edged. The variety's characteristic ripe berry and white pepper combo is there, accompanied by a little meat and flower stalks, but there's an unexpected bite to the acidity, that, when combined with the tight, drying tannins, make taking another sip a challenge.
Name: D'Arenberg 2014 The Custodian Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Baked, earthy berry aromas are cooked and nutty, not fresh. A palate with heft is awkward and a bit out of balance, while this Garnacha tastes of roasted berry fruits and burnt wood. Lingering oak spice is the most notable flavor on a heavy finish.
Name: Magister Bibendi 2014 Navarrsotillo Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Stewy tomato and raisin aromas open this Garnacha. A plump sappy palate is jammy as a whole, while this tastes of cooked plum and canned tomatoes. A finish without much depth or length closes out this marginal wine.
Name: Burgo Viejo 2016  Rioja

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of raisin and lactic oak announce a baked-out Garnacha. A thick chunky palate is not a surprise given the nose, while this is quite oaky, with gamy black-fruit flavors. A stewed character and lemony oak control a heavy finish.
Name: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2013 Anayón Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of peanut butter, stale almonds, murky earth and burnt fruits amount to a messy whole. On the palate, this is chunky and short on balance. Flavors of burnt wood, barbecued pork and black fruits finish with clove and campfire notes.
Name: Pagos del Moncayo 2016 Prados Colección Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: The fiery burn of oak is the aromatic greeting on this sticky, syrupy Garnacha that's flat as Kansas across the palate. Baked stewy black-fruit flavors remain soft and saturated on the finish. This is the epitome of an overdone wine with glaring balance problems.
Name: Bodegas San Valero 2014 Particular Viñas Centenarias Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rather light in color, this bottling shows candied-cherry, alpine strawberry, sumac, rose-petal and baking-spice aromas on the fresh nose. The palate offers red plum, star anise and allspice flavors, proving pleasantly light, refreshing and extremely layered.
Name: Koehler 2015 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Sophisticated in flavor and extremely smooth in texture, this high-elevation wine is easy to enjoy while also offering interesting nuances of fig and black pepper in the aroma, and plump plum and raspberry on the palate. It's another excellent wine from the very consistent Cedarville property.
Name: Cedarville 2015 Estate Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A rusty red color in the glass, this light but layered bottling shows dried cherry, pomegranate, carnation, hibiscus, cinnamon and vanilla-dusted toast on the nose. There is a strong grip to the palate, where flavors center on rose petal and Montmorency cherry, proving quite firm and yet delicate.
Name: Folded Hills 2015 Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From 44-year-old Grenache vines, this old vine rosé is a unique idea, and works quite well. Crisp aromas of strawberry, chalk and flint show much minerality. The palate is very textural, showing wet gravel and steely flavors with the lightest flash of red fruit.
Name: Malene 2017 Old Vine Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated aromas of boysenberry and black cherry meet with hints of game, jerky and cola on the nose of this bottling. Fairly ripe and rich blackberry-sauce flavors are lifted by anise on the palate, which is framed by balanced acid and tannins and makes for a fairly easy-drinking wine.
Name: Dusty Nabor 2016 Paper Plane Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated red-cherry aromas meet with sweet wood oil to offer a pleasant entry to this bottling. There are eucalyptus and pine-oil flavors drizzled across the palate, where dark elderberry fruits dominate.
Name: Epiphany 2015 Rodney's Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Very smooth, ripe and grapey, this is an exuberant wine packed with plum, strawberry and cinnamon flavors. It is full bodied but very low in tannins, so the palate impression is soothing and soft. The winemaker blended in 12% Syrah and 8% Petite Sirah, and a portion of the grapes was air dried on racks before fermentation.
Name: Prima Materia 2014 Grenache (Lake County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Art den Hoed and Upland vineyards. Light in color, the aromas suggest notes of raspberry candy along with herb accents. There's a pretty sense of purity to the raspberry-jam flavors that persist on the warm finish.
Name: The Orcas Project 2016 Garnacha (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smoky fiery aromas of black plum and berry fruits mixed with a hint of vinegar lead to a raw, rugged and grabby palate. Blackberry and blueberry flavors show a fair amount of oak, while heavy spice flavors along with heat and burn dominate the finish.
Name: Bodegas la Casa de Lúculo 2016 Lúculo Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very light cherry and berry aromas are followed by mild fruit flavors and a slightly gripping texture in this medium-boded wine. It is delicate and restrained, with very good acidity and more taut balance than most examples.
Name: Skinner 2016 Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Red-berry aromas are basic but fresh, with minimal concentration. A plump juicy palate ranks as healthy, while raspberry and red-plum flavors are not too serious or intense. A fresh steady finish wraps up this pulpy Garnacha.
Name: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Direct and straightforward, yet clean and easy to like, this bottling leads with bright red and black cherry, raspberry and boysenberry aromas. A hint of Asian spice adds depth, while the medium-weight palate offers additional hints of sweet cherry and raspberry sauce.
Name: Combe D'Argent 2017 Vieilles Vignes Grenache (Vin de France)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raw choppy aromas of berry fruits are lean and rough-edged. This Garnacha feels racy and fresh, but light on structure. Plum and berry flavors are short and lack stuffing, while this is juicy and popping on the finish.
Name: Castillo de Monséran 2016 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: High-toned cherry and plum aromas are aggressive, as is a lean palate. Plum and cranberry flavors are firmly in the red, while this Garnacha offers side notes of peppery spice. This is juicy and spunky more than dark and heavy.
Name: Príncipe de Viana 2016 Roble Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine has assertive smoky oaky aromas and flavors that nearly overwhelm the jammy fruit flavors underneath. The roasted toasted character gives a little spine to the otherwise soft impression on the palate.
Name: Andis 2015 Grenache (Amador County)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Solid red fruits, cherry-pie filling, cinnamon and carnation dance in the nose of this bottling. The palate shows a bit more herbal, stemmy presence, with medium tannins that lend support to the cherry-dominant fruit profile.
Name: Florent Descombe NV Grenache (Vin de France)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Scratchy plum and berry aromas are a bit gummy. A jammy palate with strawberry and raspberry flavors shows off the fruity red side of Garnacha, while a raspberry flavor lingers on a finish with mild heat and burn.
Name: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2016 El Circo Acróbata Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Stewy aromas of raisin and prune include a warm note of leather. This Garnacha feels tannic and jammy. Flavors of raisin, blackberry and loud oak finish soft and jammy, with little to no structure.
Name: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2016 Menguante Selección Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
