Description: Cheesy aromas dominate the nose on this flat rubbery-feeling Garnacha. Gritty berry-fruit flavors are a bit weedy, while this is lifeless on the finish.
Name: Vega del Castillo 2016 Señorío de Aldaz Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cooked aromas of raisin open this flabby Garnacha. Stewed berry flavors along with clove and nutmeg notes don't amount to anything serious, while this tastes like spongy spice cake and exhibits almost no tannic grip on the finish.
Name: Lelia 2016 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Chalone, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light rosewater, strawberry and cherry-juice aromas meet with rounded star anise and baking spice on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is great chalky tension to the palate and a ripping acidity, framing flavors of red fruit, orange rind and, on the finish, vanilla paste.
Name: Betwixt 2016 Boer Vineyard Grenache (Chalone)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Textured acidity contrasts well against this wine's backdrop of lushly round body and a ripeness of cherry and strawberry fruit. A floral element of rose and lavender adds complexity and a beguiling quality to the nose.
Name: Kobler 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from the new Spear Vineyards is fresh and lightweight but lovely and flavorful, starting with a nose loaded in red-cherry, vanilla and star anise aromas. The refreshing palate, which can benefit from a slight chill, offers pomegranate, orange rind and a botanical twist of lemon verbena.
Name: Kings Carey 2016 Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is loaded on the nose with dried hibiscus, pomegranate, rose petals, leather and slate aromas. Cinnamon, sumac and rose flavors are strong on the light, bright and tight palate, giving depth to the raspberry and white-pepper backdrop.
Name: Lumen 2015 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lively aromas of sumac, cinnamon, hibiscus, plum, lavender and turned earth make for a very compelling, layered and sexy entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate shows more restraint, with rosewater, tangy red-plum skins and tart pomegranate flavors, wrapped in taut tannins.
Name: Stephen Ross 2015 Bee Sweet Vineyard Grenache (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 9% Syrah and 1% Viognier, this wine tastes of strawberry compote, violet and rose—floral and enticing with its robust backbone of clove and leather. Smoothly textured, it's a joy to drink, and a fine pairing with charcuterie and grilled meats.
Name: Hudson Vineyards 2016 Pick Up Sticks Estate Grown Grenache (Carneros)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented 100% whole cluster from the winery's young estate vineyard, the aromas bring notes of brown stem, dried tobacco, green herb, flower and raspberry. The flavors are light but juicy with a long lingering finish. The stem influence is very primary at present. Give it time in bottle or a long decant to let it settle in.
Name: K Vintners 2015 The Boy Powerline Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Earthy in wild strawberry and blueberry, this intense, ripe and fruity wine is nonetheless balanced in bright lifted acidity that persists and refreshes. Tightly wound, the texture is layered and complex.
Name: Chiron Wines 2015 Unfamiliar Truth Grenache (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine hails from a vineyard on the Royal Slope. Light in color, the aromas are light and elusive, with notes of cigar box, white pepper and spice. The palate is transparent in style, with elegant strawberry flavors. One wants more aromatically, but the palate delivers.
Name: Alleromb 2015 Corfu Crossing Vineyard Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light but candied aromas of cherry syrup, carnations and a touch of sweet sage show on the nose of this appellation blend. A grippy texture grabs the palate, and delivers flavors of red flowers, pine sap, dried herbs and red fruit.
Name: Zinke 2015 Grenache (Central Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tart elements of cranberry, red cherry and dust form around a thick, layered core of richness on the midpalate and smoothly etched tannins with just a hint of grip. Candied cinnamon lingers on the finish.
Name: Saxon Brown 2015 El Diablo Vineyard Grenache (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Taut and tannic on the nose, this bottling, which includes 2% Mondeuse, offers red-plum skins, rosewater and strong hibiscus notes on the nose. The palate is straightforward and likable, with more plum, hibiscus and rose, framed by fresh acidity and decent tannins.
Name: Jamie Slone Wines 2016 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly stewed aromas of red-cherry syrup meet with gravel and wet earth on the nose of this bottling. Baked cherry flavors are paired with vanilla and gingersnaps on the palate, where the acidity steadily rises.
Name: Grey Wolf Cellars 2015 Instinctual Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: One of three different 2017 rosés from Quady North, this is a low-alcohol, pale-copper-colored wine, that appears deceptively light. Yet in fact, it's packed with flavor and displays a rich, rounded mouthfeel with a winning combination of mixed flowers, herbs and tangy cherry. The ample acidity adds a blood-orange vein to the mix.
Name: Quady North 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The name comes from the concrete tanks used to ferment the wine, with the fruit coming from River Rock Vineyard in the Rocks District. Quite pale in color, initially subdued aromas of raspberry candy, tangerine peel and herb are followed by soft palate-coating red-fruit flavors. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.
Name: The Walls 2016 Concrete Mama Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Extremely pale in color with an orange tinge, the aromas pop with notes of raspberry, stem, smoked meat and white pepper. The palate is lighter styled, putting an emphasis on elegance and not fully delivering on the aroma's promise. Smoked-meat notes linger on the finish.
Name: Block Wines 2016 Boushey Vineyard Golden Block Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite light in color, the aromas exude notes of raspberry, moist earth, juniper berry, blue fruit and tangerine peel. The palate brings a sense of texture and elegance, putting a premium on purity, with lighter-styled fruit flavors. It shows the variety's more graceful side.
Name: Kerloo 2016 Upland Vineyard Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is quite floral on the nose, but there are also strong aromas of juicy red fruits and a pinch of pepper. Tangy black-plum and dark-blackberry flavors show on the sip, where the tannins are still rather stiff.
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Grenache (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Freshly pressed morello cherry, dried red flowers, rust and a hint of brown sugar show on the nose of this bottling. It's straight-ahead on the palate with clean red-cherry flavors, lifted by a touch of sandalwood.
Name: MCV 2016 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A darker shade of pretty pink, this bottling offers aromas of roasted plum, wet cement and lemon balm. It's fairly juicy on the sip, where berry and cherry flavors are clean and set against a chalky texture.
Name: Koehler 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cranberry, raspberry, vanilla and baking spice lead to concentrated flavors that show a mixture of fruit and barrel. There are good things going on but the oak seems quite heavy handed, overrunning the variety.
Name: Novelty Hill 2015 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Both the candied-red-cherry and warm baking-spice notes make for a very welcoming nose on this bottling. The palate is a bit light and framed by rough tannins, showing flavors of smoke, cinnamon and red fruit.
Name: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Purple Rain Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter in color, aromas of vanilla extract, green wood, baking spice, herb and raspberry are followed by light-bodied fruit flavors. The concentration doesn't all seem there, and the wood is quite intense.
Name: Ambassador Vineyard 2015 Estate Grown Grenache (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine hails from Canyon Vineyard Ranch. Aromas of baking spice, vanilla extract and raspberry are followed by lighter-styled elegant fruit flavors, with abundant vanilla accents. There are good things going on, but the wood gets in the way, taking over on the palate.
Name: Palencia 2015 Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Earthy on the nose, this bottling shows exotic red-plum aromas as well as hints of sagebrush. Turned earth, plum skins, pepper and savory roasted-meat flavors arise on the palate.
Name: Midnight 2015 Moonbeam Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in neutral puncheons, this wine has aromas that pop, recalling white pepper, dried herbs, raspberry compote, strawberries and spice. The flavors are rich and intense but still maintain a sense of lightness and purity. The depth of the fruit is impressive, with wonderful texture and richness that come in waves. A long, sustained finish caps it off.
Name: Latta 2014 Upland Vineyard Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 20% Syrah and coming from the Upper Mill Creek area, this offers perfumed notes of raspberries, fresh flowers, wild blueberries, white pepper, smoked meat, orange zest and herbs. The flavors are ripe and juicy, with pure fruit notes that carry long into the finish.
Name: Elephant Seven 2016 Yellow Bird Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is an inventive and stunning bottling from Spanish Springs Vineyard by Bryan Babcock. A beautiful shade of hot pink and extremely cloudy in the glass, this wine shows lush aromas of strawberry cake, vanilla and caramel on the nose. The mouthfeel is creamy but the flavors are tangy with kumquat, and that compelling combo holds until baked goods arise on the finish. It is a really fascinating wine.
Designation: Eye of the Beholder En Tirage Rosé of
Name: Babcock 2016 Eye of the Beholder En Tirage Rosé of Grenache (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: Deep ruby in the glass, this wine has a nose of strawberry and violet. Everything feels in balance, from fruit and spice to acidity and tannin. The flavors run from dark plum and cassis to white chocolate and anise, with lingering tannins and a finish marked by a soft splash of citrus.
Name: Dalton 2016 Estate Oak Aged Grenache (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This new offering from the winery combines fruit from Olsen and Boushey vineyards. Light in color, it offers restrained but nuanced plum, fresh herb, orange peel, smoked meat, white pepper and raspberry aromas. There's a pleasing sense of purity to the juicy fruit flavors, making it a very pretty interpretation of the variety. Give it plenty of time to open up.
Name: Two Vintners 2016 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône Villages, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Plump, sun-kissed blackberry and dried-strawberry flavors abound in this deeply fruity, forward Grenache. Full bodied and plush on the palate, it's lifted by savory hints of bramble and spice as well as firm, finely edged tannins that grip on the finish. Drink now–2021.
Name: Château Maucoil 2015 1895 Grenache (Côtes du Rhône Villages)

Appellation: Châteauneuf-du-Pape, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Prominent notes of barley, nut and spice add a smoky tone to plush blackberry jam and preserved-plum flavors. Made from 100% Grenache grapes, it's a richly extracted, warming wine with bold alcohol and mouthfilling but lush tannins. It needs a few years to meld but should drink well from 2020–2030.
Name: Domaine du Grand Tinel 2015 Alexis Establet Grenache (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A vibrant dazzle of pale pink in the glass, this bottling shows fresh, focused and exuberant aromas of bubblegum, rose petal and tangerine rind. Rounded watermelon flavors meet with lemon-lime on the palate, which is persistent in expression deep into the finish.
Name: Kitá 2017 Camp 4 Vineyard Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône Villages, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Delicate hints of dried strawberry and violet are inviting on the nose of this plush Grenache-based wine. It's rounded and rich on the palate, offering luscious layers of strawberry and blueberry flavors. Firm, persistent tannins grip the finish. Drink now–2023.
Name: Domaine Fond Croze 2015 La Croix du Coq Grenache (Côtes du Rhône Villages)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Soft and very restrained aromas of melon, bubblegum, cotton candy and chalk show on this bottling by Karen Steinwachs. The rounded and mellow palate offers watermelon and more bubblegum flavors, proving very pleasant and excellent for a hot day.
Name: Seagrape 2017 Buttonwood Farm Vineyard Rosé of Grenache (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite pale in color, with an orange tinge, this leads with cigar box, Red Vine, raspberry and cherry Jolly Rancher aromas and elegant but sumptuous fruit flavors. There's a lot to like.
Name: Angel Vine 2016 Stonetree Vineyard Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly vinous on the nose, this pink wine shows hints of raspberry and strawberry on the nose. The palate offers slightly unusual hints of toast and nuts at first, but then settles into a familiar background of fresh red fruits and a taut texture.
Name: Calerrain 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Monterey County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A relatively light color leads to spicy aromas, a firm gripping texture and very tasty, complex but restrained flavors including red cherry, cardamom and beef tartare. The wine has great balance due to firm tannins and good acidity, and tastes incredibly fresh and appetizing.
Name: Amador Cellars 2014 Reserve Grenache Noir (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Subtle and complex rather than simply fruity, this medium-bodied wine brings aromas of sunbaked earth, cedar and leather along with flavors like sour cherry, beef broth and anise that are compelling to taste. The texture is firm, moderately tannic and provides just enough tension so that the flavors seem to release slowly onto the taste buds.
Name: The Withers Winery 2015 Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Elegant and spicy floral notes of concentrated rose petal, hibiscus, sage and juniper play against a sugar-plum aroma on the nose of this bottling. Thyme and bay leaf lace the ripe plum-pudding and baked berry flavors of the palate, which is lifted by a crushed purple-flower element.
Name: Derby 2014 Derby Vineyard Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from four vineyards, with 12% Mourvèdre, shows loads of crushed carnation, rose petal, cranberry and raspberry on the nose. There is a compelling freshness to the palate, with potpourri and lavender flavors meshing into a background of pomegranate and rosewater.
Name: Bonny Doon 2017 Clos de Gilroy Grenache (Monterey County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Copper orange in color, this is a meaty, complex quencher, with a metallic edge of steely wet stone. Citrus and peach give it a restrained fruitiness that never becomes heavy or anything but refreshing.
Name: Anaba 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling of an Alban clone was fermented 56% whole cluster, and makes for a more mineral-driven Grenache, with aromas of dried red currants, sarsaparilla, leather and pencil shavings. It's very dry on the palate with red plum, rosewater, candied jasmine and a hint of spearmint, but the firm tannins need much more time to smooth out.
Name: Big Basin 2014 Grizzly Grenache (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine pleases the palate with great balance and a nice combination of fresh fruit and light spice flavors. Hints of new leather and sunbaked earth temper strawberry and cherry notes, and mild tannins add some good grip to the texture.
Name: Vasco Urbano 2015 Norm Marina Ranch Grenache (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brawny in leather, baked strawberry and blackberry, this is a robust version of the variety, ripe, softly layered and undeniably fruity. Cinnamon and brown sugar add richness and a touch of spice.
Name: Kokomo 2016 Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine has a very pale-pink color, vivid strawberry and grapefruit flavors and a good crisp texture. It will provide great refreshment as well as concentrated fruit flavors that last through the tangy finish. The Clif Family made it with Grenache grapes and no oak aging.
Name: Clif Family 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is rewarding in tones of earth and blueberry that are balanced by bright, juicy acidity. Easygoing on the palate, with soft, integrated tannins, it finishes in a dusting of cocoa powder.
Name: Capo Creek 2015 Grenache (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Menfi, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Made entirely with organically grown Alicante, this offers aromas evoking rose petal, red berry and Mediterranean scrub. The aromas carry over to the juicy easygoing palate alongside supple tannins.
Name: Marilena Barbera 2016 Ciàtu Alicante (Menfi)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is full-bodied and quite concentrated, starting with oaky cedary aromas that lead to ripe rich blackberry flavors and a broad mouthfilling texture bolstered by moderate tannins.
Name: McKahn 2016 Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Made from organically grown grapes, this supple, well-ripened wine shows the grape's typical spicy plum and black cherry flavors. The fading color and short finish suggest drinking it sooner than later. Enjoy now–2020.
Name: Upper Five 2015 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's spicy plum and berry aromas are lightly oaked and minty. It's fresh and crisp on the palate but almost raw, with rubbery tannins and plum, currant and vanilla flavors. It's dry and spicy on the finish.
Designation: Xi'ipal Las Bajadas Single Vineyard Martín de Unx
Name: Bodegas Caudalía 2015 Xi'ipal Las Bajadas Single Vineyard Martín de Unx Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is very tightly wound and light on the nose, showing only hints of white peach, lemon rind and crushed gravel. It's clean and easy on the palate, with crisp flavors of lemon juice, rose petal and Meyer lemon rind that broaden a bit on the finish.
Name: Morgan 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Pink-orange in color, this is fresh and lightly fruity, balanced in a lasting combination of strawberry and peach flavors, the acidity in check.
Name: C R Graybehl 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine is explosively fruity. Its tart red plum and black cherry fruit bursts from the glass. High alcohol gives the finish a slight, liquorous burn. But if it's fruit flavor you want, it's here in spades.
Name: 2Hawk 2016 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A subtle savory earthy leathery aspect adds intrigue to this medium-bodied and rather soft-textured wine. The fruit component is light raspberry.
Name: Cavaletti 2016 The 109 Mile Grenache (California)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine is medium bodied, full flavored and well structured. Ripe cherries and black plums fill the aroma, dark cherries and subtle spice and smoke come out on the palate as a firm layer of tannin grips the sides of the mouth, ready to handle rich proteins.
Name: Writer's Block 2015 Grenache (Lake County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Blended with 12% Syrah, this has initially light aromas that open up to reveal cocoa powder, woodspice, dried herb, red berry and mineral notes. Its sweet cherry flavors are ripe and front-loaded, with a core of tannin in the middle. Cranberry flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Castillo de Feliciana 2014 Garnacha (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This light colored wine brings tire rubber, potpourri, raspberry and spice aromas. The palate is soft in feel—full of red fruit flavors that seem a bit hot.
Name: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Savory, earthy aromas set the stage for flavors that are lean, meaty and tea-like, while the texture is smooth and just lightly tannic. Interesting that the color is quite light and brownish, but that's not too unusual for a Grenache, and goes along with the maverick nature of this envelope-pushing wine.
Name: Windchaser 2015 Grenache Noir (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's cherry candy and rubber aromas lead to a palate that's bouyant and lively but unsettled. Its plum and currant flavors are lean and edgy, framed by rubbery grape skin tannins and slight oxidation.
Name: Aragus 2015 Old Vines Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Very ripe and roasted in character, this full-bodied wine smells smoky, tastes meaty and brings some heat to the midpalate and finish. It is big and a bit rough around the edges.
Name: Sol Rouge 2014 Grenache (Red Hills)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This everyday Garnacha is racy and energetic, with spicy, leathery raspberry, strawberry and plum aromas. It's brighter on the palate, offering juicy plum and raspberry flavors that linger on the lively finish.
Name: Borsao 2016 Monte Oton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fresh and light, this is a delicate wine, light pink in color, showing subtle raspberry aromas, subdued cherry flavors and good acidity that keeps it lively on the palate.
Name: McKahn 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This Garnacha's jammy aromas of prune and raisin suggest overripeness. It's full bodied but short on acidity. And it tastes like it smells: raisiny, with cassis notes.
Name: Jardín de Lúculo 2015 Old Vines Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's heavy oak aromas bring a smoldering campfire to mind. It's dense and soupy, with low acidity and soft tannins. Its baking spice and black fruit flavors finish hot, with a roasted character. It was tasted twice with consistent findings.
Name: Pagos del Moncayo 2015 Prados Colección Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's damp earth and raisiny aromas don't suggest a high level of quality. It's jagged on the midpalate but creamy along the edges, with candied and raisinated berry flavors that fall flat on the finish, lacking complexity.
Name: Jardín de Lúculo 2015 Origen Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This Garnarcha features roasted berry and horseradish aromas. It's choppy on the palate, with top-heavy acidity and jammy blackberry and cassis flavors. Tobacco notes emerge on the finish.
Name: Santo Cristo 2015 Flor de Cayus Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's bright raspberry and plum aromas are typical of basic Garnacha. Its fresh, racy palate isn't heavily structured, offering a simple mix of plum, oak and chocolate flavors.
Name: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Viña Temprana Old Vines Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's medicinal, roasted black fruit aromas include animal and Band-Aid notes. It's a syrupy Garnacha with overripe plum and blackberry flavors that's at once sticky and acidic on the finish.
Name: Agustín Cubero 2015 Unus Old Vine Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This $15 Garnacha is heavily oaked and smells singularly of clove. The palate is sticky and cloying, with artificial clove and allspice flavors. Way too much oak has been thrown at totally average fruit here, and the result is forced and fake-tasting.
Name: Coto de Hayas 2016 Centenaria Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This leads with brett-derived scents and alcoholic heat. It's soft and gummy on the palate, without much structure. Heavy oak has resulted in roasted berry and clove flavors, and it's even more artificial and oaky-tasting on the finish.
Name: Picador 2015 Cuvée E.M.H. Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This offers thick, inky road tar, wood grain and graphite aromas. It's heavily oaked and resiny, with cloying, oaky blackberry and mint flavors. It finishes with even more oak and a hint of carob.
Name: Bodegas Campos Realos 2015 Real de Aragón Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Clove, mint and chocolate aromas and flavors dominate this wine, suggesting forced oak. In between all that wood is a cloying mouthfeel marked by weedy sweetness. This might rank as one of the most manipulated and artificial-tasting wines from Spain.
Name: Vega Sindoa 2015 El Chaparral Old Vines Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's prune, raisin and cassis aromas lead to a flabby, misdirected palate. Its black fruit flavors are candied and severely overripe. It's so viscous and syrupy that it's hard to drink.
Name: Breca 2015 Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's wooly fruit aromas show a volatile whiff of vinegar. It's jammy and out of shape, with soupy raspberry and plum flavors.
Name: Bodega Virgen de la Sierra 2015 Albada Viña Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is three-quarters Grenache, balanced by Syrah (15%), Mourvèdre (5%) and Carignan. Lighter in color with a reddish tinge, dried and fresh herb, raspberry, plum, dried orange-peel, smoked-meat and mineral aromas are at the fore, bringing a delightful sense of purity. The palate is all about delicacy of the red-fruit flavors, showing a reserved styling. An extended juicy finish caps it off.
Name: Gramercy 2015 The Third Man Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter in color, the aromas pop, with notes of green olive, potpourri, green herb and orange peel. The flavors bring a light, elegant styling, providing a lot of interest but not fully delivering on the aroma's promise. Citrus flavors linger on the finish. It's a pretty interpretation of this variety.
Name: Full Pull & Friends 2012 Olsen Vineyard Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fairly dark in the glass, this Grenache rosé, which includes 19% Cinsault, shows raspberry and orange oil on the nose. There is persistent acidity and a tactile grip to the sip, where orange skin and red pear flavors ride a chalky texture.
Name: Proulx 2017 Willow Creek Farm Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strawberry punch aromas meet with cotton candy on the light but very inviting and rounded nose of this Grenache-based pink wine. It's soft on the palate with just enough grip to make for a compelling sip.
Name: Comartin 2017 Adelaide's Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A soft pink color, this bottling from the Riboli family's new Stefano Vineyard shows watermelon, lime rinds and orange on the nose. It's clean and crisp on the palate with lime, strawberry and a fresh acidity.
Name: San Simeon 2017 Stefano Vineyard Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Vin Pétillant, France Other, France
Description: Sparkling Provence rosé is the logical next step in the success story from the south of France. This one is soft and off dry, making it a great apéritif. It's bubbly, crisply textured and ready to drink.
Designation: Coeur Clémentine La Pétillante Brut Rosé
Name: Vins Clémentine NV Coeur Clémentine La Pétillante Brut Rosé Grenache (Vin Pétillant)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Mellow yet packed with action on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of rose petals, jasmine tea, caramelized black fruit and loam. The mouthfeel is quite full and grippy with tannins, offering big fruity flavors of strawberry, grenadine, lavender and violet. Stunning acidity and a chalky texture carry deep into the finish.
Name: Denner 2015 Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is an impressive wine, especially for a county blend. Aromas of potpourri, sumac, rose petals, strawberry, tart mulberry and plum make for a very beautiful floral-first nose. Raspberry, cranberry and pomegranate show on the energetic sip, which is framed by a chalky grip and also shows dark turned soil, mint and tarragon elements.
Name: Samsara 2015 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made from the same five rows each year of clone 362, this bottling starts with red-spice aromas of mace and cinnamon and then shows the underlying fresh raspberry and white-pepper tones. The sip starts very peppery, and then offers red currant, carnation, hibiscus and even a flash of red melon.
Name: Samsara 2014 Larner Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark and thick in the glass, this bottling shows concentrated black cherry and blackberry aromas alongside baking spice, cocoa, vanilla and roasted meat scents. There is zesty acidity and strong structure throughout the sip, which offers floral touches of rose petal and carnation and prominent oak elements.
Name: Site 2014 Larner Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rustic aromas of turned loam, dusty gravel and leather are lifted by carnation, hibiscus and red spice on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Tight cranberry and raspberry flavors meet with orange peel on the palate, which also includes that earthy streak and floral elements to make a very complete wine.
Name: Baker & Brain 2014 Le Mistral Vineyard Grenache (Monterey County)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine offers all of the sleekness and complexity you'd hope from a top tier wine. It's dripping in tones of juicy, ripe strawberry, rhubarb and blueberry jam, along with violets, warm spices and some earthiness at its core. Texturally, there are no hard edges here. Soft and supple, some silky tannins and a delicate line of acidity are there, but only enough to rein in all that plush fruit. Drink now–2033.
Name: Wirra Wirra 2016 The Absconder Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Baked red cherry, dried fennel, wild mint and riverbed aromas show on the nose of this bottling by Santa Barbara County-based Grenache specialist Angela Osborne. Marjoram, oregano and thyme all play on the nose, as do hints of cracked pepper, decorating the supple strawberry core. Strong tannins uphold the finish.
Name: A Tribute to Grace 2015 Provisor Vineyard Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is a pretty, lifted, light- to medium-bodied style that erupts with aromas of ripe cherries, baking spices, red licorice and rose petals. The palate is juicy in feel, with tight-grained tannins and a long, savory finish.
Name: Turkey Flat 2016 Grenache (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Barossa, South Australia, Australia
Description: From the oldest plot of the Tri-Centenary vineyards (1889), of which just 820 vines remain, this Grenache is an inky-hued, dense version of the variety, swimming with plush, almost raisiny blackberry fruit, cola, dusting polish, mocha and spice. The full-bodied palate offers more rich, dark fruit and tight-grained, dusty tannins. This is a classy drop and should age beautifully through 2028.
Name: Yalumba 2012 The Tri-Centenary Grenache (Barossa)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This bottling by Angela Osborne is a great example of a light wine that's loaded with action. Aromas of cranberry, orange rind, baked soil, forest herbs and river stones show on the nose. The palate shows red plum, mace, white pepper, tarragon and more forest floor, all wrapped in a lithe texture.
Name: A Tribute to Grace 2015 Shake Ridge Ranch Grenache (Amador County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light red currant, rose petals and jasmine tea are outdone by the crushed gravel minerality on the nose of this bottling. The palate is all about texture and earth, with a light body and grippy texture conveying rocky flavors alongside dried strawberry, rose petals and a salt-and-pepper spice.
Name: A Tribute to Grace 2015 Vie Caprice Vineyard Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rose petals, cola, macerated wild cherry and cherry pits meet with gravel and crushed brick minerality on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard just on the east side of Highway 101 south of Orcutt. The palate is fresh and mineral-driven, with turned earth, gravel and strong acid taking center stage over the light-red-fruit flavors.
Name: A Tribute to Grace 2015 Murmur Vineyard Grenache (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The winery's first Grenache from this esteemed vineyard, this was aged in neutral French oak. It's expressive in aroma, with flower, mountain strawberry, green olive, white pepper and smoked meat notes that become more prominent over time. The palate is full-flavored but still elegant, with fruit and savory notes that lead to a peppery finish.
Name: W.T. Vintners 2015 Boushey Vineyard Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Surprisingly concentrated in style for such a coastal vineyard, this bottling shows boysenberry syrup, black-plum pudding and spice cake on the nose. The palate is intense with dark fruits of blueberry and roasted black plum, with nutmeg and gingerbread flavors as well as firm tannins framing it all.
Name: La Barge 2014 Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is the most affordable and easiest-to-find take on Angela Osborne's uniquely light style of Grenache. Cranberry, hibiscus and crushed gravel show on the nose, while the palate carries her typically lively texture, persistent acidity and fresh flavors of pressed raspberries.
Name: A Tribute to Grace 2016 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-plum sauce, star anise, concentrated rose and strawberry-jam aromas make for a luxurious and inviting, if a bit powerful, nose on this bottling. Strawberry paste, white pepper and a gravelly minerality show on the sip.
Name: Vie Winery 2013 L'Imaginaire Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Co-fermented with 12% Syrah, this tasty wine opens with complex cinnamon, roasted coriander and wood smoke aromas. Mixed berry fruit flavors follow, with added brightness from using 30% whole clusters. The tannins are polished, contributing streaks of tea and tobacco.
Name: Fox Farm 2015 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is a solid, medium-bodied expression of the variety that McLaren Vale excels at. Aromas of ripe blue and black fruits, vanilla and cola are laced with sweet spices. The palate is lean and tightly wound from dusty tannins but with enough juicy fruit to prop them up.
Name: Kay Brothers 2016 Basket Pressed Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated berries, cola spice, licorice and gingerbread aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's thick on the palate with boysenberry, plum, hoisin and gingersnap flavors—a heavier and spice-laden take on the grape.
Name: Ferguson Crest 2015 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Montsant, Catalonia, Spain
Description: This wine's medicinal berry aromas suggest cinnamon. It's full and saturated on the palate yet hollow in the middle. Saucy flavors of plum and berry come with a hint of blackened oak. The finish is earthy and savory.
Name: Josep Grau Viticultor 2014 La Florens Garnacha (Montsant)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: A relatively rich style of the variety, there's plenty going on in this wine: The nose is a heady mix of blueberries, plums and cranberries, along with Dr. Pepper, sweet spice and a green herbal tinge. The palate is medium bodied although there's no shortage of ripe plummy fruit.
Name: Thorn Clarke 2016 Barossa Trail Saleyards Road Grenache (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Nutmeg, baked cherry, Chinese five spice and cinnamon show on the nose of this bottling. The palate falls in line, with rounded red fruit, baking spice and a compelling texture.
Name: Villa San Juliette 2015 Reserve Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Tarragona, Catalonia, Spain
Description: This fortified wine from Tarragona includes old stocks of red and white Garnacha, bolstered up to 20% alcohol. It's woody on the nose and power-charged on the palate, with rich and creamy but also charred flavors. Chocolate and burnt wood notes turn more smoky and bitter on the hot, fiery finish.
Name: De Muller 1954 Avreo Vino de Licor Red (Tarragona)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Ripe fruit flavors of strawberry preserves and blueberry pie add instant appeal to this wine. It spent 18 months in neutral and once-used barrels, lending a touch of milk chocolate to the finish.
Name: Jaxon 2015 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Montsant, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Although this value red shows mild baked and raisiny aromas, it's not overripe. The palate is blocky but full. Dry oak flavors of clove and spice infuse its tomatoey plum fruit, feeling bold, dry and firm on the finish.
Name: Cellers Baronia del Montsant 2013 Flor d'Englora Garnacha (Montsant)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is very floral on the nose with rose petals and hibiscus, as well as plush strawberries and framboise. The palate is loaded with plummy flavors, proving both somewhat light and very extracted at the same time.
Name: Seven Oxen 2015 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Gigondas, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Crisp black-plum and raspberry flavors are richly concentrated in this vibrant wine. It's bold and plush on the palate but lifted by fresh acidity and subtleties of tea leaf, violet and bramble. The finish is penetrating and dense, marked by ripe, persistent tannins. Beautiful already it's structured enough to improve through 2030 and hold further.
Name: Château de Saint-Cosme 2014 Le Claux  (Gigondas)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Elegance, depth and power rise to the stage in this bottling by Jordan Fiorentini, who packs in aromas of concentrated red cherry, turned loam, bay leaf and packed rose petals. The mouthfeel is lavish at first, and then the tannins firm up, delivering flavors of cherry compote, orange rind and rosebuds. Zesty acidity runs throughout.
Name: Epoch 2014 Sensibility Paderewski Vineyard Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Gigondas, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Whiffs of spice and smoke lend nuance to juicy black plum and boysenberry in this velvet-textured Gigondas. It's voluminous and ripe but balanced with fresh acidity and a peppery zest on the midpalate. The finish is rich and lingering, coated by a pleasant grip of cocoa powder and tea tannins. Approachable already it should improve through 2020 and hold further.
Name: Château de Saint-Cosme 2014 Le Poste  (Gigondas)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright rhubarb and hibiscus aromas meet with wet gravel and spice cake on the nose of this well-woven bottling. The palate tightens up on an earthy rocky core, proving texturally unique and firm while delivering flavors of cherry, dried sage and baked bricks. A very structural Grenache that's built to last. Drink now through 2030.
Name: McPrice Myers 2015 Sel de la Terre Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a “wow” factor on the nose of this bottling of old vine Grenache, with fresh red cherry, cola, light licorice, rusty earth, rosewater and carnation all coming to the fore. The palate is loaded with wet gravel and river-stone minerality, which is decorated with red plum and pomegranate flavors. Overall light and easy yet complex and unique.
Name: Birichino 2016 Besson Vineyard Old Vines Grenache (Central Coast)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a strong streak of elegant herbs, from bay leaf to mint to thyme, set against a plummy background, along with turned earth and rose petals, on the nose of this bottling. Rose hips, marjoram and tangy pomegranate flavors show on the lively sip, which also benefits from grippy tannins.
Name: Archium 2015 Haven Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Freshly smashed pomegranate and red cherry meet with white pepper, light bay leaf, anise and tarragon on the nose. The riper palate blends those herbal touches together with black raspberry and boysenberry, adding hints of lavender and pepper as well. Squeaky tannins and strong acidity lead into the finish.
Name: Tercero 2013 Larner Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very transparent shade of rusty red in the glass, this bottling shows how compelling Grenache can be in a lighter style. Aromas of red cherry, salt-and-pepper spice and tanned leather show on the nose. It's clean and savory on the palate, full of dried carnations, hibiscus, white pepper and a touch of dill.
Name: A Tribute to Grace 2015 Santa Barbara Highlands Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Damp funky herbs meet with boysenberry, dark cranberry, cinnamon and mace on the compelling, unique nose of this bottling. Juniper and fennel pollen spice up the tightly wound, dark-red fruits on the sip, where meaty hints of roasted game add to the complexity.
Name: Potek 2014 Demetria Vineyard Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Chalone, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong red fruit, smoke, pressed red flowers and iron show on the nose of this bottling from an appellation whose rugged, rocky setting is known for producing age-worthy wines. Though lighter in body, the palate is tremendously tannic and firm at this young age, so patience is required for the wood shavings, pepper spice and caramelized red-fruit elements to shine. Drink 2020–2035.
Name: La Marea 2015 Brosseau Vineyard Grenache (Chalone)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cherry syrup, grenadine, red flower petals and a pinch of cinnamon show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard near Los Alamos. Strong hibiscus notes on the sip meet with black-tea tones, and the concentrated structure is firm with tannins.
Name: Tercero 2013 Watch Hill Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated aromas of alpine strawberry, framboise, cola, root beer and vanilla give this rich single-vineyard expression a heady spiciness. It's a solid example of how a heavier Grenache can still retain boisterous acidity and compelling grippy texture, amidst flavors of cooked cherries and tangy cranberry sauce.
Name: Cordant 2015 Wills Hills Vineyard Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Condensed rose petals, soft red plums, minty herbs and wet soil show on the approachable nose of this bottling. Rounded hibiscus and watermelon flavors lead the medium-bodied sip, where a compelling tension gives nuance to this strong expression of Grenache.
Name: Jada Vineyard & Winery 2015 WCS Jack John Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very floral on the nose, this bottling from a young vineyard shows crushed slate, red cherries and a touch of potpourri on the nose. The palate offers hearty flavors of baked boysenberry, peppery spice and a tart violet florality, proving quite a mouthful of flavors.
Name: Potek 2014 Kimsey Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Clara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light aromas of rose petal, hibiscus and light cherry emerge with patience on the nose of this very restrained bottling. The palate is all about texture, with hints of cinnamon, rosewater, cherry foam and gravel, a hint of strawberry paste emerging on the finish.
Name: A Tribute to Grace 2015 Besson Vineyard Grenache (Santa Clara County)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy black-fruit aromas of chocolaty plum and berry are the starting course. This wine is a bit high in acidity and pulling, so there's tension on the palate. Plum, tomato and oak flavors are saucy, while the wine tastes earthy and feels grabby on the finish.
Name: Bodega Virgen de la Sierra 2016 OGV Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Quite smooth in texture and rather mild in flavor, this wine has a rich mouthfeel, tasty elements of black pepper and cranberry and just enough tannin for a little grip on the finish.
Name: Le Casque 2015 Grenache (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Catalunya, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Jumpy plum and raspberry aromas come in front of a fleshy but bright palate with bold acidity. Lively raspberry and plum flavors darken up on a peppery finish with some heat. For an everyday red wine with energy, this fits the bill.
Name: Alta Alella 2016 GX Made With Organic Grapes Garnacha (Catalunya)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a full-bodied but not very concentrated wine that smells meaty and cherry-like, has mellow, mature spice flavors, a smooth, broad texture and slightly hot finish.
Name: Sentivo 2014 Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Catalunya, Catalonia, Spain
Description: A transparent red color and aromas of cherry and plum set up a wiry, clipped palate with juicy acidity. Spunky plum flavors turn more roasted on a finish with barbecued notes.
Name: Ramon Roqueta 2016 Garnacha (Catalunya)

Appellation: Catalunya, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Grapy wild-berry aromas show notes of raisin and wet clay. This feels full and blocky due to low acidity. A mix of candied plum, berry and green herb flavors are short on the finish.
Name: Ressò 2016 Old Vines Garnacha (Catalunya)

Appellation: Bajo Aragon, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Candied aromas of berry fruits and raisin are not fresh or focused. This wine has a stewy feel along with gummy flavors of blackened berry fruits. Touches of clove, licorice and mint register on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Tempore 2016 Esenzia Old Vine Garnacha (Bajo Aragon)

Appellation: Paicines, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This higher-end, elegantly packaged bottling delivers depth, starting with a well-woven, unique nose of baked strawberry, cinnamon, juniper, peppercorns and tobacco. Those elements converge on the palate alongside sandalwood, Montmorency cherry and vanilla, bolstered by a soft but steady acidity.
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 Family Reserve Grenache (Paicines)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, this wine offers beguiling aromas with notes of fire pit, flower, stem, potpourri, black raspberry and smoked meat. Ethereally light and enchanting, it's texturally rich and flavorful, with a warm finish—a delicious example of this site and variety.
Name: Two Vintners 2015 Claire Boushey Vineyard Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Drake Whitcraft is becoming a master at weaving a wide array of sensory experiences into very light wines. This starts with candied pomegranate, fennel bulb and cracked white pepper on the nose, then hits the palate with bright snappy red fruits, heavy peppery spice and a penetratingly bright acid profile. It goes down easy, but with complexity.
Name: Whitcraft 2016 Stolpman Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: There's strong oak, vanilla and spice cake on the nose of this rich bottling from Paso Robles vineyards as well as sugar plums and wet soil aromas. There's an earthy minerality of turned loam to the palate, with hints of forest moss, pine oil and cracked pepper.
Name: Nelle 2015 Grenache (California)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Grenache is a little older than the typical release, and that gives it some extra depth. Aromas of cranberry sauce, baking spice, rose petals, hibiscus and carnations are nose-tickling. The palate is loaded with spice cake, gingerbread and rounded, slightly sour red-cherry flavors, altogether soft and pleasing.
Name: Curran 2012 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of cinnamon, dried rose petals and tight raspberry fruit make for a very pretty nose on this lighter delicate style of Grenache. The palate is quite fresh, with cherry, cranberry, orange rind, dried ginger, cracker pepper and sumac flavorings combining for a very refreshing, elegant bottling.
Name: Crawford Family 2015 Kimsey Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Swartland, South Africa
Description: There's a pleasant earthy, spicy character right off the bat on the nose of this wine, opening with pronounced scents of Dr. Pepper, cherry cola, red plum, chicory root and church incense. The medium-weight palate offers structured tannins that lend surprising grip, yet bright acidity keeps the mouthfeel lifted. The stalky, tight red-berry flavors on the palate return to spicy abundance on the medium-length finish. Drink 2020–2025.
Name: A.A. Badenhorst Family Wines 2015 Raaigras Grenache (Swartland)

Appellation: Swartland, South Africa
Description: Enticing, fruity aromas of red cherry and brambly berry set the stage for layers of cola, baking spice and cocoa. The medium-weight palate offers a texture like crushed satin, smooth yet defined, with ample acidity to keep the structure and ripe-fruit flavors from feeling overly dense. The spice returns on the finish and continues alongside a hint of peppery warmth. Drink now–2023.
Name: David & Nadia 2015 David Grenache (Swartland)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red and purple flowers meet with crushed slate, turned soil and plump cherry fruits on the nose of this bottling. It's a solid, down-the-middle expression of the grape, with red and black plums, clove and tarragon lifts to the palate.
Name: Villa Creek 2015 Garnacha (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded and ripe aromas of baked strawberry, red plum, dried rose petal and anise show on the nose of this bottling by theater tech-turned-winemaker Sabrine Rodems. The complex texture is still a bit stiff and sticky on the palate, and the flavors are strong and straightforward, with cranberry and sandalwood. It's clean and refreshing overall, but it could use more time.
Name: Wrath 2015 Alta Loma Vineyard Grenache (Monterey)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's strong woody spice on the nose of this appellation blend with sandalwood and lacquer aromas meeting with stewed plums, mulberries and candied flowers. Those same fruit flavors show on the sip, alongside a pine-needle lift. It is a quite rich expression.
Name: Kaena 2015 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Swartland, South Africa
Description: A lovely note of mint chocolate rides atop the core of ripe wild berries and cherry in the nose and mouth of this attractive wine. It boasts a medium body and satiny texture, with ample structure and acidity for overall balance. The fruit-forward palate is accented by herbal, earthy hints, finishing with a flourish of baking spice. Drink now–2023.
Name: Momento 2015 Grenache (Swartland)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An extremely pale, orange-tinged color belies an aromatically expressive wine, with appealing notes of white pepper, wild raspberry and herb. The palate is sumptuous yet light in feel, with achingly pure fruit flavors. This wine is all about elegance—perhaps too much for some tastes. But for those seeking the variety's delicate side, look no further. Drink now.
Name: Descendant 2013 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Swartland, South Africa
Description: This is a dense, dark and well-concentrated wine, with abundant notes of blackberry, boysenberry and cherry on the nose and mouth. Hints of pepper, licorice and char add depth and interest, featuring most prominently on the finish alongside a hint of fudgy brownie. The mouthfeel is bold, gripping and firmly textured. Drink now–2021.
Name: Leeuwenkuil 2015 Grenache (Swartland)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of three vineyards, including one in Santa Barbara County, offers intriguing sweet-and-sour aromas of dried sage, bay leaf, forest floor and olive tapenade. Dried berry fruit shows on the sip alongside chaparral, and it tastes much older than its young age.
Name: Bonny Doon 2016 Grenache (Monterey County)

Appellation: Maremma Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Alicante, this presents aromas suggesting red-skinned berry, white pepper and leather. The easygoing palate offers cranberry, clove and exotic spice alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Poggio al Tufo 2015  Maremma Toscana

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, this offers faint aromas that give up almost nothing on first pour, except notes of spice. Still young, the palate is more revealing, showing elegant flavors of raspberry and plum. If the aromas open up it could move up a notch.
Name: Upsidedown 2016 The Gold Drop Collection Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Berry and tomato aromas are basic. Typical of Garnacha, this is grabby and chewy on the palate. Flavors of grape skins, black plum and herbal berry fruits are peppery and show a hint of oak-based clove on the finish.
Name: Acentor 2016 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Montsant, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Berry and spice aromas that suggest clove open this medium-bodied Garnacha. Spiced berry flavors hint at cinnamon, while chocolate notes are welcome on a plump finish.
Name: Cellers Unió 2015 Perlat Garnacha (Montsant)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Furry plum and berry aromas are good but fragmented. Racy acidity creates tension and some rawness on the palate, while this wine tastes of tart black plum and black currant. Latent acidity on the finish results in strained freshness.
Name: Xiloca 2016 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Foxy berry aromas are fruity and jumpy. This wine is grapy on the palate, and more flat than lively. Jammy black-fruit flavors are herbal, while mint and peppery notes drive the finish.
Name: Cruz de Piedra 2016 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raisiny, saucy aromas are slightly volatile. A wide, saturated palate comes up short on focus and acidity, while a mix of raisin and green-herb flavors lands on a heavy finish.
Name: Albada 2014 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Pushy oak and heavy clove aromas seem excessive for this level of Garnacha. A rough, grating palate leads to oak-heavy flavors of clove and blackberry, while a persistent flavor of oak-driven clove controls the finish.
Name: Marqués de Montañana 2016 Selección Especial Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Gigondas, Rhône Valley, France
Description: The Hominis Fides represents some of the estate's oldest Grenache vines, with an average age of 90 years. Irresistibly ripe, rich and mouthfilling, this is a powerhouse of black-plum and cherry flavors refined by layers of pencil shavings, cedar and spice. It's bold and lavishly textured yet has freshness and a fine, filigreed tannin structure. Drink now through 2030.
Name: Château de Saint-Cosme 2014 Hominis Fides  (Gigondas)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: After skipping a vintage, the producer offers this impressively powerful expression of the variety from a great site. Compressed plum and strawberry compote flavors are rich and rounded, nuanced in juicy acidity. A lasting bite of oak and tannin permeate on the long finish, accented in white pepper.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Rossi Ranch Grenache (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Châteauneuf-du-Pape, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Savory tones of tobacco leaf, dried lavender and thyme lend a dark, sultry appeal to rich blackberry and plum here. This wine is fleshy on the palate yet firmly balanced with fine, taut tannins and a lingering, brambly finish. Graceful and nuanced, it should drink at prime through 2030.
Name: Laurence Féraud 2014 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This complex vineyard-designate is spicy and earthy in equal measure, the burst of white pepper most memorable. Dried plum, rhubarb and strawberry compote add to the story, with a fresh core of acidity piercing through the strong tannin.
Name: Quivira 2015 Wine Creek Ranch Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense blackberries, vanilla, star anise and ripe elderberries show on the nose of this clonal selection by Grenache guru Mikael Sigouin. Thick black plum and black-currant-sauce flavors combine with soy and violet on the palate, where a bright acidity penetrates deep into the finish.
Name: Kaena 2014 Clone 362 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This affordable red is high-toned in strawberry and a juicy earthiness, its use of oak and moderate power well-integrated. Smooth and velvety on the palate, it finishes in a bright tease of red licorice.
Name: Thirty-Seven Wines 2014 Grenache (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Quietly floral, this wine has small percentages of Syrah and Alicante Bouschet. Red licorice and a thread of white pepper play along a thick big-boned entry that softens into a silky wonder as it develops. It highlights the savory aspects of this beloved Rhône variety.
Name: Benovia 2014 Grenache (Sonoma)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pale pink in color, this is a pitch-perfect rosé, with aromas of watermelon, pink grapefruit, rose petal and lemon rind. There is great zip to the palate and a chalky texture, carrying fresh but tight red-fruit flavors. It will please New World and Old World fans alike.
Name: Topa Mountain Winery 2016 Rosé of Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine has an appetizing lip-smacking texture and a rather taut balance that could take on a wide variety of food pairings. It's all fresh berry and cherry flavors, snappy acidity and firm tannins.
Name: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown Grenache (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an extremely smooth, mellow, complex and interesting wine. From the first whiff of cedar and cinnamon in the aroma, to intricate flavors of raspberry, black tea and clove, it brings a lot of nuances to the palate and wraps them in a soft blanket of mild acidity and light tannins.
Name: Miller Wine Works 2014 Naked Vine Vineyard Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine has a big structure, strong oak, spice and red fruit flavors all wrapped in fine-grained tannins. The color is relatively light, but the aromas are full of toasted oak and nutmeg while the flavors have vivid cranberry and cherry. The wine should mellow with age, and will be best after 2020.
Name: Brassfield 2015 Grenache (High Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Healthy doses of black pepper and smoked meat in both the aromas and the flavors give this wine a pretty forceful personality, and it has good fruit to back them up. It smells like cracked pepper and cedar, tastes spicy, meaty, quite firm in texture and brings out raspberry and red cherry on the finish.
Name: Cedarville 2014 Estate Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This soft-textured, mouth-filling wine has woodsy, fallen leaf aromas, gentle flavors that combine savory and fruity accents and mild acidity and tannins. It's medium to full-bodied and soothing to sip.
Name: Iron Hub 2014 Estate Bottled Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Gripping in texture and nicely saturated with ripe plum and smoked meat flavors, this is a compelling, interesting and complex wine. It shows light oaky, toasted accents on top of vivid red cherry and black-cherry flavors, while firm tannins and good acidity keep it appetizing.
Name: Bella Grace 2014 Grenache Noir (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: This opens with a gorgeous, highly aromatic nose reminiscent of purple flower fields partnered with ripe raspberry, blueberry and blackberry. The fruit-forward palate offers more berry goodness, with a velvety tannic structure and enough acidity to enliven the finish. Drink now–2019.
Name: The Foundry 2015 Grenache Noir (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A rare 100% varietal offering, this works well to showcase dusty, pronounced tannin around a richness of baked cherry and strawberry seasoned in white pepper and orange. Tart acidity works alongside floral aromatics of cherry blossom and violet.
Name: Meeker 2014 Hoskins Ranch Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Gigondas, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Fleshy and full on the palate, this plump red wine offers heaps of juicy, easy black-cherry and berry flavors peppered with spice and mocha. It's a rich, mouthfilling sip but tightens up firmly, with a bold, tannic finish.
Name: Laurence Féraud 2013  Gigondas

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bright, fresh, fruity aromas and flavors are supported by a good firm texture in this very clean, tangy wine. It has a bracing mouthfeel, plenty of red cherry and raspberry flavors and light to medium body.
Name: Lois Rae 2015 Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sierra Pelona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This is the strongest showing yet from this region northeast of Los Angeles, with aromas of berry, hickory smoke, slate and rust on the nose. There is a rustic quality to the sip, with fennel seed-laced salami and macerated plum flavors.
Name: Reyes 2015 Grenache (Sierra Pelona Valley)

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Streaks of tobacco, resin and earth offset bright, fresh blackberry and plum in this rich, boldly concentrated wine. Voluminous and a touch warming on the palate, it's framed by sunny acidity and fine-grained but grippy tannins.
Name: Château d'Or et de Gueules 2015 Castel Nou Red (Costières de Nîmes)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the producer's estate vineyard, the fruit certified biodynamic and organic, this is a rustic, daring wine, ethereal on the one hand in body and spirit, while biting in tannin. Ash and earthy strawberry provide the core of flavor.
Name: Ampelos 2014 Delta Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Piekenierskloof, South Africa
Description: There's a gamy, earthy thread to this wine, along with notes of tobacco and crushed violets that weave throughout the boysenberry fruit. The palate doles out more black berry flavor, while fine tannins and ample acidity frame the finish. Enjoy through 2018.
Name: Piekenierskloof 2015 Grenache (Piekenierskloof)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smooth and tannic, this wine from Grenache specialist speaks loudly to a core of dried cherry, almost liqueur-like in its richness and density, given savory companionship by thickets of leather.
Name: C R Graybehl 2015 Mounts Family Vineyards Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Bright red-cherry and strawberry notes are offset by tones of dried herbs and underbrush. This wine is rounded and full on the palate but delicate in concentration. It finishes with drying, slightly tacky tannins.
Name: Château de Campuget 2015 1753 Grenache (Costières de Nîmes)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Generous oak and tannin dominate around a sizable ripeness of cherry and vanilla in this youthful wine. Tart acidity accents the baked character of the fruit.
Name: C R Graybehl 2015 Mathis Vineyard Grenache (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bountiful boysenberry fruit shows alongside a muddy, loamy clay minerality on the nose of bottling, which is lifted further by crushed lavender aromas. The palate's rounded berry fruit is complemented by cherry wood smoke, grippy tannins and strong acidity. The slate and clay character provides a compelling backbone.
Name: Kaena 2015 Ali'i Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Brawny aromas of wild boysenberries, bay leaf, black cardamom, wet soil and black tobacco recall a tumble through the rugged chaparral on the nose of this bottling. The palate's black fruit and violet flavors mingle with lavender, chai spice, clove, black pepper and more tobacco, framed by firm tannins. This represents a tremendously complete sensory experience.
Name: Chesebro 2013 CM Ranch Grenache (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this countywide blend is extremely elegant and lovely, with light rose petals, pressed black plums and crushed violets. There's a tremendously grippy texture to the sip, providing a pure tension that delivers flavors of purple fruit and rosewater. It's a testament to the versatility of the variety.
Name: Jaffurs 2015 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Mikael Sigouin extracts the rich side of Grenache in most of his bottlings, and this is an excellent example. Deep and stunning aromas of lilac, cola, red cherries, strawberry-balsamic glaze, black cardamom and sharp sandalwood lead into a palate that's lavish with chai spice, dried ginger and cherry-cordial flavors. Tannins pile up toward the finish and the acidity sings through it all.
Name: Kaena 2015 Larner Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light in color, this wine's beautiful nose shows freshly pressed raspberry, dewy tarragon, fennel and lavender aromas—a showcase of aromatic elegance. Immensely fresh and inviting flavors pop on the palate, from tart strawberry and green fennel to rose petals and rosewater, all framed by a long-simmering acidity. It would work well with either white fish or roasted pork.
Name: Casa Dumetz 2015 Thompson Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in color, this unique wine shows peppery figs, plum paste, rust and star anise spice on the fascinating nose. It's light in body with a great textural grip, offering up a distinct stew of flavors, including macerated orange, plum, Christmas spice, sarsaparilla, coffee candies and a white-pepper-dust finish.
Name: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Faces Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strawberry, red plum and dried rose petals float atop a very rocky core on the nose of this old vine expression, where wet gravel and crushed river stones serve as a backdrop. The palate is bouncy and fresh with wild raspberry set against crushed-concrete minerality.
Name: Birichino 2015 Besson Vineyard Old Vines Grenache (Central Coast)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of dried cherry, iron and smoke are set against a mineral-driven backdrop of volcanic soil, wet gravel and slate on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit like sucking on gravel at first: very schist-driven and flint-like. Then come waves of pomegranate, carnation and, on the finish, vanilla.
Name: Bolero Cellars 2014 Garnacha (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: El Pomar District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cherry compote, warm cinnamon bread, plump raspberry and a hint of star anise make for a rich and spicy nose on this bottling. The palate shows similar character, with plush, soft and warm tones of red cherry and light clove spice.
Name: Pomar Junction 2014 Grenache (El Pomar District)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Alto Moncayo's mega Garnacha is this smoky, roasted smelling monster. Aromas of plum and currant are straight from the smoker, while this feels full and massive but tempered by acidity. Resiny oak flavors of clove and campfire are stronger than the wine's plum and berry notes, while this tastes savory and extremely woody on the finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2014 Aquilon Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump, dark strawberry, lavish kirsch, along with cola, cinnamon and allspice show on the nose of this rich bottling from a vineyard on the small appellation's northern end. Vanilla, caramel and cherry-jubilee flavors show on the ripe sip, where a solid tannic tension arises on the finish.
Name: Kaena 2015 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A deeper shade of pink, this bottling shows raspberry, rose petal, crushed gravel and wet slate on the impressively mineral nose. There is a complex texture to the palate, which is loaded with crushed rock and chalk, and also shows candied raspberry and cherry flavors.
Name: Kaena 2016 Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sonja Magdevski is exploring what Grenache can do across Santa Barbara County, and this appellation blend is a bit more simple that her single-vineyard expressions, but gives a great sense of what she is up to. Purple hibiscus, light mulberry, rooibos tea and exotic cherries show on the fresh nose, while the palate is delicate with hints of plum, black raspberry, star anise and vanilla dust.
Name: Casa Dumetz 2015 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light, cloudy and blood-orange colored in the glass, this oxidative bottling from Thompson Vineyard, which spent 140 days on skins, is unlike any Grenache on the market. Aromas of plum, fig, pepper, strawberry wine and balsamic vinegar lead into a palate of sour red plum and white pepper. Fascinating for wine geeks, though perhaps too weird for most.
Name: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Twilight Idol Thompson Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A heavy application of charred oak might be too much for some, but if that's to your liking then you should enjoy this Garnacha's smoky, spicy nose. A stout, full-bodied palate is full of resiny oak with a balance of acid. Saturated, woody flavors of roasted berry fruits finish toasty and resiny. Drink through 2020.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2014 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a rather extreme minerality in play on this old-vine bottling, with wet gravel, scree and crushed slate leading the nose alongside crushed carnations, rose petals and touch of dark-plum fruit. Muddy chalky clay tones carry that vibe into the sip, only allowing a slight berry flavor to rise above.
Name: Birichino 2014 Besson Vineyard Old Vines Grenache (Central Coast)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Swarthy aromas of cooked black cherry, root beer, vanilla, cinnamon, clove and shaved eucalyptus show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are very minty with sweet bay leaf, juniper and more eucalyptus, proving quite a mouthful.
Name: Kaena 2015 La Presa Vineyard Grenache (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This spicy, fiery smelling Garnacha shows bright plum and berry aromas. In the mouth, this is tough and tannic, with raw acidity and a mild burn. Dark, spicy berry flavors are blackened, while this tastes peppery and feels hot on the finish.
Name: Artadi 2013 Pasos de San Martín Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Lactic oak is the dominant aroma on this Garnacha, which results in creamy notes of chocolate atop plum and cassis scents. This is woody and resiny in feel, with ample acidity to maintain balance. Savory, smoky plum and blackberry flavors are baked and woody, while this tastes of beef jerky and other cured meats on the finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2014 Veraton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Despite its potent alcohol, this is an elegant wine with pretty raspberry and strawberry fruit. It's lightly dusted with cinnamon notes and is fresh and lively in the mouth. Enjoy over the next couple of years.
Name: Troon 2016 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Pushy oak on the nose results in grainy aromas and cheesy notes. This warm-vintage Garnacha from Navarra feels tight and pulling, with choppy tannins. Oaky flavors of blackberry are raw and bumpy across a hot and scratchy finish.
Name: Artadi 2012 Santa Cruz de Artazu Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated fruit aromas of red plum, reduced strawberry and gingerbread are a bit much on the nose of this bottling. The cooked flavors are very kirsch-like, with concentrated cherry and plum, yet there is still a compelling tannic structure and a strong acidity.
Name: Kaena 2014 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense black plums, crushed black rocks and a dollop of vanilla, star anise and licorice show on the rather rich nose of this bottling. The flavors are a tad woody, with cigar box quite prominent, as well as roasted game and dark minty cherries.
Name: Croma Vera 2015 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
