Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a hearty and quite delicious wine, although nuances of the Grenache grape are overshadowed by richness. Roasted duck, bacon fat, smoked pork loin and freshly sliced filet mignon show on the nose, with violet and blueberry-syrup touches. The palate offers licorice, pepper, blueberry sauce and a very soft texture.
Name: Herman Story 2013 On the Road Grenache (California)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Extremely flavorful and wonderfully exotic, this full-bodied wine has intense fruit flavors like raspberry and rhubarb, with a host of interesting accents recalling cedar, white pepper and clove. The mouthfeel is warm and rich, tannins are soft and easy, and the finish lingers nicely.
Name: Parducci 2014 Reserve Grenache (Mendocino)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Intriguing aromas of fresh herb, potpourri and red fruit are followed by juicy but restrained raspberry flavors. It shows a lovely sense of balance, tapering slightly toward the finish.
Name: Ott & Murphy 2013 Sugarloaf Vineyard Grenache (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very tasty, this full-bodied but not heavy wine has an earthy, irony vein running through ripe fruit and black-pepper flavors, giving it unusual complexity. The balance is good, lending a smooth but lively feeling on the palate.
Name: Iron Hub 2013 Estate Bottled Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of raspberry, cherry and orange peel are followed by full-throttle flavors that still display a sense of elegance. It shows some warmth on the finish.
Name: Rocky Point 2014 Boushey Vineyard Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, the aromas on this bottling are also a bit weak, with cinnamon and red fruits emerging with patience. It's light and lithe on the palate, with candied cherry, rose petals and tons of cracked pepper making for a lengthy, grippy sip.
Name: Rideau 2014 Estate Grenache (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is made in a ripe forward style, with lightly volatile aromas of apple, plum and dark raspberries. It's full bodied and pulls no punches as generous red and black-fruit flavors with cocoa accents show some warmth on the finish.
Name: Ryan Patrick 2013 Reserve Northridge Vineyard Grenache (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Alicante, this opens with delicate aromas of black-skinned fruit and a whiff of leather. The straightforward palate offers ripe black plum and cooking spice alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Poggio al Tufo 2012 Alicante (Toscana)

Appellation: Ventoux, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This high-end bottling features fruit from 90+-year-old vines, aged for 12 months in oak. It's medium to full in body, with supple tannins and crisp acids. Notes of barrel char and cherries finish dry, with a rustic edge.
Name: Marrenon 2014 Orca Vieilles Vignes Grenache (Ventoux)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: An unsual combination of almost-sweet fruit flavors and a vivid vegetal element makes this full-bodied, rustic wine an outlier.
Name: Jaxon Keys 2013 Estate Ravazzi Vineyard Grenache (Mendocino)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from Northridge Vineyard on the Wahluke Slope and Powerline Vineyard in the Walla Walla Valley, this pale colored wine delivers vibrant, complex aromas of strawberry, brown stems, fresh flowers, green olive, smoked meat and moist earth. The cranberry and smoked meat flavors are soft and sumptuous, leading to an extended fruit and savory note finish. It's all about elegance but the purity is dazzling.
Name: K Vintners 2014 The Boy Grenache (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine, which is 100% varietal, is a blend from the Upland, Stoney Vine and French Creek vineyards. Fermented using 75% whole cluster and seeing just 15% new oak, the emphasis is on freshness and purity. It displays aromas of stems, white pepper, earth, funk and black olive, with the Stoney Vine influence winning out. The earthy and savory palate-coating flavors heighten the interest, with fruit and savory notes sailing on the finish. There are lots of good things going on but it needs time to come together. Best after 2019.
Name: Sleight of Hand 2014 The Sorceress Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, this wine brings initially reserved aromas of raspberry, herb and mineral, along with a light earthiness. The palate is broad and quite pure in style. It shows more flesh than the winery is typically known for but still has no shortage of elegance and balance.
Name: Gramercy 2014 The Third Man Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This powerful wine puts purple plum and tart cherry fruit front and center. That fruit drives the bus through a dense palate, with a burst of acidity adding a turbo charge. It saw 25% new French oak.
Name: South Stage 2012 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla and cocoa mix with red fruit. The fruit flavors are full and palate coating but the oak seems a little too intense at times.
Name: Milbrandt 2012 Vineyard Series Clifton Vineyards Grenache (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of Monette's Vineyard Grenache and River Rock Syrah (15%). The volatiles are amped up, along with aromas of raspberries and herb. The flavors are full and liquorous, showing a fair amount of heat.
Name: Elephant Seven 2014 First and Mercer Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Look out for Colin Murphy, who was named winemaker at this estate after years working for regional legends Bruno d'Alfonso and Kris Curran. This bottling shows dark strawberry, incense, sandalwood, cola, figs, pepper and soy on the pretty yet complex nose. There is lots of intrigue to the palate too, where black plum comes together with chamomile, Earl Grey tea and lavender.
Name: Koehler 2013 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are intense, with notes of embers, stargazer lilies, funk, wet stone and black pepper. The palate dances gracefully, putting a premium on texture along, with generous amounts of savory flavors that persist on the long finish.
Name: Horsepower 2013 Sur Echalas Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas pop with notes of fresh flowers, smoked meat, stems, mineral, smoke, white pepper and an earthy funk. The flavors dance on the palate, with mouthwatering fruit and savory notes that lead to an outrageously long finish. It's equal parts elegance and intensity.
Name: No Girls 2013 La Paciencia Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is perfumed with notes of potpourri, red fruit, funk, crushed gravel, ash, olive, orange peel and peat. The palate explodes with fruit and savory flavors that bring a sense of depth but also a sense of elegance and weightlessness. A hyper-extended savory finish kicks it up a notch.
Name: Cayuse 2013 God Only Knows Armada Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and inviting on the nose, this wine is redolent with strawberries and hibiscus as well as cinnamon candy, fennel and chaparral. A sip grips the palate with polished tannins, offering baked black cherries in licorice sauce, rhubarb, smoke and earthy flavors.
Name: Anglim 2013 Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A very pretty pale-copper color with a tinge of pink, this wine offers delicate, nuanced aromas of orange peel and mineral. The palate has a lightly creamy feel, showing a lot of freshness and tension.
Name: Cayuse 2014 Edith Rosé Armada Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from certified Biodynamic grapes, this robust, 100% varietal red is lush and spicy, full bodied yet high in acidity and bright, fresh flavor. Red licorice, vanilla bean, baked strawberry and a hit of white pepper combine effortlessly for a satisfying experience.
Name: Quivira 2014 Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Terra Alta, Catalonia, Spain
Description: This blend of two types of Garnacha and some Carignan is a consistently top performer from this Catalonian region. This edition smells reedy and spicy, but also like ripe plum and raisin. A generous balanced palate holds flavors of vanilla, plum, cherry and peppery spice. On the finish, this is composed in feel, dry and spicy. Drink through 2019.
Name: Edetària 2014 Selecció Garnacha (Terra Alta)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling, which includes 8% Zinfandel and 3% Syrah, shows gingerbread, sandalwood, olallieberry, violet and maraschino cherry on the nose. It's delicate on the palate at first, with candied-strawberry flavors as well as cinnamon foam and purple flowers. It features a nice textural tension as well.
Name: Proulx 2014 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is dark in color for the variety, with aromas of cherry, raspberry, herb, wood spice and potpourri. The dark-cherry flavors are broad and rich, tapering toward the finish.
Name: Ambassador Vineyard 2013 Estate Grown Grenache (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Very ripe flavors make this wine seem almost sweet and the rich texture coats the mouth, augmenting the syrupy impression. Flavors suggest plump raspberries and fresh blackberries, while the finish brings out milk chocolate.
Name: Graziano 2013 Grenache (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Solano County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This dry wine has a medium-dark color with a mahogany rim. It offers strong berry, black pepper and clove aromas and flavors, and a broad, smooth texture. It's full bodied, mouthfilling and spicy.
Name: Gauguine 2013 Grenache (Solano County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Intensely fruity and subtle in oak, this wine is smooth and juicy, with a pronounced sense of cherry and strawberry. Substantive tannin provides weight and breadth, along with a grippy, leathery finish.
Name: Kobler 2014 Campbell-McKinney Vineyards Grenache (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of cherry syrup, cola and cinnamon emerge from this bottling, which features artistic labels that always impress the eye. The palate shows dark red fruit and baking spice, as well as a minerality that combines rust and gravel.
Name: Archium 2014 Haven Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Solano County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine has big aromas like baking spices, prunes and figs, while flavors recalling maple syrup and chocolate seem to coat the palate. Although technically dry, it feels sweet and lush.
Name: Putah Creek 2013 Grenache (Solano County)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A light cherry-red color, this wine offers bright aromas of strawberry and cherry. It drinks off dry, with lightly spritzy fruit flavors that come off as a bit weighty and ponderous.
Name: Columbia Winery 2015 Limited Release Rosé Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Light in color, with some browning around the edges, this 100% varietal wine is powdery in texture with mellowed acidity. Baked strawberry makes an appearance as the finish approaches.
Name: Meeker 2013 Hoskins Ranch Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Ile de Beauté, France
Description: This soft, young wine is all about red-berry fruits. With a touch of spice and acidity, it is should be drunk quickly while its fruitiness remain fresh.
Name: Domaine Marengo 2014 Emiliu Grenache (Ile de Beauté)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Not much of this wine was made, the grapes coming from a vineyard in the heart of the appellation farmed by Phil Coturri. Earthy and light in oak, it struggles to show fruit, remaining more about minerally and compostable aromas.
Name: Sergio 2014 Steel Plow Vineyard Grenache (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The first of Folin's 2014s to be released, this excellent wine is 100% varietal, and done in a spicy, assertive style. Loaded with garrigue-like wild herb scents and streaked with the same flavors, it's peppery, bold and exciting.
Name: Folin Cellars 2014 Estate Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The extreme youth of this stylishly packaged wine is on full display, with exuberant notes of crushed cranberry, raspberry, Earl Grey tea and rosewater on the nose. Lively acidity on the sip carries flavors of dried red fruit and touches of leather and tobacco. It's almost soda pop-like, and would go great with a slight chill on a warm day near the water.
Name: Last Summer 2015 Grenache (San Luis Obispo)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine walks its own path, smelling like flowers, honey and ripe peaches. It tastes fresh, nicely tart, lightly tannic and floral, making for an adventurous and energizing path to take.
Name: Donkey & Goat 2015 Grenache Noir Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Peppers and cloves accent cherry-berry fruit on the nose of this single-vineyard wine. On the palate, it's full bodied and deep and silky in texture, with a long spice-inflected finish.
Name: D'Arenberg 2010 The Derelict Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Exuberant dried-flower aromas kick off the nose on this wine that shows rosebuds and lilacs before diving into heady notes of cola, olallieberry, blackberry and touches of tobacco, cocoa and cappuccino. The floral tones extend to the palate that is balanced between black raspberry and rosewater flavors, spiced with a touch of white pepper.
Name: Moxy 2011 Grenache (Monterey County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rich in body but light in tannins, this warm, generous wine fills the mouth and eases down the throat. It has a good mélange of cherry, strawberry and floral aromas, satisfying fruit flavors and a nicely soft finish.
Name: Cedarville 2013 Estate Bottled Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark in the glass, this bottling, which is one of the first from this promising vineyard on the northern edge of the tiny appellation, offers concentrated clove, rosebud and olallieberry aromas. On the sip, there are flavors of dark boysenberry, black raspberry, anise, sage and a bit of black tea.
Name: Kimsey 2013 Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Terra Alta, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Aromas of blackberry, cassis, raisin and woodspice suggest that this varietal Garnacha is ripe. That's confirmed on the palate, which feels chunky and full, with modest acidic edge. Ripe, roasted, fully oaked flavors of black fruits finish minty and spicy, with notes of clove and coffee. Drink this full-bodied, fairly soft wine through 2018.
Name: Cellers Tarroné 2013 Seguit Grenache (Terra Alta)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Berry, cassis and cola aromas are bold and stout. This Garnacha feels full and clampy. Plum, blackberry and leathery flavors are strong and secure, and the wine finishes in composed fashion, with rubbery, chewy tannins.
Name: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2015 Menguante Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Chalone, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light in the glass, this bottling shows crushed thyme and oregano herbs along with hibiscus, pomegranate and red-cherry fruit on the nose. The palate offers a fruit-punch character at first, with flavors of sour mulberries providing further intrigue.
Name: Flywheel 2014 Boer Vineyard Grenache (Chalone)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine has aromas of exotic woods like cedar and mahogany, then focused cherry and prune flavors, medium-full body and a texture that's light on tannins and juicy in the mouth. Minor amounts of Mourvèdre, Syrah and Petite Sirah were blended in.
Name: Prima Materia 2013 Grenache (Lake County)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of red-berry chewing gum and stone-fruit pits announce a full-bodied, pulpy wine with flavors of orange juice and citrus peel that fall off on the finish. Drink this rosé soon.
Name: Finca Albret 2015 Rosado Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Plum and berry aromas are a touch prickly, as if there were notes of herbs and wild pasture infused into this Garnacha. Tight and drawing on the palate, this tastes of black fruits, chocolate and savory spices. A firm, tannic, rubbery-feeling finish maintains the wine's integrity.
Name: Legado del Moncayo 2015 Old Vines Montaña Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Black-fruit aromas come with notes of leather, horsehide and mint. In the mouth, this is medium to full in body, with enough juicy acidity to preserve balance. Blackberry, cherry and stewed-plum flavors are sound on the finish.
Name: Marques de la Musa 2015 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jumpy berry aromas are young, simple and raw. This feels fresh but jagged, with clean but basic pomegranate and berry flavors. An edgy palate with juicy acidity helps to maintain the wine's integrity.
Name: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2015 Corona de Aragón Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gritty, earthy berry aromas lack refinement. This wine has a narrow, blocky mouthfeel and salty flavors of baked plum and carob. That same roasted, salty character carries over onto the finish.
Name: Campos de Luz 2014 Estate Wine Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy, herbal, tomatoey aromas suggest pizza. This feels wide and rubbery, while minty, earthy plum flavors hold onto that same leafy, green character on the finish.
Name: Marques de la Musa 2010 Reserva Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of black-cherry chewing gum, raspberry and plum are simple but solid. This feels full, fruity and a touch clampy. Black-fruit flavors of plum and blackberry finish with grabby tannins.
Name: Legado del Moncayo 2015 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gritty, roasted, oaky aromas out-muscle this Garnacha's fruit scents. A solid but aged mouthfeel and flavors of earthy, spicy plum and tomato finish desiccated and flat. Drink immediately.
Name: Campos de Luz 2010 Estate Wine Reserva Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Grapy aromas of plum and pomegranate turn more wild with airing. Grabby, tannic and punchy across the palate, this wine tastes of herbal berry fruits, with a firm finish.
Name: Bodegas Paniza 2015 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This basic Garnacha is slightly horsey and volatile on the nose, but ample berry aromas push it towards a full, grapy palate. Baked black-fruit flavors taste roasted and a touch charred on the back side.
Name: Borsao 2015 Viña Borgia Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Baked aromas of raisin, prune and black cherry are also oaky. This feels and tastes stewed. Flavors of baked berries and marshmallow finish with a note of chocolate and a grabby, heavy feel.
Name: Lelia 2014 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Flat, lightly oxidized aromas don't impress. The palate on this Garnacha rosé is dull like the nose, with low acidity. Candied, generic flavors are slightly bitter and pithy.
Name: Ochoa 2015 Calendas Rosado Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine brings pleasingly pure notes of red fruit, bramble, black olive and earth. The flavors are full, lush and pure, backed by tart, cranberry-like acidity and a lengthy finish. It's a compelling example of the variety, showing very pretty nuances.
Name: Block Wines 2014 Boushey Vineyard Golden Block Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Three-quarters of this wine is from Boushey Vineyard in the Yakima Valley with the rest from Monette's in the Walla Walla Valley. The aromas are redolent with notes of raspberries, kirsch and white pepper. The palate has a compelling mouthfeel and a dazzling sense of purity,
Name: Maison Bleue 2013 Bourgeois Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of fresh raspberries, flowers and dried herbs are followed by full-bodied, succulent red-fruit flavors. It shows a pleasing sense of purity and elegance to the jammy fruit flavors.
Name: Idilico 2013 Garnacha (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pale pink in color, this wine offers nice touches of bubblegum and watermelon, with lively white pepper for a complex twist. Clean and lovely lines of pink strawberry, rocky minerality and more of that intriguing pepper spice continue on the palate that leaves the mouth watering. It's a great pink.
Name: Koehler 2015 Rose of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of baking spices and red and black raspberries lead to plentiful red-fruit flavors. It lingers on the finish.
Name: Novelty Hill 2013 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Heavy oak and herbal berry aromas start this old vines Garnacha. Give it some breathing time. Grabby, sticky and a bit narrow in the mouth, this tastes of woody blueberry with herbal overtones. Minty oak and strong tannins push the finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Bodegas San Valero 2012 Viñas Centenarias Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Rivesaltes, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Dark, decadent notes of dried cherry and fig lead the bouquet of this seductive wine, with supporting notes of wood spice, cocoa powder, pressed purple flowers and rum raisin adding depth and character. The medium-weight palate boasts velvety tannins and rich black-fruit flavors that finish full and chocolaty.
Designation: Domaine de Bila-Haut Vin Doux Naturel
Name: M. Chapoutier 2001 Domaine de Bila-Haut Vin Doux Naturel Grenache (Rivesaltes)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Concentrated aromas of raspberry, black cherry and blackberry set up a palate with moderately structured tannins. Flavors of blackberry, cassis and toast are nuanced. While this wine is dark and grapy on the finish, with a sense of smoothness. rounds it out.
Name: Algairen 2015 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine shows a unique aroma profile of sweet herb, apricot and red plum, along with a kiss of vanilla bean. The flavors are light and elegant, showing subtlety and restraint along with a pleasing sense of purity.
Name: Tempus Cellars 2013 Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A nice salmon color, this subtle kitchen-sink pink blend of 77% Grenache, 8% Mission, 4% Petite Sirah, 4% Syrah, 4% Zinfandel, 1% Cabernet Sauvignon, 1% Merlot and 1% Petit Verdot offers clove, raspberry and light plum on the nose. The palate offers more raspberry, a touch of bubblegum and a concrete-driven mineral tension that makes for excellent texture.
Name: Proulx 2015 Willow Creek Farm Rose of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is pale peach in color. It starts with aromas of strawberry, herb and spice that lead to juicy, just-off-dry, well-balanced fruit flavors that provide a whole lot of appeal.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Alder Ridge Vineyard Rosé Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Floral plum and black cherry aromas are nice and fruity. A bright, juicy, simple palate holds flavors of plum, blackberry and chocolate. While nothing sticks out on the finish, this Garnacha ends nicely and overdelivers.
Name: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2015 El Circo Acróbato Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lightly pink in color with a hint of orange, this bottling, which includes 20% Grenache Blanc, shows rose petals and a touch of watermelon shaved ice on the shy nose. The palate is very steely, reserved and tense, with only hints of light strawberry emerging. The wine is more about texture than flavor.
Name: J. Lohr 2015 Gesture Rose of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine's dark-pink color borders on mauve, indicative of the darker style that ensues. Aromas of dried cherry, kirsch and orange peel are a tad boozy. The palate offers brown spice, cherry, black plum and nutmeg flavors, proving flavorful though not as refreshing as many other pink wines.
Name: Sextant 2014 Rose of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Bouncy berry and cherry aromas are more or less standard for basic Garnacha. This wine feels a bit gummy and grabby, but not sticky. Lightly herbal, minty dark-berry flavors finish herbal, chocolaty and a touch green.
Name: Castillo de Monséran 2015 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Lightly green aromas of herbal red plum and cinnamon lead to a hard, closed, edgy palate. Minimal red-fruit flavors are herbal and finish scratchy, tannic and raw.
Name: Ignacio Marín 2012 Ballad Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Basic plum and black cherry aromas come with hints of baking spices and cinnamon. This feels a bit high in acidity and pinchy. While a quick wash of grapy, black-fruit flavors finishes without much noise.
Name: Beso de Vino 2015 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Stalky, gritty, earthy plum aromas are minimally ripe. This feels firm, grabby, chunky and rough all in one. Gritty, unusually-bready berry flavors finish herbal and dry.
Name: Bodegas Paniza 2012 Viñas Viejas de Paniza Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Fully ripe black-fruit aromas are rubbery and edgy. This feels jammy, heavy and simple. Flavors of syrupy blackberry and crème de cassis finish sweet and grapy with a sense of syrupy weight.
Name: Bodegas San Valero 2015 Particular Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is a prime example of McLaren Vale Grenache. It's full-bodied and supple in feel, yet structured enough to support a fruit bowl of plums, raspberries and cherries. Clove and cinnamon notes add complexity to the fruit-filled finish.
Name: Penny's Hill 2014 The Experiment Estate Single Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a vineyard in the hills overlooking the Santa Clara Valley, this bottling shows baked strawberry, cinnamon cream, Red Hots and black-plum juice, proving quite pretty if a tad candied on the nose. A light cinnamon-clove meringue flavor proves very inviting on the palate, where lush black cherry is leveled by a tart plum-skin grip.
Name: Storrs 2012 Grenache (Central Coast)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: A step up from the solid 2013, this vintage offers more vivid raspberry fruit and cracked pepper. It's a bit jammy, but then some dried spices emerge on the finish, reining things in and imparting welcome complexity. Drink now–2023.
Name: Angove 2014 Warboys Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red cherry, kola nut, root beer, brown spice and a touch of smoke pull the nose deeply into this bottling by Blair Fox and Eli Parker. Baked red and black plum, a touch of mulberry and bloody, earthy flavors mark the palate, which is quite complex and bound together with a strong tannic structure.
Name: Epiphany 2013 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Expertly integrated aromas of black plum, vanilla cola, light clove, pralines and a touch of caramel cream show on the nose of this bottling by a Sta. Rita Hills producer that sourced from up north. Wild berries, red cherry and black raspberry pop on the palate, where an earthy tension of chipped slate meets with a baked goods richness.
Name: Zotovich Cellars 2013 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Understated plum, earth and spice aromas give an indication that this is not a casual, fruity Grenache. It is warm and supple, yet features enough dried-spice complexity to merit slow sipping and even savoring the lingering finish.
Name: Mr. Riggs 2014 The Magnet Generation Series Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Full bodied and supple, this is a dark wine with ample fruit. Cassis and black cherry notes pick up hints of cola on the finish. Drink now–2020.
Name: Angove 2013 Warboys Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Rose hips and petals, potpourri, ginger snaps and dark strawberry show on the lush nose of this bottling by Don Lorenzi, whose Italian family has been making wine for generations. Strawberry and lush cherry flavors meet with increasignly prominent nutmeg and allspice once sipped. The palate is quite hearty and full of dried fruit.
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2012 The Rainbow Gap Vineyard Grenache (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This pure Grenache is an elegant wine, one that might be mistaken for Pinot Meunier, given its light hue and stiff tannins. Pretty raspberry and cherry fruit comes up slowly—give it plenty of aeration—and the more it breathes, the less those tannins take away from the fruit.
Name: Jaxon 2013 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Peaches and rosewater are the dominant flavors in this tasty, all Grenache rosé. Though it comes across as a bit one dimensional, that dimension has plenty of fruity appeal, supported with lemony acids and a hint of bitter rind.
Name: Quady North 2015 Rosé of Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cinnamon spice meets with rose petal, cola, red cherry and dried violets on the nose of this bottling by veteran Terry Culton. The palate is tasty but not overly complex, with black cherry, earthy fennel and sage, and a touch of tobacco into the finish.
Name: Culton 2013 Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Crisp and edgy, featuring tart cherry fruit and hints of green peppercorn. It's fairly big in the mouth, but lacks a bit of generosity.
Name: Wirra Wirra 2014 The Absconder Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is a dense, ripe and fruity wine, with forward aromas and flavors of black plum, cherry and muddled berries that are kissed by sweet spice. Medium acidity and supple tannins result in a plush yet accessible and well-balanced palate. Drink now.
Name: Le Paradou 2014 Grenache (Vin de France)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Crafted by Syncline winemaker James Mantone, the aromas of raspberry, kirsch and spice show a pleasing sense of harmony. The red-fruit flavors are layered, showing intensity and precision, with the tannins bringing some grip. The balance is spot-on throughout.
Name: Force Majeure 2013 Collaboration Series Force Majeure Vineyard Grenache (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A very pale copper color, this wine is aromatically expressive with notes of strawberry and cherry bubblegum along with light herbal notes. The palate drinks dry with electric acidity that makes the fruit flavors snap, with citrus notes that persist on the finish.
Name: Kerloo 2015 Rosé Painted Hills Vineyard Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark orange-pink in color, this meaty, substantial wine doesn't skimp on flavor or body. It presents a rewarding and intense celebration of raspberry and cherry that delights on the palate and will do well at the table, indoor or out.
Name: Kobler 2015 Rosé of Grenache (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla, baking spice, dark-fruit and herb aromas are followed by elegant cranberry and raspberry flavors. Spice flavors linger on the finish. It's a pretty expression of the variety, showing impeccable balance.
Name: Bunnell 2011 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This pale salmon-colored wine shows bright aromas of watermelon and strawberry. The palate drinks dry with mouthwateringly tart fruit flavors.
Name: Browne Family Vineyards 2015 Rosé Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine, which is 100% varietal, is a blend of fruit from Art Den Hoed and Gunkel vineyards. Aromas of cranberry, clove and fresh flowers are followed by coffee and floral flavors that show elegance and persistence.
Name: Maryhill 2013 Proprietor's Reserve Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This heavily oaked Garnacha smells largely of campfire and char. A drawing, chunky palate is bold and deep, with flavors of hickory, char and blackberry. With such forceful oak, this finishes woody, meaty and with pushy flavors of clove and mint.
Name: Coto de Hayas 2013 Centenaria Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cherry and black plum aromas are oaky and smoky. Full, blocky and a bit awkward on the palate, this Garnacha tastes of minty, oaky clove, roasted plum and black currant. A saucy, semi-oaked finish is solid enough.
Name: Bodegas Aragonesas 2013 Dom Ramon Imperial Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A mellow, mildly fruity nose is like a cypher. This feels limited but healthy and compact. Cherry, plum and spice aromas are basic, while this tastes of generic berry fruits on the finish. Garnacha with some Tempranillo is the blend.
Name: Bodegas Aragonesas 2013 Don Ramón Vino Tinto Barrica Red (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jammy plum aromas with a note of lawn cuttings precede a palate with astringent tannins and harshness. Roasted plum flavors are a touch spicy, while this finishes rough, drying and hot.
Name: Bodegas Aletta 2013 Veraz Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Soupy, volatile plum and berry aromas are stalky. The palate is adequate but sticky, while saucy but sweet plum flavors fall off quickly on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Aragonesas 2013 Viña Temprana Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This stellar wine has a huge yum factor. Deliciously ripe and spicy, it's loaded with cranberry and raspberry fruit. There's an underlying tang of pink grapefruit acidity, along with aromatic highlights of violets and rose petals. Drink now through 2022.
Name: Cowhorn 2013 21 Grenache (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoked oregano, black plum, dark berries and loamy soil notes come through on this bottling by one of this appellation's original families. Dark plum, blackberry, crushed black rocks, iron and touches of dried mint and white sage come through on the savory palate. This bottling aims more for power than finesse in this variable grape.
Name: Beckmen 2013 Purisima Mountain Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This producer is showing true skill with this variety, vibrant in red and black cherry and cassis. Bright and satisfyingly generous on the palate, it's succulent as well as being earthy, with lingering layers of black pepper and cinnamon. It never gets heavy or burdensome, maintaining a fleetness of freshness that's irresistible.
Name: Kokomo 2014 Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The most interesting of Sonja Magdevski's extensive study of the Grenache grape, this bottling shows very fresh cherry juice and dried roses as well as inviting splashes of Dr. Pepper, kola nut and sarsaparilla on the nose. Once sipped, crushed cinnamon and star anise give nuance to the ripe cranberry fruit and there are even dashes of iron and coffee flavors.
Name: Casa Dumetz 2014 Thompson Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Mulberries and exotic plums mix with river rocks and hibiscus flowers on the nose of this very quaffable and inviting bottling, one of the best in the winery's Grenache study. It's broad and playful on the palate with flavors that perfectly reflect the aromas. With a slight chill, this would be a great red for brunch.
Name: Casa Dumetz 2014 Tierra Alta Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Closed and in need of air at first, this takes on a ripe, medicinal, almost candied red-fruit nose. Next up is a full, wide-bodied palate with chunky plum and raspberry flavors. This old-vines Garnacha is ripe, tasty and all about the fruit. Drink through 2020.
Name: Palacios Remondo 2011 Propiedad  (Rioja)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded plum and berry aromas grow more complex thanks to hints of sarsparilla bark, rose buds, cinnamon stick and nutmeg on the nose of this cool-climate bottling. The palate is quite peppery, with dried red flowers, red plums, peppercorns, strawberries and a texturally earthy core of fine-grained tannins.
Name: Stephen Ross 2013 Jespersen Ranch Grenache (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Full of the lushness that comes with this brand in all forms, this bottling shows vanilla cake, toasty oak, red fruit, abundant baking spice, molasses and a touch of freshly shaved pork roast. The palate is heavy duty with similar flavors and even some fudge, which albeit delicious, hides much of the grape's varietal beauty.
Name: Austin Hope 2013 Grenache (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich cherry jam, dew-covered thyme and a touch of licorice show on this bottling from a vineyard on the eastern fringe of the Sta. Rita Hills. Round red fruits and an anise character show right away on the palate, which grows more complex with pencil lead, cinnamon and dried herbs.
Name: Casa Dumetz 2014 John Sebastiano Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite dark in color, brooding aromas of olallieberry, blackberry, grape soda, plums and concentrated purple flowers appease the nose on this bottling from one of Paso's newly designated appellations. The palate blends licorice, turned earth and eucalyptus with a fresh pomegranate juice flavor.
Name: Brecon Estate 2013 Estate Grenache (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is tons of lively action packed into the nose of this wine, from rosebuds and zesty cherry cola to cinnamon spice and rainbow peppercorns. The texture is relatively light on the sip, and yet grippy tannins and a bursting acidity swim across the palate, showing vibrant iron and red-fruit flavors.
Name: Santa Cruz Mountain Vineyard 2014 Hook Vineyard Grenache (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy berry and raisin aromas announce a warm, ripe wine. This feels plump, grapy and chunky, with moderate acidity. Grapy, bold flavors of raspberry, prune and cherry are earthy and loamy, while ripeness and a raisiny element carry onto the finish. Drink through 2019.
Name: Contino 2011  Rioja

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The most reserved of this winery's Grenache studies, this bottling shows baked red cherry, red currant, cola and slate on the nose. An iron-based minerality shows on the earthy palate, which also offers chipped slate, cranberry and tart cherry elements. It's a tad light but still intriguingly textured.
Name: Casa Dumetz 2014 Larner Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the vineyard once known as Alisos comes this wine, with aromas of soft clove, red cherry and a touch of sage. A strong ginger spice reigns over the palate, which is bitingly acidic, and shows dark strawberry fruit and dark thyme herbs. This wine is still quite wound up, but that acidity will prove mouthwatering for years to come.
Name: Casa Dumetz 2014 Flower & VIne Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy and lightly peppery, this fresh rosé brings concentrated strawberry fruit into focus. Made from organically grown grapes, it expands into a full-bodied finish with a lick of milk chocolate.
Name: Upper Five 2015 Rosé of Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This red-fruit-dominated Garnacha smells of earthy cherry and plum along with orange peel. A racy, chewy, slightly rough palate of pie cherry, red plum, raisin and chocolate finish juicy and aggressive.
Name: Baron De Ley 2012 Varietales  (Rioja)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This full-bodied red opens with aromas of ripe plum, vanilla and a hint of charred topsoil. The warm, chewy palate has flavors of ripe black cherry, licorice, baking spice and coffee bean while a note of bitter almond signals the finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Tenute Soletta 2010 Keramos Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bit shy on the nose, this appellation-blend bottling shows light cola, red cherry and wet slate aromas. The palate is tightly wound and very earthy, with turned loam, strong wet clay, oregano, sage, pomegranate and hibiscus elements all playing together nicely.
Name: Casa Dumetz 2014 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied, well-balanced wine has peppery, light-smoke aromas, modest rhubarb flavors and interesting white pepper and raspberry notes. It has personality and a rustic, authentic appeal.
Name: Skinner 2013 Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Heavy prune and raisin aromas are perfumed and rich, but arguably a bit overripe. Matching the nose, this feels thick, saturated and grapy. Flavors of black plum and blueberry finish chunky, with muscularity but also a rubbery flavor note.
Name: Vivanco 2011 Colección  (Rioja)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A light cedary, floral aroma starts this full-bodied wine on an interesting note, and similar flavor complexity continues. It feels nicely astringent on the palate, as fine tannins and good acidity keep it lively.
Name: Andis 2013 Grenache (Amador County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This brawny wine has attractive oaky, smoky, spicy aromas, generous fruit and spice flavors, full body and a good, gripping layer of tannin to add texture.
Name: Vasco Urbano 2013 Norm, Marina Ranch Grenache (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fully 25% of the wine is Syrah, which adds color and helps to bolster the fruit. Red berries provide a light base for a wine with plenty of barrel flavors of toast and coffee grounds.
Name: Reustle 2014 Hebron Bloc Grenache (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gritty, granular, medicinal aromas smell reedy and like crushed vitamins. A choppy palate and flavors of plum, grape juice and raspberry end with cutting tannins and the essence of raspberry.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2012 Conde Valdemar  (Rioja)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Light strawberry, earth and rose-petal aromas add to the blackberry flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It feels tight and tastes lean now, so it's best to drink after 2019.
Name: Rock Wall 2014 Abba Vineyard Grenache (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and earthy-tasting wine has berries and cherries in the aroma and beefy, savory flavors that fill out the rather tannic texture nicely.
Name: Melée 2012 Grenache (California)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Black cherry and plum aromas are solid. This is chunky and heavyset, but comfortable across the palate. Generic plum and berry flavors are pure, while this finishes plump, chunky and with a hint of chocolate.
Name: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2014 Menguante Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Rubbery black plum and berry aromas lead to a fresh, tight palate with astringent tannins. Generic berry flavors are angular, while this everyday Garnacha is tannic and scratchy on the finish.
Name: Castillo de Monséran 2014 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Grapy and perfumed on the nose, this quaffable Garnacha is sound and fresh, albeit a bit acidic. Black-fruit flavors are common and show notes of earth and chocolate, while a grabby finish displays no glaring faults.
Name: Beso de Vino 2014 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jumpy, candied-cherry and berry aromas are straight from Kool-Aid city. Fresh on the palate, with pure but simple cherry, plum and raspberry flavors, this is meant for simple sipping. Serve lightly chilled for best results.
Name: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2014 El Circo Acróbata Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Why this basic Garnacha is so oaky is a question that deserves to be asked. That said, it's still a healthy, balanced wine with grabby tannins and good energy. Dry, woody notes of spice and clove accent sappy plum flavors.
Name: Bodegas San Valero 2014 Particular Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine smells fruity, like raspberry and cranberries, and turns very tart and astringent on the palate. Sharp fruit flavors come out on the finish along with a metallic edge.
Name: Los Portales 2013 Garnacha (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean and tight aromas of strawberry essence mesh with dried violets, rose petals, star anise and clove on this engaging while classically profiled bottling. It's light and lively on the palate, with tons of bright red fruit and cinnamon spice, showing cranberry tang in the midpalate and the structural bones to hold up its energetic game for years.
Name: Jaffurs 2012 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With healthy dashed of Syrah (19%) and Mourvèdre (5%), this wine drinks as much like a Rhone-style blend as a varietal wine. The aromas offer a very pretty balance of red and blue fruit, accented by generous amounts of black pepper, high-toned herbs and moist earth. The flavors have crystalline clarity, dancing lightly on the palate and ending with a coffee filled finish. It provides a lot of delicacy and nuance, only ramping up over time.
Name: Gramercy 2013 The Third Man Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is an intrigue of lavender, rose and kirsch, young in firm tight tannins and tension. Black pepper, cherry and a light-bodied weight provide smooth drinkability and elegance, just waiting for the tannin to settle down. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Byington 2014 Smith Vineyards Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine has just about the lightest pink color possible, very tempting floral and cherry aromas, and vibrant, mouthwatering cherry and grapefruit flavors. It's essentially light in body but so alive with fruit that it will drink well with almost any dish.
Name: Clif Family 2015 Rosé of Grenache (Mendocino)

Appellation: Somontano, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Plum, berry, rubber and herbal aromas are earthy and solid as a whole. This Garnacha is dry and complex across the palate, with peppery, herbal flavors of plum, cherry and raspberry. Cocoa and spice notes drive a finish with medium intensity and an overriding sense of freshness. Drink through 2020.
Name: Viñas del Vero 2010 Secastilla Garnacha (Somontano)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe raspberries, plump alpine strawberries and cranberry-cola notes meet with shaved cinnamon, pencil lead and dried sage on the nose of this single vineyard expression. The flavors are focused on woody red fruits, with chaparral scrub highlights as well as bay leaf and juniper. It's relatively light but well layered.
Name: Comartin 2013 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A plush style of the grape, this shows blackberry and black plum fruit, lush purple flowers, baking spice and a dusting of graphite on the nose. The palate is soft and cola-driven, with blackberry puree, woody elderberry and violet flavors. The tannic structure enhance its robust character.
Name: Grey Wolf Cellars 2013 Instinctual Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a full-bodied version of the variety and yet it rides a line of soft texture and floral aromatics that ground it in nice ways. Meaty and fruity in cherry, it finishes thick and rich.
Name: C R Graybehl 2014 Mathis Vineyard Grenache (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass but unmistakably pink, this Grenache-based rose shows a lime-driven citrus rind character on the crisp nose, gaining a touch of fruit from delicate watermelon and slight bubblegum scents. There is a touch of effervescence on the palate, where delicious and zesty lime, pink peach and more watermelon flavors come into play.
Name: Margerum 2015 Riviera Rosé of Grenache (Central Coast)

Appellation: Somontano, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of cherry, spicy tomato sauce and herbs turn more open and jammy as this breathes. A fresh, juicy, choppy palate is home to bright cherry, currant and plum flavors, while the finish is snappy and lightning quick.
Name: Viñas del Vero 2013 La Miranda Secastilla Garnacha (Somontano)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Fresh for the summer season is this tutti-frutti Navarran Garnacha. Pink in color and pumped up, this tastes of pink grapefruit, nectarine and citrus pith. It's all about freshness and drinkability.
Name: Príncipe de Viana 2015 Edición Rosa Grenache (Navarra)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Horseradish and berry aromas are a touch rough and tough. This tannic Garnacha features a pinched, hard mouthfeel and tight, drawing flavors of berry fruits and plum. Peppery harshness and rubbery tannins define the finish.
Name: Filón 2013 Filón Real Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has an intensity of strawberry that permeates thoughout, riding atop a distinct earthiness that becomes slightly sour on the finish. Medium bodied, its aromatics are all roses.
Name: C R Graybehl 2014 Mounts Family Vineyards Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is a touch stalky and rough on the nose, while in the mouth it's raw, choppy and boxed in. Cherry and plum flavors pick up speed on the palate and taste slightly gamy and burnt on the finish.
Name: Tres Ojos 2012 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Berry aromas are straightforward and solid enough. This has a sticky, grabby mouthfeel and oaky flavors of plum and stewed berries. All in all, it's a decent wine with a slathering of vanilla oak on the finish.
Name: Stylo 2014 Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of jammy, candied berry fruits and wet dog fur amount to a murky whole. This is high in acidity, with a mishmash of berry and creamy, plastic-like flavors. A smear of oak dominates the finish.
Name: Albada 2013 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Barossa, South Australia, Australia
Description: Grenache is being treated with more and more respect around Australia, which means more bottlings are reaching the variety's potential. Gentle herbal notes intertwine with bunches of black cherries and a hint of vanilla in this medium- to full-bodied example. Hints of red peppercorn capture a unique combination of fruit and spice, while the finish is long and crisp.
Name: Langmeil 2013 The Fifth Wave Grenache (Barossa)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Not many $30 wines can offer fruit from 100-year-old vines, but this one does. It's full bodied and rich, with notes of plum and black cherries supported by hints of chocolate and vanilla. With its long, velvety finish, there's no reason to defer gratification, although it should drink well through at least 2020.
Name: Mr. Riggs 2013 Generation Series The Magnet Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Layers of fresh purple flowers, from lilacs to lavender, meld with dried rose petals, cinnamon, concentrated hibiscus, orange rind and black tea on the wondrous nose of this bottling. A sanguine character starts the sip before it evolves into dried strawberry and a mix of lavender, mint and thyme, framed by bright acidity and lush texture.
Name: Big Basin 2012 Coastview Vineyard Grenache (Monterey County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Exotic scents and flavors highlight this bottling by Doug Margerum that packs crushed kola nut, red roses, cinnamon stick, vanilla and a dewy lavender into the nose. The palate bursts with cologne-like qualities, combining raspberry, mulberry, pomegranate and heirloom plums with violets, lilacs and more purple and dark-red flowers.
Name: Margerum 2013 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: More brooding in style, this deliciously rich bottling shows dense black cherry, black plum, blackberry and stewed strawberry on the nose alongside black cardamom, anise and curry spice. Layers of smoked meat and hoisin sauce decorate the purple flowers, dried red cherry and pencil-lead flavors of the palate.
Name: Villa San Juliette 2013 Reserve Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Barossa, South Australia, Australia
Description: John Duval (ex Penfolds) has finally released a varietal Grenache, a wine that's quite different from the blends and Shirazes he's done up until this point. This is supple, full in body and round, without the firm structural elements his wines typically possess. Dare I say it's hedonistic? Black cherry and cinnamon notes are juicy and mouthwatering on the long finish. Drink now–2020.
Name: John Duval Wines 2013 Annexus Grenache (Barossa)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite dark for the grape, this wine from the Carpinteria estate of Rick and Penny Morales shows red plums, pepper, dried oregano, cooked beef, hoisin and mint chocolate on the lush nose. Though the wine is five years old, the tannins remain quite present on the palate, where bay leaf, black cardamom, espresso, cedar and exotic spices give depth to the black plum and dark strawberry fruit.
Name: Paredon 2011 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This international venture based out of the former Nepenthe winery in the Adelaide Hills sources fruit from a number of vineyards in South Australia. This bottling is light on its feet for its 15% stated abv, showcasing fresh cherry fruit, gentle herbal notes and silky tannins. Drink now–2022.
Designation: Thorny Devil Old Vine Single Vineyard
Name: Thistledown 2013 Thorny Devil Old Vine Single Vineyard Grenache (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fresh, enticing fruit aromas and a smooth yet firm texture make this full-bodied wine hard to resist. Toasted oak, ripe berries and cherries gush from the glass, and light tannins add grip to the generous mouthfeel.
Name: Baiocchi Wines 2013 Sharon's Vineyard Grenache (Fair Play)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The bouquet on this wine by Matthias Pippig is rather thick for the grape, with dark strawberry, black raspberry and red-cherry fruit warmed up by snapped sage sticks, sarsaparilla, slate earthiness and a touch of tobacco. Black plum and red currant show on the dense palate, where sticky tannins present black peppercorn, raw beef and eucalyptus complexity.
Name: Sanguis 2012 Verve Grenache (Central Coast)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Just tiny amounts of this wine (25 cases) are available in the U.S. market, but it represents a trend in Australia of celebrating old-vine Grenache. A blend of two parcels from the Blewitt Springs and Seaview subregions, this is silky in texture, with crisp red cherries shot through with herbal streaks and a slightly warm finish.
Name: Thistledown 2013 The Vagabond Old Vine Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deemed “The Imaginary One,” this bottling shows a combination of spice and fruit on the nose, with gingersnap, red berry and strawberry aromas. There's woody complexity on the crisp and clean palate, with cedar, incense, sandalwood, star anise and clove set against a red berry and fruit-punch frame.
Name: Vie Winery 2012 L'Imaginaire Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From an extreme coastal site, this earthy wine from Ryan Carr offers root beer, cola, red roses, sage, and hibiscus on the nose as well as pomegranate and stewed strawberries. Tangy red cherry fruit shows on the acid-laced palate, with warmer cinnamon, cappuccino and lavender florality.
Name: Carr 2013 Paredon Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh red cherry and plump red currants are spiced up by Dr Pepper, cola, rose petals, mace and dried fennel on the nose of this bottling by Sabrine Rodems. Tea and Asian five-spice notes arise once sipped, backed by raspberries and pink peppercorns, altogether fairly light and lithe in body.
Name: Wrath 2013 Alta Loma Vineyard Grenache (Monterey)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Brisk and lively, this wine is a bit shy on the nose at first, then reveals red and purple flowers, dark fruit, brown spice and a touch of shattered asphalt. The palate is quite tarry despite being lighter, with blackberry-juice flavor and lots of acidic pizzaz.
Name: Alta Colina 2012 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly funky aromas of dried, composting red and purple roses meet with crushed mint, vanilla and red berries on the nose of this complex bottling. Pomegranate, red plum and strawberry fruit show on the palate, bolstered by wet gravel, thyme and black-pepper spice.
Name: Clos LaChance 2013 Reserve Grenache (Central Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass and a bit shy on aroma at first, this bright wine eventually shows candied strawberry, cherry, cranberry, cinnamon and allspice notes on the nose. The palate is lean and fresh, with raspberry, cranberry, pencil lead and dried herbs all playing a role.
Name: Adelaida 2012 Anna's and Glenrose VIneyards Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Touches of tar, concentrated rose petals and strawberry-black plum syrup show on the heartily extracted nose of this bottling, made by a vintner in Massachusetts. The palate packs a lot of flavor, from rose hips and dried hibiscus to pomegranate, elderberry and pencil lead.
Name: Balderdash 2012 Trademark Red Grenache (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Tenuous initial aromas of wet dog and latex turn more fruity and clean with airing. This is yet another lean, fresh, snappy wine from the very cool and wet 2013 vintage. Dry, medicinal red-berry flavors are oaky and finish sharp.
Name: Finca Albret 2013 Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: On first take, this mature Garnacha smells of padrón peppers and green herbs, although it comes around with airing. A medium-bodied palate with high acidity tastes of herbs, sour plum and pie cherry before finishing long and with a hint of oaky toast.
Designation: Duque de Medina Gran Reserva Old Vine
Name: Ignacio Marín 2006 Duque de Medina Gran Reserva Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raw aromas of tomato, spice, herbs and pie cherry accurately announce a pointy, lean, scouring palate. This Garnacha from a cool vintage is dominated by red plum, tart cherry and raspberry flavors that finish short and punchy.
Name: Vega Sindoa 2013 El Chaparral Old Vines Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of red plum and citrus qualify as raw and sharp. This is racy on the palate, with high acidity. Flavors of plum and cherry show mild spice and herbal shadings, while a tart red-fruit character is maintained across the finish.
Name: Artadi 2013 Artazuri Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite ripe and quite mature tasting, this wine has pruney aromas, raisin and plum flavors, full body and firm tannins.
Name: Longevity 2012 Grenache (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This vineyard is best known for its Syrah but Grenache also shines, as evidenced by this compelling bottle. The aromas pop with complex notes of flowers, brown stems, mineral, smoke, raspberries, peppery spice and the vineyard's signature earthy funk. The palate shows delicacy, precision and detail, with a lightly meaty, peppery finish that lingers. It's a completely captivating expression of the variety with balance that downright dazzles.
Name: Two Vintners 2013 Boushey Vineyard Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smoky, roasted aromas of hickory and blackberry are patented for this label: all Alto Moncayo top-end bottlings open like this. In the mouth, this is direct, full bodied and high in energy. The flavors match the nose, meaning this tastes like dark berry fruits mixed with smoky oak and char, while the finish turns chocolaty, with pepper, wild berry, spice notes and heat. Drink through 2022.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2013 Aquilon Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Mostly Grenache (88%) along with Syrah from River Rock and Northridge vineyards respectively, this wine is notably pale in color. The aromas of dried brown stems, white pepper, clove, tangerine peel, plum, fresh flowers and pomegranate are expressive. The elegant flavors display delicacy and complexity, while showing exceptional polish and balance. It's all about subtlety and nuance.
Name: K Vintners 2013 The Boy Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Like its brothers Veraton and Aquilon, this modern Garnacha opens with hickory, savory berry and balsamic aromas. While it's stout in feel, there's freshness amid the saturation. Flavors of toasty oak, licorice and blackberry finish long, blackened and savory. Drink through 2021.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2013 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's amazing floral energy on the fresh and inviting nose of this wine that shows punchy notes of hibiscus, red rose petals, dried red cherries, kola nut and a touch of cinnamon. The palate, aided by an 8% Syrah inclusion, is almost effervescent with raspberry and baking-soda qualities that settle into dried red fruit and chopped thyme herbals.
Name: Nicora 2013 Euphoric Grenache (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dried herb notes intermingle with raspberry, cranberry, moist earth, olive and spice on a wine that has yet to truly reveal itself aromatically. The palate is pillowy soft with elegant red-fruit and smoked-meat flavors that glide on the finish. It's all about delicacy.
Name: Kerloo 2013 Upland Vineyard Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Like all Alto Moncayo Garnachas, this opens with a big, loud crust of toasty oak and campfire smoke on top of blackberry aromas. The palate offers depth and body, while charred, toasty black-fruit flavors finish peppery and with tolerable heat. Drink through 2021.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2013 Veraton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Lightly herbal, candied-berry aromas are good but not what you'd call exact or exciting. This has plenty of energy on a jumpy palate, while lightly resiny, woody flavors of candied red fruits finish tight and juicy.
Name: Filón 2014 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Blueberry and raspberry aromas are ripe, grapy and feature a dash of cocoa. This is lively, punchy and healthy in feel. Medicinal plum and berry flavors are a touch salty, while this finishes with ripeness and good overall balance.
Name: Legado del Moncayo 2014 Montaña Old Vines Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône Villages, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This is 100% Grenache from a vineyard planted in 1895, so genuinely old vines. That said, 2013 was a challenging vintage, and this wine shows the firmness that marks so many of the wines. It's taut, dusty and herbal, with drying tannins on the finish.
Name: Château Maucoil 2013 1895 Grenache (Côtes du Rhône Villages)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Saucy blueberry aromas are a touch muddled and difficult to decipher, while this Garnacha feels medium in body and healthy. Raspberry and plum flavors come with a resiny, pasty oak note, while medicinality rises up on the finish.
Name: Breca 2014 De Fuego Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cherry and blueberry aromas are floral at first, then a touch grassy after airing. This feels full and bouncy, while salty plum and berry flavors are limited but fine. This holds form on the finish.
Name: Legado del Moncayo 2014 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This cool-vintage Garnacha smells earthy almost to the point of compost. A chunky, fairly heavy palate is bolstered by a shot of acidity, while rubbery dark-berry flavors finish with a reprise of earth character and moss.
Name: Las Rocas de San Alejandro 2013 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This Grenache-based cuvée is medium-bodied and crisp in feel. Black cherries and chocolate mingle easily on the palate, but the wine finishes dry and astringent. Serve with rare beef or lamb for best enjoyment.
Name: Chateau Les Amoureuses 2014 Les Charmes Grenache (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Spunky, edgy, slightly cheesy cherry and plum aromas come in front of a palate with crisp acidity and firm tannins. Tart plum and pie cherry flavors finish with scraping acidity and a touch of sourness.
Name: Retorno 2013 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of cherry Kool-Aid and fruit punch offer a sprinkle of spice in the background. This is simple in feel, with citrusy acidity. The red-fruit flavors are easy going and the finish is mild.
Name: Borsao 2014 Quadrum Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This varietal Garnacha is chunky and heavily oaked on the nose, with woody aromas of vanilla and plastic. An overtly oaky, awkward feeling palate tastes of resin on top of plum and blackberry, while the finish shows more resin mixed with mint.
Name: Bodegas Langa 2012 Pieza el Caidero Grenache (Calatayud)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Fleshy, powdery aromas of melon and raspberry are not really crisp. This feels basic, with wiry acidity. Briny citrus flavors carry onto a finish that's highly regular but gets the job done.
Name: Vega Sindoa 2014 Garnacha Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A blast of burnt wood and sawmill is the greeting on this heavily oaked Garnacha. Specific aromas of wood shavings, creosote and Bourbon barrel amount to a sundae's worth of oak notes. Flavors of char, coffee, chocolate and burnt wood dominate this overly oaked wine that is weak on core fruit.
Name: Borsao 2014 Tres Picos Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bright, fresh nose of rose petals, brisk raspberry juice, cranberry, turned earth and a pinch of white pepper makes for a lively wine. The palate begins with juicy strawberry then settles into anise and citrusy spice, an expertly lively wine with chalky texture and vibrant energy. Winemaker Lane Tanner is new at Grenache, but she's rocking it.
Name: Lumen 2014 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Reserved red-cherry fruit aromas gain complexity with fog-soaked sagebrush, dried purple flowers and an earthy mushroom character on the nose. Roasted shiitake, marjoram, crushed Brazil nuts and a hint of cardamom play on the dark, spicy, earthy palate, laid across a bed of cranberry fruit.
Name: Scratch 2013 Grenache (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a rich and concentrated Grenache, a bit beyond what's varietally familiar, but it's an undeniably luxurious wine. It offers smoky vanilla, fresh leather, black-cherry jam, black licorice and a touch of fudge on the nose. Caramelized plum and olallieberries meet with balsamic fig and milk chocolate on the palate.
Name: Jada Vineyard & Winery 2013 WCS Jack John Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine, boosted by 8% Syrah, is relatively light in the glass, showing vanilla and plush red cherries on the nose. The palate offers lots of baking spices and touches of dried herbs, but is based primarily on rose petals and ripe olallieberries.
Name: Law 2012 Beguiling Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of Dr Pepper, black-cherry cola syrup, chopped lavender candies and a touch of leather show on the intriguing, distinct nose from this historic property. The cola character plays heavily into the palate, where condensed purple flower, blackberry, black tea and licorice flavors also abound.
Name: Bien Nacido 2012 Grenache (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Randall Grahm wine, which also includes 9% Mourvèdre and 2% Syrah, hits the nose with tight raspberry juice, hibiscus, cola and iron aromas, proving tight and mineral-driven. Pencil lead leads the lighter palate, which also shows brisk pomegranate, black and white pepper and a menthol-like Sichuan-peppercorn sensation on the finish. It's a tremendous wine for the price.
Name: Bonny Doon 2014 Clos de Gilroy Grenache (Monterey County)

Appellation: Swartland, South Africa
Description: This is a rich, lush and oaky Grenache, with a creamy texture and a seductive, toasty finish. It boasts upfront aromas and flavors of black berries and plum that are heavily laced with sweet spice and wood tones. Licorice, clove and toasted star anise abound on the medium-bodied palate and linger long on the close. Drink now.
Name: Spice Route 2012 Grenache (Swartland)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy plum and cherry fruit is highlighted with a sprinkle of nutmeg. Sappy, tongue-tickling acids elevate the fruit flavors, while the wine finishes with thick, velvety tannins.
Name: Abacela 2013 Barrel Select Garnacha (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This Grenache was made in a firm, tannic and quite oaky style. Dark flavors mix black cherry, black licorice and road tar, with some alcoholic burn running along the finish.
Name: Griffin Creek 2012 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Dried berries, light licorice, hints of game and a flash of mint show on the nose of this wine from the South Coast. A tangy cranberry-pomegranate-raspberry element shows on the palate, given nuance by an herbal character. It would complement a wide range of meats and cheeses.
Name: Danza del Sol 2012 Grenache (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in color, especially for how this grape is typically handled in the region, this shows plump raspberries, cherry, black cardamom and brick on the nose. Flavors are light and dainty, with elements of graphite, tart pomegranate, cranberry and raspberry.
Name: Passaggio 2013 New Generation Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh-squeezed olallieberries, concentrated lilacs, plum skin and a light pepper aroma show on this wine's dense nose. The palate is lighter in flavor yet dense in texture, with strong tannins framing the fresh boysenberry fruit.
Name: Rotta 2013 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Montsant, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Powdery berry aromas are sketchy but don't offend. This Garnacha feels jammy, rubbery and on the tannic side, while buttery accents intermingle with briny raspberry flavors. A plump, almost sticky feeling finish shows smacking tannins.
Name: Sant Rafel 2014 Joana Garnacha (Montsant)

Appellation: Montsant, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Briny, rubbery aromas turn gamy and horsey in short time. This varietal Garnacha feels raw and low on body. Salty, herbal tomato and red-plum flavors finish with a flavor akin to Mexican salsa.
Name: Cellers Baronia del Montsant 2014 Flor d'Englora Garnacha (Montsant)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A mixture of Stoney Vine (70%), Upland (20%) and Les Collines vineyard fruit, this wine displays reserved aromas of crushed violets, dried orange peel, brown stems, gravel, smoke and peat. Then sweet raspberry and savory flavors float like a magic carpet, showing exceptional length. It's an elegant, compelling expression of the variety.
Name: Sleight of Hand 2013 The Sorceress Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is all varietal from Cockburn Ranch near the Blue Mountains. Aromas of vanilla, fresh dill, orange zest and red fruit lead to plump fruit and barrel flavors that show a sense of nuance and persistence.
Name: Bontzu 2013 Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This inaugural release displays dialed-back aromas of pencil eraser and dried herbs that need a bit more lift. The palate puts a premium on purity of expression along with a tart lick of acid and cinnamon notes on the finish. If the aromas and flavors sync up further, this young wine moves up a notch.
Name: Swick 2014 Terre Brûlée Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of coffee, gravel and boysenberry are followed by pillowy-soft fruit and barrel flavors. It displays delicacy and nuance.
Name: Columbia Crest 2013 Reserve Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
