Description: This wine shows a lot of reduction that provides off-putting aromas. The strawberry and cranberry flavors are full and show pleasing purity and length. The disconnect between the aromas and flavors is substantial but some time in a decanter might sync them up.
Name: Ott & Murphy 2012 Grenache (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Big red fruit embraces chewy, integrated tannins in this vineyard-designate, a full-bodied explosion of ripeness and bold expression. While powerful, it holds on to nuance via streaks of high-toned citrus, allowing the wine room to breathe and remain lighthearted.
Name: Kobler 2013 Campbell McKinney Vineyard Grenache (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a producer always to consider for Rhône-styled wines. A mix of strawberry pie and Nilla wafer, this 100% varietal wine is robust and full bodied. Structured with plenty of tangy acidity, it'll stand up to cellaring or a decant. Drink now through 2021.
Name: Quivira 2013 Wine Creek Ranch Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Layered aromas of blackberry, cassis, leather and dried cheese are inviting. In the mouth, this Garnacha from vines more than 100-years-old is jammy and friendly. Candied almost syrupy flavors of blackberry and black cherry finish dense and chocolaty, with modest acidity. Drink through 2017.
Name: Bodegas San Valero 2011 Particular Viñas Centenarias Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Loamy berry, cheesy oak, balsamic hints and vanilla notes make for an interesting bouquet. This feels a bit wiry and acidic at its core, while overall it's chunky in stature. Deep warming flavors of kirsch and blackberry finish with heat and jammy weight. Drink through 2017.
Name: Firestarter 2011 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is 100% varietal, and sports interesting aromas of Provençal herbs. Peppery cranberry fruit is spicy and tart, fading through the midpalate into a lean, but lingering finish.
Name: Folin Cellars 2013 Estate Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Cherry-vanilla surrounds a flank of big oak, while classic notes of baked strawberry also come into play. A brawny, full-bodied expression of the variety, given 6% Mourvèdre and 6% Syrah, it has good bones and acidity lurking beneath the power.
Name: Mounts 2012 Estate Grown Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe rustic woody aromas of berry fruits and cedar introduce a raw rugged drawing palate with oaky baked lightly medicinal flavors of candied berry fruits. Grabby tannins, heat and spicy flavors push the finish on this firmly structured Garnacha. Drink through 2018.
Name: Bodegas San Valero 2010 Particular Viñas Centenarias Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gritty plum and currant aromas are basic but fresh. Ditto the palate, which shows acidic scratch but not too much. Prickly lightly oaked cherry and plum flavors end with scratchy freshness, lean tannins and lasting berry notes.
Name: Borsao 2014 Viña Borgia Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cherry and raspberry aromas are spunky and simple in front of a crisp edgy palate. Medicinal, lightly rubbery flavors of cherry and plum finish with a raw rub, juicy acidity, a lean body and mild heat.
Name: Borsao 2014 Monte Oton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Heavy oak aromas rest forcefully on top of plum and black cherry scents. This is fresh and proper in feel, with dominant oaky graininess and medicinal berry flavors that finish woody like a plank.
Name: Penelope Sanchez 2014 Red (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Untamed plum and cherry aromas are a bit strained. This everyday Garnacha is fresh and fruity in feel, with good but standard plum and cherry flavors. An edgy grating finish with a spot of oak character wraps this up.
Name: Borsao 2014 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Floral blueberry and black-currant aromas are jammy. Following the nose, this Garnacha feels chunky and low in acidity. Jammy flavors of blueberry and cassis end in a pudgy but friendly way. Drink this low-acid offering sooner rather than later.
Name: Montoya 2011 Cuvée E.M.H. Reserva Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Granted, this is a young wine, but on first impression it imparts a raw, burly earthiness that's hard to completely embrace, with a sense of cooked mushrooms and sour cherry around soft, light-bodied tannins. Give it plenty of air.
Name: Noble Tree 2014 Grenache (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine arrests the senses with dazzlingly pure aromas of dark raspberries, cherries, clove, mineral and spice. Flavors are intense, layered, and rich without sacrificing one iota of balance. The plush mouthfeel and long finish only add to the enjoyment and sensory experience.
Name: Latta 2012 Upland Vineyard Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: The first harvest from the De Portola Vineyard, this aged wine shows a mysteriously inviting character on the nose and palate. Aromas of cinnamon, strawberry jam on toast, mace and plums lead into a palate decorated by cherry and berry juice mulled by licorice and sandalwood.
Name: Gershon Bachus 2008 Hesperus Grenache (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Light in color and clear, this 100% varietal wine from a prime spot in Carneros known better for Pinot Noir and Chardonnay dances in the glass, a celebration of floral violet aromas and faint white pepper. Restrained and elegant, it's plenty spicy and fresh, finishing with just the right amount of red cherry.
Name: Miner 2012 Hudson Vineyard Grenache (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rose petals, red currants, red licorice and a bit of snapped sage stick entertain the nose on this bottling, which can be sampled at the producer's downtown Paso tasting room. Earl Grey tea, dried orange rind and dried violets play on the palate, which cuts the elderberry fruit with sharp, slightly bitter cherry pits.
Name: Anglim 2012 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine has a rather light color. Aromas seem roasted and savory rather than fruity, leading to attractive spicy, meaty, almost mushroomy flavors. The texture is on the lean side, moderately tannic and quite dry.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2012 Estate Bottled Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Not your usual dark and superripe California wine, this is light in color with a brick-brown edge. It smells lightly spicy, almost like salt and pepper, and tastes dry, beefy and also a bit like raspberries and black tea. It's a great change of pace and very interesting to taste.
Name: Calavera Wines 2013 Dalton Vineyard Grenache (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Whiffs of white pepper and fresh young pine trees give nuance to the supple raspberry and wild red-berry fruit aromas on the nose of this bottling. It's light in body and texture once sipped, so throw a chill on it to enjoy the nice anise notes, juniper character and pomegranate backbone.
Name: Carucci 2013 Murmur Vineyard Grenache (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this wine shows cola, dried strawberries, dried rose petals, sagebrush and a rustic leather element on the nose. The palate offers lots of dried herbs, from oregano to sage to marjoram, as well as Earl Grey tea, all against a light raspberry-cranberry juice frame.
Name: Rideau 2013 Estate Reserve Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bing cherries and cranberries are spiced with black cardamom on the slightly cough-syrupy nose of this wine. Iron and blood flavors show on the palate, with dried red cherries and rose petals.
Name: Archium 2013 Haven Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A slightly sour red-apple and light strawberry aroma meets with a touch of watermelon and cotton candy on the nose of this blend of 76% Grenache, 10% Syrah, 8% Mission, 4% Zinfandel and 2% Cinsault. There is lots of citrus zing to the nectarine-driven palate, which also shows some pink-lemonade flavors.
Name: Proulx 2014 Willow Creek Farm Rose of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Vivacious cola and pomegranate fruit gain complexity with lava-rock minerality, cigar box and woodfire ash on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate offers perfumy purple flowers and blackberry, quite quaffable though not especially complex.
Name: Chamisal Vineyards 2012 Grenache (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black cherry juice, slate and sandalwood consume the nose with rich and ripe aromas on this powerful bottling from a vineyard south of Santa Maria. This shows lots of elegance and complexity on the palate, with turned earth, wild berries and an intriguing sense of pine needles and juniper. Expect great things from this relatively new producer.
Name: Mattina Fiore 2012 Murmur Vineyard Grenache (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark violets, sagebrush, olallieberry and a touch of smoked plums greet the nose on this bottling by Jeremy Weintraub, winemaker for Adelaida and formerly Seavey, who is focusing this project on renowned vineyards. The palate is high and tight at first with sanguine and iodine elements, opening toward black pepper, licorice, black and red currants and broader cherry flavors.
Name: Site 2012 Larner Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Alluring red cherry wraps itself around a velvety texture with tannic foundation and a substantial mouthfeel. Though powerful, it's sexy and floral, with buoyant acidity and weight.
Name: Kokomo 2013 Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Iron and rose petals mix with hot gravel and olallieberry on the nose of this concentrated bottling by the Fess Parker family's Rhône-variety-focused brand. Dried black cherries and heady anise power the palate, with violet in the background.
Name: Epiphany 2012 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red currant and plump red berries are lifted by hibiscus and violet notes on the nose of this wine by Matt Brain and Josh Baker. It's quite ripe with plum, pomegranate and cherry fruit on the palate, but also relatively light in texture. Elegantly complex, it also discloses pipe smoke and eucalyptus elements.
Name: Baker & Brain 2012 Le Mistral Vineyard Grenache (Monterey County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Every vintage Bryan Babcock makes an experimental white wine pressed straight from red grapes, in this case opting for Grenache. The result is a unique nose of lemon cake, pink rose petals and ice cream, followed by a a lively, energetic palate powered by Key lime pie flavors. It's worth tracking down for those seeking something completely different.
Name: Babcock 2014 Identity Crisis Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A juicy nose of ripe pomegranates, warm cranberries, concentrated strawberry blossoms and a bit of smoked herbs makes for an enticing introduction on this wine from one of the region's earliest producers. The palate shows cola, blackberry juice and a lavender lift. It's a perfect hamburger pairing.
Name: Zaca Mesa 2012 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Just two barrels of this 100% Grenache were bottled, after aging 20 months in French oak. It's bright and spicy, showing cranberry and cherry fruit highlighted by orange peel, cinnamon, pepper and red licorice. The lovely fruit shines right on through a lingering finish.
Name: Jaxon 2012 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Juicy with scents of cherry cola and cream soda, this wine was sourced from two vineyards. It shows violet flavors, backed up by hibiscus and a light raspberry juice. It's clean, fresh and very easy to drink.
Name: Sculpterra 2013 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Concentrated aromas of raisin, black currant, animal fur and charred wood announce a blocky, tannic palate. Grapy flavors of raisin, prune and minerals finish with peppery spice along with jammy black-fruit flavors. Drink this ripe Garnacha through 2019.
Name: Artadi 2012 Pasos de San Martín Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Watermelon liqueur and strawberry soda notes arise from the glass of this lively pink wine. There is good energy once sipped, with an apple-skin tartness and ripe though sour cherries delivering the fruit character.
Name: J. Lohr 2014 Gesture Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense and concentrated aromas of frozen strawberries, blackberry pie, black cherries and vanilla sauce properly predict a very rich wine. Once sipped, the wine is quite thick, with lots of mint, fudge and brown spice, proving quite tasty although not quite varietally familiar.
Name: Calcareous 2012 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lighter in color, this is a fairly heavy-duty take on the grape, with cola, red cherry and cinnamon notes on a nose that seems hotter than the alcohol level suggests. Licorice, caramel, smoky Scotch and kirsch flavors consume the palate.
Designation: La Libresca Santa Barbara Highlands Vineyard
Name: j.brix 2013 La Libresca Santa Barbara Highlands Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a thick and savory wine, compressed and somewhat flabby on the palate. A curious nose takes time to develop into full-bodied black cherry and blackberry.
Name: Wattle Creek 2013 Grenache (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Pale in color, this 100% Grenache has arresting, complex aromas of candied strawberries, pomegranate, herbs, plum and orange peel. The red fruit and savory flavors are sweet and generous, showing an exquisite sense of purity and richness. It's a knee-buckler but all about delicacy and restraint.
Name: Rôtie Cellars 2013 Little G Grenache (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from Boushey, Ciel du Cheval and Seven Hills vineyards, this wine opens with aromas of plum, Asian spices, licorice, dark fruit and light barrel spices. The palate is rich, full bodied and velvety, with abundant coffee flavors and a mesmerizing sense of texture.
Name: Maison Bleue 2012 Bourgeois Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Grenache from Angiolina Farm and Upland vineyards along with 22% StoneTree Mourvèdre, this wine offers aromas of violets, raspberry, plum and assorted herbs. The plum and dark raspberry flavors are pure, ripe and full while retaining a pleasing sense of balance. The complexity only increases with some additional time open.
Name: Kerloo 2013 Majestic Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pretty pale-salmon color, this wine offers appealing aromas of orange peel, strawberry and wet stone. The palate is dry, crisp and clean with mouthwatering acids, a beautiful sense of texture and a lingering finish. It's thoroughly delicious.
Name: Maison Bleue 2014 Lisette Rosé of Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The dark raspberry, plum, herb, vanilla and spice aromas and flavors are rich and high octane. It's not for the faint of heart but offers plenty of appeal.
Name: Ambassador Vineyard 2012 Estate Grown Attache Grenache (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The barrel influence is heavy on this wine, with aromas and flavors of vanilla, cocoa and coconut out front of the variety's red fruit. Still, the silky feel and spice flavors bring plenty of appeal; it's just a bit hard to get at the fruit.
Name: Bunnell 2010 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plum, spice and white pepper aromas are followed by full-bodied, ripe and quite sweet fruit flavors. There are a lot of good things going on, but the richness of the fruit gets a bit out in front, giving a somewhat ponderous, weighty feel.
Name: Darby 2012 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Grenache (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Jumilla, Levante, Spain
Description: Aromas of cherry cough drop, leather, tomato and raspberry lead to a chewy, jammy palate. Slightly salty flavors of plum and raspberry run short, while the finish is briny and sweetened by creamy oak notes. Drink now.
Name: Casa Castillo 2013 El Molar Garnacha (Jumilla)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of raspberry and baking spices are followed by tart, full-bodied fruit flavors backed by cranberry-like tartness. It shows a lovely sense of texture but the alcohol distracts.
Name: Ambassador Vineyard 2012 Estate Grown Grenache (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Cava, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Pickled, briny aromas of citrus and berry fruits are modest. On the palate, this is soft and low on acidity. Flavors of raspberry, cherry and red currant are mild, with a touch of bitterness.
Name: Biutiful NV Brut Rose Garnacha (Cava)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Structured but sleek, this has aromas of ripe blackberry, raspberry and ground cooking spice. The full-bodied palate delivers juicy black cherry, black pepper, anise, wild herb and tobacco while ripe, polished tannins provide support. It nicely blends structure and elegance.
Name: Pala 2013 Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Complex and generous on the palate, this vineyard-designated varietal is surprisingly light and bright in spirit, ethereal even, offering aromas of black pepper, violets and gunpowder, hard to figure out but inviting nonetheless. On the palate, juicy plum and dark cherry provide an exuberant edge.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Rossi Ranch Grenache (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Vineyard-designated Grenache is a rarity in the Northwest. This one is all about subtlety and elegance of expression, with aromas of candied raspberry, thyme, spice and wildflowers leading to a textured, pillowy palate that possesses an ethereal lightness and great length.
Name: Rasa 2013 Primus Inter Pares Monette's Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of steeped plum, ripe black currant and a whiff of grilled Mediterranean herb lead the nose. The round, concentrated palate doles out fleshy blackberry, ripe black cherry, ground pepper and anise alongside ripe, chewy tannins.
Name: Contini 2011 Inu Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: It would be all too easy to write this off as minimally ripe and sharply herbal, as it first appears. But with extensive aeration it blossoms into a wealth of detailed flavors—bright raspberry, tart citrus and fresh herb, all with impressive length.
Name: Cowhorn 2012 20 Grenache (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Succulent blackberry, spiced blueberry, licorice, ground white pepper and carob all come together on this full-bodied, chewy red. Ripe, round tannins support the juicy flavors.
Name: Ferruccio Deiana 2012 Sileno Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of blue flower, ripe berry and Mediterranean brush lead the nose on this robust wine. The forward, chewy palate offers crushed wild cherry, juicy black raspberry, ground pepper and licorice alongside ripe, round tannins.
Name: Vigne Surrau 2013 Sincaru  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smooth and harmonious are good descriptors for this medium-bodied, warmly fruity and well-balanced wine. It smells like plums and cherry compote, tastes substantive with more cherries and plums, and feels rich but well supported by fine tannins and subtle acidity.
Name: Baiocchi Wines 2012 Sharon's Vineyard Grenache (Fair Play)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This earthy expression of Cannonau opens with aromas of charred topsoil, baked plum, ground pepper and a whiff of wild game. The palate offers ripe black cherry, fig, clove, leather and licorice alongside firm tannins.
Name: Giuseppe Sedilesu 2012 Sartiu  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Red and black berry, dark spice and Mediterranean herb aromas lead the nose on this straightforward, friendly wine. The juicy, savory palate offers crushed black cherry, black berry, dried herb and peppercorn alongside smooth, enveloping tannins.
Name: Mesa 2013 Primo Scuro  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, underbrush, wild berry and a floral note lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers bright red cherry, blackberry, black pepper and grilled herb alongside polished tannins.
Name: Giuseppe Gabbas 2013 Lillovè  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of dried Mediterranean brush, chopped mint, vanilla, mocha and ripe plum lead the nose. The meaty palate doles out prune, ripe black cherry, fig, cinnamon and nutmeg alongside the heat of alcohol and solid, chewy tannins.
Name: Giuseppe Sedilesu 2010 Ballu Tondu Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Toast, baked earth, grilled mushroom and roasted coffee bean aromas come together on this full-bodied wine. The evolved palate offers dried black cherry, raisin, oak, espresso and black pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit richness, which is already fading.
Name: Giuseppe Gabbas 2011 Dule  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of charred topsoil, resin, leather, game, overripe black-skinned fruit and raisin. The forward palate is equally earthy—a bit rustic even—showing fig, cured meat, carob, steeped prune, fig and a note of bitter almond alongside ripe, chewy tannins.
Name: Tenute Soletta 2011 Corona Majore  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe blue and black-skinned fruit, dried herb, spice and a floral note lead the nose on this big, hearty wine. The warm, one-dimensional and forward palate delivers ripe black cherry, blackberry, licorice and searing alcohol alongside velvety tannins. The evident alcohol throws it off balance.
Name: Giuseppe Sedilesu 2012 Mamuthone  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This easygoing expression of Cannonau offers cherry, raspberry, ground pepper, anise and a note of toasted almond. It's already accessible thanks to lithe tannins. Drink through 2016.
Name: Piero Mancini 2013 Falcale  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Showing Cannonau's lighter side, this simple red has fruity aromas of wild berry and a hint of dried aromatic herb. The easygoing, informal palate offers red cherry, raspberry and a hint of white pepper alongside soft tannins.
Name: Vigneti Zanatta 2013 Salana  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This lean, dry, tangy wine needs rich food for a good pairing. Flavors of tart cherry, cranberry and rhubarb ride over an assertive acid backbone.
Name: Naggiar 2012 Estate Grenache (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Cannonau di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of scorched earth, pressed rose and a funky note of game lead the nose. The lean, diluted palate offers raisin and a hint of dried black cherry alongside gritty, fleeting tannins.
Name: Boccantino 2012 Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Despite its lighter color, this wine explodes from the glass with a complex, near-endless list of aromas that include sea breeze, crushed flowers, peat, green olive, fire pit, smoked meat, pepper, orange peel and sea salt. Its ethereal, elegant style belies the outrageously rich, exquisitely flavorful savory notes that won't quit, offering a completely captivating walk on the variety's wild side.
Name: Horsepower 2012 Sur Echalas Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It takes some time to open up but when it does, this wine reveals perfumed aromas of potpourri, green olive, savory spices, peat, pepper and mineral. The palate is equal parts light and dense with almost chewy, savory flavors that won't quit.
Name: Cayuse 2012 God Only Knows Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite lightly colored, this wine displays perfumed aromas of green and black olive, stargazer lilies, mineral, peat and moist earth. The flavors are both ethereally light and rich, tingling the palate with seemingly endless savoriness.
Name: No Girls 2012 La Paciencia Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of tobacco, dried herbs and strawberry are followed by focused, creamy-feeling raspberry and cranberry flavors. It shows a real sense of purity but the mouthfeel is where it truly shines.
Name: Sparkman 2013 Wonderland Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The oak (50% new French) plays a big part in this show, with aromas of coffee and pencil lead alongside the variety's strawberries and herbs. It's supple and pillowy in feel with a high yum factor.
Name: Novelty Hill 2012 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Inviting macerated strawberry aromas mix with light plum, pink peach flesh and the original Hubba Bubba bubblegum scent. The delicious palate is driven by a subtle sense of cotton candy, all cut with a lime peel acidity.
Name: Koehler 2014 Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This brand is winemaker Heidi Peterson Barrett's ode to Rhône, as well as a place for her own Bordeaux-varietal wines. The first vintage of this 100% varietal wine on its own, it's soft and supple with a tannic backbone. Pretty plum aromas and a streak of peppery spice and leather are joined on the palate by juicy blueberry and finished off in restrained oak.
Name: La Sirena 2012 Grenache (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Volatility interferes with the otherwise pleasing mixture of fruit and barrel, with notes of raspberry jam, fresh and dried fruit and vanilla. Flavors are quite sweet and ripe, showing a hedonistic styling. Drink now.
Name: McCrea 2009 Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This Garnacha opens with earthy plum and raspberry aromas as well as licorice, horse hide and herbal accents. A fresh, energetic, lively palate delivers plum, cherry and raspberry flavors in front of a clampy, tannic finish with savory notes.
Name: Montgó 2012 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Despite its light color, this wine's aromas pop with notes of flowers, orange peel, red currant and earth. Grapes largely come from River Rock Vineyard. The fruit flavors are light and delicate with the oak pulled way back. It's a very pretty expression of the variety.
Name: Lantz 2013 Grenache Noir Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A brooding foundation of blackberry and mushroomy earth lift this full-bodied, tannic wine, which needs further time in bottle to develop. Spicy cinnamon, clove and pepper keep it lively on the palate, between the density and concentration of oak. Let this wine unwind in the bottle through 2020.
Name: V. Sattui 2012 Grenache (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of exotic spices, licorice gumdrop, leather and raspberry announce a full-bodied palate. Saucy plum, oak and mustard-like flavors finish with a dash of cumin and a solid, grabby texture.
Name: Bodegas San Valero 2012 Particular Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This forcefully oaked Garnacha offers rustic berry fruit aromas over clove. The high acidity is offset by resiny oak, while flavors of clove and char vie with generic red-berry flavors over a slightly hot finish.
Name: Marqués de Montañana 2013 Selección Especial Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Prune and raisin aromas are dominant and suggest overripeness. Following that lead, this is chunky and heavy on the palate, with pounding tannins. Baked blackberry, prune and savory flavors finish long and dense.
Name: Ignacio Marín 2012 Ballad Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This opens with an aromatic note of wet dog along with wild berry and plum. The palate is spunky, jumpy and lively, while flavors of plum, raspberry and berry skins finish short and simple.
Name: Acentor 2013 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy blackberry flavors include carob and herbal accents. This is drawing and high in acidity, while earthy, herbal flavors of raspberry and plum are a bit green. Charred oak, clove and leafy berry flavors take over on the finish.
Name: Cruz de Piedra 2013 Selección Especial Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Leathery, horsey lead aromas include hints of licorice, baked plum and green herbs. This Garnacha has a saucy, tomatoey feel and leafy red-berry flavors that finish with a hint of sweet caramel and herbal overtones.
Name: Pago Aylés 2012 Aldeya Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Catalunya, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Loamy, earthy aromas of raspberry and raisin fall flat as this breathes. A heavy palate is low on freshness and acidity, while prune, cherry and cassis flavors veer toward raisin on a finish that quickly loses clarity and snap.
Name: Ressò 2013 Garnacha (Catalunya)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: The aromas of this wine are gummy and candied on the nose. Weird flavors of pastry, mulched earth and clay are devoid of clean fruit and finish jumbled and flat.
Name: Agustín Cubero 2013 Unus Old Vine Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Woody aromas of vanilla, blackberry, black plum and cassis are lactic and creamy. Concentrated and huge on the palate, but with enviable balance, this powerful, ripe Garnacha deals blackberry and dark-plum flavors prior to an oaky, spicy, chocolaty finish with peppery, blackened spice notes. This is a monster wine with 16.5% abv, but it can handle it.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2012 Aquilon Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Earthy aromas of black loam and graphite give complexity to accents of beet juice and dried purple flowers on this wine by longtime Rideau Winery winemaker Andres Ibarra, who also manages La Presa Vineyard. Deep purple florals of violet and lavender hit the palate along with cooked peppercorns, sweet plums and spiced cherries, making for an elegant and complex package.
Name: Ibarra 2012 La Presa Vineyards Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine, which blends 75% estate fruit with 25% from Rodney's Vineyard, offers black raspberry juice, black cardamom, allspice, buttered cherries and sandalwood on the nose. Bright strawberry fruit flavors are enhanced with clove spice, and a decently tart tension holds it all together.
Name: Carhartt Vineyard 2012 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Full blackberry and black-plum aromas come with controlled but obvious oak. This feels tight and direct on the palate, with ripeness and weight. Blackberry, cassis and chocolaty oak flavors finish woody and peppery, with drying tannins. This is a powerful, oaky Garnacha made for the modern palate.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2012 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Potent black-plum and black-cherry aromas come with a ton of grainy, spicy oak. This is both fresh and bright as well as dark, brawny and roasted in character. Flavors of ripe blackberry and cherry share the stage with toasty, charred oak and spice flavors in front of an aggressive but tasty finish.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2012 Veraton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Penedès, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Rosy cherry and plum aromas turn more rubbery and raisiny as this airs out. Solid, lifted and deep on the palate, this varietal Garnacha deals lightly herbal, floral flavors of plum and cherry cough drop, while the finish is oaky, resiny, raw, scouring and tough. Nothing about this is subtle or elegant, but it is dynamic. Drink through 2020.
Name: Parés Baltà 2011 Hisenda Miret Microcuvée Garnatxa Garnacha (Penedès)

Appellation: Paicines, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rose petals, violets, red cherries, plums, rhubarb and heavily peppered spices dominate the nose of this tasty wine from a little-known appellation 27 miles inland from Monterey Bay. It's softly textured upon sipping, then acidity shows up and holds through the sip, along with a stemmy tension. Fresh flavors include sour cherries and red berries.
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2012 Grenache (Paicines)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Floral red-plum aromas come with a welcome note of wild herbs. A punchy, stout palate is juicy and possesses short, bold plum and boysenberry flavors. This bright Garnacha doesn't fall off on the finish; it's a good choice for burgers or tacos.
Name: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2013 El Circo Acróbata Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A muscular, oaky nose shows cool, grapy, berry aromas that carry an animal streak. This is drawing, tannic and rubbery on the palate, with meaty, hard-spice flavors of blackberry that turn mildly bitter and hot on the finish.
Name: Ignacio Marín 2013 Magnífico Grenache (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cherry and red-plum aromas are also horsey, jammy and suggestive of bacon fat. An astringent palate ranks as severely rugged and drawing. Bitter red-plum flavors simmer prior to a hard-tannin finish that's peppery and tart.
Name: Terrai 2013 OVG Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dark and ominous in color, with a grapy, rustic, smoky nose, this Garnacha is high in acid, rubbery and tannic on the palate. Semisour black-plum flavors finish equally tannic and acidic.
Name: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2013 Menguante Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Odd aromas of clove are smoky but mostly come across as weird and forced. This has a lactic, creamy mouthfeel with soft edges. The flavor profile is all wood, and resiny, clove-driven wood at that. A severely sweet, cloying, resiny finish is a lot to deal with.
Name: Coto de Hayas 2012 Fagus Selección Especial Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented entirely in concrete egg, this is a light, clear red exuberant in earthy cherry and cassis. Ethereal, it offers spice and plenty of length around a shy body, a bite of fruit on the finish. Made in small quantities at a fair price, it's one to try for its sheer rarity alone, a good example of another light-bodied red that can do well in the appellation.
Name: Noble Tree 2013 Grenache (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light orange-pink in color, this wine is boosted by 2% Syrah, 1% Mourvèdre and 1% Grenache Blanc. It shows squeezed lime and pressed watermelon on the nose, proving quite Provencal in style. The cotton-candy palate is lifted by citrus pith, proving tightly wound while quite mouthwatering.
Name: J. Lohr 2013 Gesture Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This nano-produced wine all comes from Stillwater Creek vineyard. It offers aromas of ripe red apple and red raspberry along with light barrel accents. The elegant, velvety texture steals the show, with the red fruit flavors lingering.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2011 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of overripe red apple, cranberry, raspberry and white pepper predominate, along with light oxidative notes. The jammy red fruit and apple flavors are luscious and sweet, bringing a pleasing sense of texture along with a lingering finish.
Name: Flying Dreams 2012 Garnacha (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Feral aromas of blood, gristle and game provide an intriguingly sexy quality to this wine. It proves quite light on the palate, with waves of umami crashing in, from truffles and mushrooms to dry-aged beef, with hints of crushed herbs and lavender adding complexity.
Name: Consilience 2012 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a steeply sloped site also planted to Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this thick, leathery wine shows undeniable power and intensity although it is still tannic and young. Heady bouts of lavender, red cherry and black licorice compete for attention on the palate amid intriguing floral, rose-like aromatics.
Name: Ram's Gate 2012 Ulises Valdez Diablo Vineyard Grenache (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cherry, leather, tobacco, licorice and chocolate-dipped strawberries combine into a heady nose on this single-vineyard bottling from the Grenache-focused winery. Tongue-tingling acidity runs through flavors of balsamic vinegar and strawberry extract, all held together by steady tannins. It's quite a full presentation of the grape.
Name: Kaena 2012 Larner Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This nervy and vibrant wine takes time to reveal the intriguing flavors within. Quite tart and tannic at first, it is firm in texture to balance the ripe, sweet plum, marascino cherry and orange peel aromas. While chewy and lip-smacking in the beginning, deeper flavors come through on the second and third sips, and a smoky nuance develops on the finish.
Name: Donkey & Goat 2013 Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: One of Mikael Sigouin's single-vineyard studies, this shows sandalwood, rose petals and juicy berries on the nose. It's ripe yet restrained on the palate, with plump red berries that pull back before being too juicy, with licorice spice and plum skin bitterness on the edges.
Name: Kaena 2012 Tierra Alta VIneyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is not necessarily a classic Grenache, but there is no denying its bold but sophisticated personality. Pomegranate and blackberry aromas are tinged with earthiness, and the flavors are rich in fruit as well. The texture is lush and the body is very full. Think of it as very ripe and delicious, while sleek and smooth in spite of high alcohol.
Name: Cline 2013 Big Break Vineyard Grenache (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Juicy and ripe, this bursts open with a flavorful mix of brambly berry, cherry compote and red licorice. It's full and broad, ready for near-term drinking, and yet has the acid backing to age 2019–2021.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2013 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made in a big style, this keeps its balance from the aroma through the finish. It has a dark color for what can often be a lighter-colored wine. Aromas recall dark cherries and black pepper, while flavors resemble blackberries. The tannins are firm but the texture is satisfyingly broad and generous.
Name: Sanglier Cellars 2012 Touche Grenache (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Vibrant floral aromas of violets, hibiscus and rose hips meet with strawberry extract, licorice paste and a fruit-punch nose. It's easy and light on the palate, with rose petals, lavender and white pepper spicing a rhubarb pie character. Tannins emerge to give density to the finish. It's great for beach or barbecue.
Name: Margerum 2013 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red currants, balsamic-laced strawberries and darkly colored herbs emerge off of this wine by Grenache specialist Mikael Sigouin. There's a lot going on in this very flavorful wine, with Bing cherry fruit balanced by a graphite-like minerality.
Name: Kaena 2012 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Priorat, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Cherry and plum aromas are lean and citrusy, while the palate on this high-reaching Garnacha is loud and raw, with punishing tannins. Plum skin, cherry and oaky coconut flavors finish with heat and aggression. This is not easy to drink at this point; give it until 2016–2017 and revisit.
Name: Scala Dei 2011 Masdeu Garnacha (Priorat)

Appellation: Montsant, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Deep, smoky aromas of black fruits are muscular and full. This is well structured and strong, with toast and dark-fruit flavors of blackberry and plum. Spicy, peppery flavors and mild heat drive the finish.
Name: Gran Vinaio 2010 Red Grenache (Montsant)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is attractively fruity in aroma, accented by smoke and spices. It smells plummy and tastes a bit like wood smoke and black pepper. Medium to full bodied, it is well balanced and just tannic enough to keep the texture firm and appetizing.
Name: Graziano 2011 Grenache (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Terra Alta, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Floral cherry aromas are spunky and light, with nothing aggressive. Juicy in the mouth, this Garnatxa delivers some pop but isn't heavy. Cherry, plum and raspberry flavors end minerally and clean, with a drawing feel.
Name: Cellers Unió 2012 Clos del Pinell Garnacha (Terra Alta)

Appellation: Penedès, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Earthy raspberry aromas are dusty, dry and smell a touch like a rubber band. Rubbery tannins create some rawness on the palate, while briny plum and raspberry flavors finish with a smack of oak and mild heat.
Name: Parés Baltà 2011 Indigena Garnatxa Garnacha (Penedès)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This smells like sweet red cherries and ripe plums and tastes quite ripe, almost sweet, with more berries and cherries. The overall mouthfeel is full bodied and the texture is broad and rich. It is generous, fruity and tasty all around.
Name: Fenestra 2011 Estate Grenache (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Montsant, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Plum, blueberry and rubbery aromas are fresh and youthful, but not complex or deep. Like the nose, this is friendly on the palate, with moderate jammy weight and flavors of blueberry that finish shallow and easy.
Name: Compañia de Vinos del Atlántico 2012 Pinyolet Garnacha (Montsant)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An oaky character dominates the grape flavors and demands attention. It smells like toasted bread and charred oak, tastes a bit like vanilla, and has subdued fruit flavors.
Name: Andis 2012 Andis Grenache (Amador County)

Appellation: Alella, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Medicinal cherry aromas are candied and struggle for clarity. A grapy, grabby palate is home to blueberry and rubbery flavors, while the finish is mildly bitter and slightly hot.
Name: Alta Alella 2013 Organic Garnatxa Garnacha (Alella)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Chalky and thin, this shows no particular varietal character. It looks as if it's already fading, and flavors taste woody and dull. Two bottles tasted; same notes.
Name: Reustle 2013 Hebron Bloc Grenache (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This inaugural release is 100% varietal that's aged in neutral French puncheons. The panoply of notes includes raspberry seed, dark plum, green olive and nori. The mouthfeel is the true star with a rich, pillowy-soft, palate-coating texture showing exceptional purity and an extended finish.
Name: B. Leighton 2012 Olsen Brothers Vineyard Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, this 100% varietal wine was macerated with 50% stems and 50% whole berries before being aged in 500L neutral French-oak puncheons. It's perfumed with dark raspberries, cherry Jolly Ranchers, herbs, lavender, potpourri and mineral. The outrageously supple yet rich, supremely elegant mouthfeel dazzles.
Name: Latta 2011 Upland Vineyard Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Bright cherry and currant aromas are offset by Garnacha's patented raisiny quality on this piercing, firm wine from one of Rioja's masters of that style. Acidity is ramped up, giving a citric essence to the palate, while tart, punchy red-plum and currant flavors finish a bit sharp and pointy. Drink this food-friendly, racy wine through 2020.
Name: Contino 2010  Rioja

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Elerding and Upland vineyards, this intriguing wine offers reserved notes of herbs, ash, cherry, mineral and flowers. It's soft and sumptuous in feel, rich with sweet fruit flavors and a finish that glides.
Name: Idilico 2012 Garnacha (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented with 35% stems and aged in neutral French oak, this 100% varietal wine brings both hedonistic and intellectual enjoyment. Lighter in color, it offers intriguing notes of flowers, mineral, dried herbs and red and blue fruit. The elegantly styled, creamy flavors suggest smoke and mineral, with an appealing sultry feel.
Name: Kerloo 2012 Upland Vineyard Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas on this wine are quite light, conveying wood, herbs and red fruit. This contrasts with the sweet, rich fruit flavors with a gentle grip of tannins.
Name: Sol Stone 2012 Weinbau Grenache (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: The inaugural vintage of this wine offers notes of caramel, herbs and raspberry. The flavors are full, chocolaty and sweet, backed by dry tannins.
Name: Trinity Vineyards 2012 Grenache (Washington)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromatically unusual, this suggests raspberry jam, purple flowers, orange peel and manure. Flavors are tangy and almost seem to have a light spritz.
Name: Burnt Bridge 2012 Upland Vineyards Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This dry-farmed, small-batch wine offers dark purple-fruit aromas alongside spicy spearmint notes and a bit of unique nuttiness. It's fleshy, with ollallieberries and plum-skin flavors on the palate and a fresh fennel herbalness giving licorice grip on the close.
Name: Minassian-Young 2012 Will's Hills Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is one of famed Pinot Noir winemaker Lane Tanner's first stabs at this grape, and she succeeds strongly in this brand with business partner Will Henry. Aromas of cherry, bark, mint candy, dried rose petal and sagebrush give way to an inviting berry pie flavor, followed by a slowly emergent herbal grip that's reminiscent of pine sap.
Name: Lumen 2013 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Appealing aromas of raspberry and cinnamon swirl on the nose from this Rhône specialist based in the Bay Area. There's cherry tomato, strawberry and balsamic vinegar on the palate, with savory sage and a strong grip, yet not overpowering at all.
Name: Comartin 2012 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sourced from a vineyard that straddles the eastern edge of the Sta. Rita Hills, this wine offers aromas of rose water, slightly sour strawberry syrup and flinty gunmetal. It's soft on the palate, with ripe red fruit and Christmas spices that prove light in density but big on flavors.
Name: Dragonette 2012 John Sebastiano Vineyard Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Coming from the popular vineyard owned by the Chumash tribe, this delivers aromas of ripe raspberries and sanguine, earthy elements of iron-rich dirts. It's fairly mellow on the palate, with flavors of wild berry, lifting anise and a dank sense of tree roots.
Name: Comartin 2012 Camp Four Vineyard Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The pretty fruit flavors suggest relatively young vines, bringing light cherry to the front and center. Hints of marzipan, a flash of finishing heat and subtle chalkiness run through the finish. Another year or two of bottle age should continue to improve this one.
Name: Folin Cellars 2012 Estate Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Minerally raspberry and plum aromas are smoky and woodsy in nature. This has a tannic mouthfeel and lightly medicinal, woodsy, briary blackberry and blackcurrant flavors that finish oaky and with a note of anise and/or licorice.
Name: Castillo de Maluenda 2012 Punto y Coma Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Coming from vines planted in 1910, this wine is very light in the glass and reserved on the nose, with hints of iron and red fruits. It's tart on the palate, without much ripe fruit, proving rather dainty but offering a decent grip for such a light wine.
Name: Birichino 2012 Besson Vineyard Old Vines Grenache (Central Coast)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jammy, creamy, oaky aromas of vanilla and raspberry come with a strong hint of rubber and wet dog. This is oaky and only moderately well balanced, with flavors of cough medicine, raw oak, plum and raspberry. A sticky, oaky residual feel drives the finish.
Name: Castillo de Maluenda 2011 Picos Pardos Fusión Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Pinched and wiry-smelling on the nose, this Garnacha comes around with earthy red-berry aromas in front of a full, chunky, fairly oaky palate. Flavors of blackberry and vanilla are good but common, while the finish is dense but basic.
Name: Valcantara 2012 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This discloses funk, rubber and sulfur , but otherwise is a good but chunky and beefy Garnacha. Aromas of rubber and scrambled egg veer toward boysenberry and cassis, while the palate is grabby and jammy. Flavors of baked black fruits, prune and licorice finish pasty and oaky, with a note of sweet plastic.
Name: Pagos del Moncayo 2012 PdM Moncayo Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A metallic note accents cherry and raspberry aromas. This is one part jammy and one part tannic in the mouth, with lightly herbal, spicy, medicinal flavors of plum and berry. Oak, latex and heat are the characteristics that drive the finish.
Name: Amathia NV Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Horsey, stalky, earthy aromas lack freshness. Although the wine is now more than six years, it still has a jagged, tannic palate. Lightly herbal, stewy, stalky raspberry and plum flavors are slightly green and minty on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Montevicor 2008 Centenaria Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Hard-coated cherry aromas are slightly medicinal and candied. A chunky but fairly bright palate delivers cherry, plum and spice flavors along with mild heat on the finish. This is good, standard stuff.
Name: Hedonismo 2012 Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Blocky, warm, earthy berry and raisin aromas smell oaky and minty. This is fairly sticky on the mouth, with resiny oak flavors topping candied berry fruit. This drinks like a liquid bonbon made of milk chocolate and black cherry jam.
Name: Chapillon 2010 Cuvée Paul Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Catalunya, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Initial aromas of stalky, saucy plum and berry fruits become more acceptably rustic with airing. The palate is wiry and scratchy but full in size. Short berry flavors are leathery and horsey, with a pinch of mustard character. The finish is similar, with a molasses note and heat.
Name: Las Rocas de San Alejandro 2011 Garnacha (Catalunya)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Herbal aromas of tomato and thyme blend with spice and red-fruit scents on the nose of this simple Garnacha. A raw, slightly choppy mouthfeel is fresh, while flavors of stalky berry and plum are mildly bitter and woody, with a note of sweet plastic.
Name: Campo Viejo 2012  Rioja

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Reedy berry, green tobacco, vanilla and leathery aromas make up the nose on this jammy, oaky Garnacha. The palate is sticky feeling, with hard, scratchy tannins. Flavors of raw oak, related sawdust and candied vanilla overshadow loamy baked blackberry notes, while the finish is mostly about wood flavor and creaminess.
Name: Bodegas Langa 2011 Tradición Centenaria Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cherry and raspberry aromas are rubbery and show a fair amount of creamy, artificial-smelling oak. This is chewy and resiny in feel, with jammy flavors of raspberry, plastic and vanilla. Heat and oak are the prime players on a weak finish.
Name: Lelia 2012 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of raw oak, paint and dark-berry fruits lead to a medium-bodied palate with candied, oaky, mildly bitter black cherry and plum flavors. A modest finish closes with lasting bitterness and medicinality.
Name: Montevicor 2010 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Grassy, stalky plum aromas are decent but not overly fresh. Without a lot of shape or body, this modest Garnacha is herbaceous and limited in red-fruit flavors. The finish is gone in a flash.
Name: Maximo 2012 Edicion Limitada Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Prune and raisin aromas announce ripeness, which comes with woodsy, earthy, murky berry scents. This feels snappy at first, then more heavy and baked. Prune and spice cake flavors are clumsy, heavy and lack cohesion on the finish.
Name: Alto Cinco 2012 Paniza Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of raspberry and red zinger tea show sulfur and animal aromas. This feels jammy and buttery, with resiny creaminess that's borderline cloying. Flavors of herbal red fruits, oak and green herbs finish jammy and thick.
Name: Castillo de Monséran 2012 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: The 2011 vintage wasn't an easy one in South Australia to say the least, which makes this wine all the more admirable. Mouthwatering, peppery, red-currant fruit remains firm and focused from start to finish, ending on a crisp note. Drink now–2023.
Name: D'Arenberg 2011 The Custodian Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming in at a low (for Washington) alcohol level for this variety, this 100% Grenache shows light aromas of mint and other herbs with elusive raspberry and plum accents. It's medium bodied with an elegant, supple feel, showing little obvious new-oak influence to the red fruit flavors. A very intriguing wine where the texture plays a starring role in the show.
Name: Tertulia 2012 Riviere Galets Estate Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is a concentrated, firmly built example of Grenache, with herbal overtones to its black cherry fruit. Despite the dark plum and cherry fruit, the impression is one of tautness and freshness. Drink it with red meat now, or give it until 2017 to settle down.
Name: Yangarra Estate Vineyard 2011 Old Vine Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Barossa, South Australia, Australia
Description: Plump, supple and a joy to drink, this wine features a complex mélange of aromas and flavors, ranging from menthol and cracked pepper to mocha and roasted meat, all wrapped around a core of red berries. Drink now–2018.
Name: Yalumba 2011 Bush Vine Grenache (Barossa)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this 100% varietal, grapes from Art Den Hoed Vineyard were aged in neutral French oak. Front notes suggest black raspberry, grape Jolly Rancher and kirsch. It's flavorful and supple in feel, with plummy fruit flavors leading to a meat-filled finish. Still drinking young, it should improve with additional time in the bottle.
Name: Tempus Cellars 2012 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine displays peppery, spicy, briery fruit sweetness without discernible berry character. It's silky and plump on the palate, making it easy to drink in the near term.
Name: Epicurean 2011 Bistro Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This aromatic wine brings a potpourri of freshly rubbed sage, Dimetapp, bay leaf and sweet tobacco. It's broad yet light in feel with a pretty sense of elegance and restraint.
Name: Robert Ramsay 2012 Upland Vineyards Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Intensely aromatic, this carries a wealth of layered flavors consistent with past vintages. Umami, sea salt, mineral and Provençal herbs comingle, with a rich component of raspberry, plum and cherry compôte. More layers appear through the finish, with orange liqueur and a whiff of tanned leather.
Name: Cayuse 2011 Armada Vineyard God Only Knows Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Densely planted and labor intensive (it is actually tilled by Belgian draft horses), the vineyard's first releases have been eagerly anticipated, and do not disappoint. Floral highlights are stacked over a swirl of umami, with subtle power and airiness. Delicate and tense, it's packed with brambly berry flavors, minerally acids and fine-grained tannins.
Name: Horsepower 2011 Sur Echalas Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This vineyard was planted specifically for the No Girls project. The wine is fresh, fragrant and intensely floral, with a mix of rosewater and orange zest. Elegant, with a delicate, lacy texture, the flavors are savory and salty, braced with stiff, lightly peppery tannins. Notes of funk and mushroom come into play as it finishes gracefully and with unexpected length.
Name: No Girls 2011 La Paciencia Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Châteauneuf-du-Pape, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Full bodied and plushly textured, this is an opulent wine that's approachable now, but should last through 2025. It's tight and reticent when poured, then opens in the glass to reveal raspberry fruit, with subtle baking spice and cacao.
Name: Pierre Henri Morel 2010 Lieu-Dit Pignan Grenache (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intoxicatingly elegant aromas of cinnamon and baking spices laced with sugared plums and ripe cherries greet the nose on this heavy-duty take on the grape. The palate's first impression is of grippy tannins, with flavors of chocolate-covered cherries, espresso, leather and sandalwood running into a long finish. It is a tad boozy.
Name: Law 2011 The Nines Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Joe Barton, who's made Grey Wolf wines since 1994, launched this brand inspired by pop songs in 2011. This Counting Crows ode delivers aromas of raspberry-laced black tea, clove and cardamom. It's soft and inviting on the palate, with anise, mocha and blackberry flavors that finish with a wash of tobacco. It was still quite tight after hours of being opened, perhaps due to the 35% whole cluster maceration. Drink 2017–2023.
Name: Barton 2011 Mr. Jones Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Syrah is the star of this new appellation, but Grernache does mighty fine too, in this case offering aromas of strawberry reduction sauce, black cloves and cardamom. The palate is heavily laced with crushed dark spices, ripe red fruits, strong tannins and mouthwatering acidity. Waiting until 2016–2017 might make this wine even better.
Name: Stolpman 2012 Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied cherry, cola, wild mint and anise swirl into a layered nose on this wine by a duo of relatively new winemakers, Ian Sergy and Zach Jarosz. Light coffee, clove-spiced berry juice and cinnamon-cherry flavors are on the heavily brown-spiced palate.
Name: Archium 2012 Haven Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine also includes 10% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre and is treated similarly to the producer's larger-production GSM blend. With a shock of menthol on the nose, it veers lean and high in acidity on the palate, a taste of wild strawberry pleasantly consistent around suggestions of earthy game.
Name: Crux 2012 Grenache (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Spice and leaf aromas ride above a mildly ripe nose. Flavors of roasted plum, spice, wild herb and tomato finish well, with firm, slightly raw tannins. Drink this blend of 60% Garnacha, 30% Tempranillo and 10% Graciano through 2019.
Name: La Antigua 2006 Clasico Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A brightly aromatic wine with notes of raspberry jam, orange peel and baking spices. It's tart and tangy, seeming to need some additional time in the bottle to come into its own.
Name: Cowhorn 2012 20 Grenache (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Concentrated on the nose, with oak aromas that are under control, this Garnacha is fresh and firm on the palate. Flavors of loamy berry and cassis are ripe almost to the point of being raisiny. A plump yet dry and spicy finish ends with oak-based resin and creaminess.
Name: Quo 2011 Old Vines Grenache (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lime-laced cherry, cranberry, damp herb and dried violet greet the nose on this bottling, which explores a more sour side of this grape. The flavors range from licorice and chopped olive to cranberry and bitter plum skin.
Name: Standing Sun 2011 Live Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: As usual, this Garnacha is friendly, but serious enough to satisfy all palates. Floral berry aromas lead off the bouquet, leading to a juicy, fresh and pure palate. Flavors of raspberry, plum and a dash of spice finish with a good texture.
Name: Borsao 2013 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Oaky on the nose, this wine shows mint and sawdust aromas that transition to asphalt and fiery heat upon airing. A dense palate is loaded with creamy oak, while leaf, mint and berry flavors finish charred. With 15% alcohol and heafty oak, this could use another year in bottle to settle down.
Name: Bodegas Ateca 2012 Atteca Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Crisp and direct, this Garnacha delivers good berry aromas on the nose. Bold acidity creates a fresh mouthfeel, while racy berry flavors are clean, with a hint of cocoa and toast on the finish.
Name: Lo Nuevo 2012 Sorbo a Sorbo Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Priorat, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Herb and leather aromas lean toward green in character but deliver enough cherry and raspberry tones to bring balance. A full, grippy palate is a touch raw in feel, while leafy berry flavors are mildly green, with a note of carob. The full, bold finish comes with heat.
Name: Casa Rojo 2013 Maquinon Garnacha (Priorat)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Rubbery black cherry and plum aromas are basic but fully ripe on the nose. The fruity palate is somewhat abrupt and harsh in feel, with medicinal black plum and berry flavors. A salty, briny character rises around a slightly hot finish.
Name: Bodegas Ateca 2013 Honoro Vera Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A value wine all the way, this young Garnacha offers fresh red-fruit aromas and touches of earth and spice. The palate is equally fresh and lively, with raspberry, red plum and pepper flavors. Juicy acidity and a hint of chocolate are found on the finish.
Name: Borsao 2013 Viña Borgia Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raspberry and plum aromas are a touch lean and medicinal in the bouquet. Crisp on the palate, with drawing, raw tannins, this wine shows generic raspberry and plum flavors. The fruit falls short on the finish, exposing medicinal and bitter tones.
Name: Santo Cristo 2011 Selección Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Plum, blackberry and graham cracker aromas show a funky edge on the nose of this fruit-forward wine. The jumpy palate is bright and vibrant, with young, fresh raspberry and plum flavors.
Name: Borsao 2013 Monte Oton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Muted black plum and raspberry aromas come with a whiff of latex on the nose. The palate is tannic and grabby, with oaky berry flavors that turn leathery on the finish. Overall this Garnacha is full, staunch and designed for everyday drinking.
Name: Garnacha de Fuego 2013 Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Priorat, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Transparent in color, with a nose that is equally light and airy, this is a crisp, dry, slightly oaky wine, with a hard-smacking palate. Red plum, raspberry, strawberry and currant flavors are subdued, and lead to a sweet-and-sour finish.
Name: Scala Dei 2013 Garnacha (Priorat)

Appellation: Cévennes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: A bright, bouncy, fresh style of Grenache, made in an almost Beaujolais style. With its medium body and candied cherry fruit, drink this over the next year or so.
Name: Domaine de Gournier 2013 Grenache (Cévennes)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aggressive on the start, this Garnacha smells gritty and rough. Overt oak creates a creamy mouthfeel, while herbal and green berry flavors finish bitter.
Name: Pagos Familia Langa 2012 Real de Aragón Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sonoma's Roessler brothers deliver a great Grenache, with cinnamon spice, rose petals, squeezed strawberries and pie crust on the nose. Bright acidity shines on the palate, with red berries and strawberry spritzer flavors. Good tension between tannins and bitterness leads to a mouthwatering finish.
Name: R2 2012 Camp 4 Vineyard Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from 100% Demeter-certified biodynamic grapes, this wine has a bouquet of baked strawberry tart that makes it unique and full of personality. Amidst that is great peppery and earthy spice as well as a hint of dust, with a long-lasting finish.
Name: Quivira 2012 Wine Creek Ranch Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The vineyard for this 100% Grenache is certified sustainable, organic and Biodynamic. Bright and light in strawberry and mint, the wine has a strong herbal component intertwined with tartness and tingling acidity.
Name: Ampelos 2010 Delta The Difference Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Big flavors and full body make this deep-colored Grenache stand out. It combines aromas of ripe raspberry and boysenberry jam with hints of tobacco and cedar in the flavors. All are supported by a firm, tannic texture that is rounded out by a sensation of richness.
Name: Tuck Beckstoffer 2012 Melée Grenache (California)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Dry and rather light-bodied, this has an authentic light color and an intriguing mix of flavors: a hint of rosemary, tasty raspberry and dried cherry. Lip-smacking tannins and good acidity give texture and balance. Grapes come from 100-year-old vines.
Name: Santa Cruz Mountain Vineyard 2012 McDowell Valley Vineyard Grenache (Mendocino)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied Grenache has plenty of personality. There is a smoky, meaty character in the aroma, and the herb, rhubarb and black pepper flavors add interest. It is balanced to the dry, tannic side, which makes it more appetizing and authentic.
Name: Helwig 2013 Frenchmen's Creek Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The berry liqueur aromas common to Core Wine's extended barrel-aging program emerge even on this Grenache. The flavors are more varietally on-point, with raspberry fruit leather, chocolate-covered cherries and a still-strong acidity.
Name: Core Winery 2008 Santa Barbara Highlands Reserve Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Good, solid fruit flavors fill out this light-colored but full-bodied Grenache. It has ripe plum, tart cherry and cedar nuances; a broad, firm texture helps flavors linger on the finish. It's the kind of wine that tastes better with each sip.
Name: Calavera 2012 Dalton Vineyard Grenache (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grenache's essential fruity character is well-preserved thanks to the use of a whole berry press. Popcorn pink in color, it offers sweetly peachy flavors adorned by wild strawberry and tangerine. The wine light and minerally.
Name: Kokomo 2013 Pauline's Vineyard Rosé Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Clements Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: With earthy-piney aromas and light raspberry flavors, this will make a versatile drink with food. Though light in color, it still has richness in the texture and rather full body.
Name: People's Wine Revolution 2012 The People's Grenache (Clements Hills)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Oaky, heavily roasted aromas of hickory, baking spices, coconut and exotic black-fruit scents feed into a chunky but easygoing palate with spicy, barrel-rich flavors of hickory and vanilla as well as baked berry and leather. A ripe, slightly rubbery finish is generous. Drink through 2018.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2010 Veraton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: On the nose, this shows well: Aromas of baked black fruits, spice, coconut and sandalwood work together. This is lush in the mouth, albeit a bit oaky and resiny. Flavors of clove, sun-baked berry fruits, licorice and pepper finish creamy and low on tannic grip. Drink this full-bodied, ripe Garnacha now through 2015.
Name: Bodegas Ateca 2010 Atteca Armas Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Flush, jammy, spicy, peppery aromas are good and fruity. This is full and tight on the palate, with hard tannins. Flavors of plum, berry, vanilla and wood resin finish with a pinched, rubbery feel. This needs food in order to soften the texture.
Name: Pagos Familia Langa 2011 Real de Aragón Centenaria Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy plum and berry aromas bring a floral note. This feels firm, rubbery and tight, with raw tannins and bright acidity. Earthy, rubbery blackberry flavors offer hints of chocolate and fig, while the finish is leathery and a touch salty.
Name: Jardín de Lúculo 2012 Garnachas Atlánticas Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A grapy, clamped nose lacks nuance. In the mouth, this is raw and choppy, with fresh red-fruit acidity. Red-berry and oak flavors finish woody, with ample spice and juicy acidity.
Name: Castillo de Maluenda 2011 Punto Suspensivo Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A light, bright, pink-orange color and cherry-candy flavors make this a kind of Pop Rock bubbly. It has good refreshing acidity, fine bubbles and just a hint of sweetness. Party on!
Name: Rock Wall 2013 Rosé Grenache (Yolo County)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This Garnacha is heavily oaked.Smoky, woody aromas come with dusty berry notes, while the palate is heavy, with cheek-smacking tannins. Flavors of hickory and roasted blackberry finish with another creamy, woody dose of oak.
Name: Vega Sindoa 2012 El Chaparral Old Vines Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raw raspberry and plum aromas feed into a crisp, edgy palate with grating acidity. Tart plum and berry flavors turn earthy upon airing, while this finishes with pointed acidity and snappy red-fruit flavors.
Name: Bodegas Artazu 2012 Artazuri Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Candied oak aromas smell like sweet plastic and rubber, while berry scents lurk below. This is blocky and a bit sticky in feel, with basic plum and berry flavors that finish with a pasty accent.
Name: Bodegas Aragonesas 2012 Viñas Temprana Old Vines Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Clove aromas are dominant. This oaky Garnacha feels sticky and syrupy, while the flavor profile is all candied black fruit and clove. The finish brings more of the same in this one-dimensional wine.
Name: Coto de Hayas 2011 Fagus Selección Especial Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: It's easy for Grenache to get too heavy and rich, but this one doesn't. It's a sophisticated, medium-weight red wine that has the flavor complexity, good acidity and firm texture to make a good pairing with different dishes, from mushrooms to fowl to beef to game.
Name: Naggiar 2011 Estate Grenache (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An aromatically intriguing wine with notes of pepper, cherry cola, chocolate and herbs. It's medium bodied, flavorful with generous cherry notes and a fleshy feel.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2012 Purple Reign Destiny Ridge Vineyard Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Don't come looking for your light and fruity Grenache—the 15.2% alcohol lets you feel the fire pumping through the veins of this deeply ripe and potent wine. In a blind tasting you might easily think it was a Zin rather than a Washington Grenache.
Name: Dusted Valley 2012 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Madera, Central Valley, California, US
Description: The flavors of this very full-bodied wine are dominated by sweet-seeming oak, with smoky, toasty aromas and a maple-cured bacon flavor. Rich, almost sweet, it's very obviously flavored with oak.
