Name: Dante Robere 2012 Love Ranch Vineyard Grenache (Madera)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Initially this smells chunky, gaseous and heavy, but with airing things turn toward minerality and red-berry scents. The palate is immediately pleasing and deep, with good structure and strong but tame tannins. Meaty red-and-black flavors are dense and delicious, while the finish is broad shouldered, with a stout feel and moderate complexity. Drink through 2018.
Name: Castillo de Maluenda 2011 Punto y Seguido Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smoky, spicy berry and plum aromas are more fresh than oaky. This shows a tight, balanced structure and ample body. Flavors of plum, red cherry, berry and vanilla finish direct and fairly long, with clarity as well as some complexity. Drink through 2017.
Name: Castillo de Maluenda 2011 Punto y Coma Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Priorat, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Prior to this vintage, Negre has been a midlevel introduction to Priorato. But this bottling brings the goods and more. Floral berry aromas show Band-Aid and rubber scents, but not too much. Cassis, black cherry and blackberry flavors finish with drive, youthful heat and notes of spice and chocolate. A strong value; drink through 2018.
Name: Scala Dei 2011 Negre Garnacha (Priorat)

Appellation: Clare Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is a smooth-textured, medium- to full-bodied wine loaded with scents of cedar and spice. Red berry fruit emerges on the palate and lingers alongside the cedar notes on the long finish. Drink now–2020.
Name: Kilikanoon 2009 The Duke Grenache (Clare Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Boasting a beautiful ruby red color, this cool-climate Grenache offers aromas of red and pink roses, with blackberry juice down the middle and a lithe, near-citrus freshness on the edges. It's very spicy once sipped, with the blackberry juice and sharper citrus present again. Would be great with blue cheese burgers.
Name: Chamisal Vineyards 2011 Estate Grenache (Edna Valley)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: After 26 months in French oak and additional time in bottle, this is a sumptuously silky Grenache. The complex aromas hint at roasted meat, vanilla and stewed plum, while the flavors follow suit, picking up mocha notes on the long, mouthwatering finish. Ready to drink.
Name: Charles Melton 2009 Richelieu Grenache (South Australia)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Lightly medicinal aromas of Band-Aid and latex accent minerally red-berry scents on this medium-bodied, elegant Rioja Garnacha. A bouncy, fresh palate is modest in body but serious in character; flavors of savory oak, herbs, raspberry and plum finish dry, clean and fresh. Drink through 2017.
Name: Aldonia 2011 100  (Rioja)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Round, robust aromas of ripe berry fruits, minty herbs, latex and smoky oak set up a fresh, tight, slightly tannic and drawing palate with savory, foresty flavors of raspberry and plum. A red-fruit finish shows a touch of citric acid, but overall this is fresh and clean.
Name: Bodegas Muriel 2011 JME  (Rioja)

Appellation: Clare Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This medium-bodied Grenache features vanilla and raspberry compote on the nose. It's a smooth, if not particularly textural wine, with berry flavors and hints of toast that fall away on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Kilikanoon 2009 Prodigal Grenache (Clare Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A complex aromatic profile of the fruit, spice and savory elements found in plum chutney, this promising wine drops off a bit once sipped. But it is still tasty, with freshly picked plum flavors bringing fruit, tartness and tannins together, a bit of bacon fat on the finish.
Name: Epiphany 2011 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Sweet, floral aromas of plum, candied berry and sugar beet are friendlier than the palate, which is a bit piercing and high in acidity. Cherry and tart plum flavors finish with choppy, bright acids and citric flavors.
Name: Lurra 2013 Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: The nose on this Navarran rosado is briny and strained. The palate is on the heavy side, while flavors of peach pit and citrus peel finish pithy and mildly bitter. This will not age well.
Name: Ochoa 2013 Estate Bottled Rosado Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A vivid floral aroma pops from the glass and carries through to the palate, blending orange blossom with bursts of cherry, orange and red vermouth. It's smooth in texture, full-bodied and not very tannic.
Name: Four Fields 2012 Grenache (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Remarkably inky in color for a Grenache-based blend, it features strong aromas of cedar, meat and deeply purple fruit. The soft, rich mouthfeel coats the palate like a luxurious lacquer, and features flavors of blackberry jam, macerated cherry and vanilla-spiced plums. The blend of florals, herbals, fruit and oak-driven tannins is masterful. Drink now by itself or with a peppercorn-crusted filet mignon.
Name: Epoch Estate Wines 2011 Veracity Paderewski Vineyard Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It plays to Grenache's lighter, more refined side in color, flavor and feel. An unusual mix of fruit and savory notes includes herbs, umami, stems, cherry Jolly Rancher, green olive and wet gravel. The texture is creamy and hypnotic, gliding along to a lingering finish. A unique wine that defies easy comparison but keeps drawing you in for additional exploration.
Name: Sleight of Hand 2012 The Sorceress Upland Vineyard Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Pointed red-fruit aromas of currant and plum are light but direct. This feels fresh, with mild raspberry flavors and not a whole lot else. On the finish, mellow notes of vanilla and red plum are supported by not overly aggressive tannins. Drink this fresh Garnacha through 2015.
Name: Fernández Gómez 2010  Rioja

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Light in color and body and modest in alcohol at 12%, this is a curiously intriguing Grenache, tightly wound in freshly picked strawberries and an undeniable earthiness. Aromas lean toward roses with a heavy hint of menthol. A touch of pepperiness on the finish completes the wine.
Name: Sheldon 2012 Ceja Farms Grenache (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Stillwater Creek vineyard fruit spent time in once-used French oak. From a cool site in a cool vintage, the flavors are subdued, with wild purple berry, herb, pepper and earth.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2011 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Milk chocolate and oak aromas blend with lightly herbal berry scents. This is fresh and choppy on the palate, with red-fruit flavors of plum and pie cherry. Aggressive and slightly herbal on the finish, this comes around with airing.
Name: Filón 2012 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Hard and oaky cherry aromas filter into a tangy, zesty, clampy palate. Plum and other red-berry fruit flavors finish raw and rugged, with overt oak character and a touch of minty, herbal green.
Name: Cruz de Piedra 2012 Selección Especial Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Rubbery, herbal red-berry aromas introduce a fresh but grating palate with high acidity. This tastes a touch oaky and herbal, with generic red-fruit flavors. A crisp, slightly sharp finish is as you'd expect.
Name: Marqués de Montañana 2012 Selección Especial Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raisiny, pruny aromas are all that register on this rubbery, jammy Garnacha. Flavors of sweet plum, raspberry and raisin are chunky, while the finish is raisiny in flavor and rubbery in feel.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2010 Conde de Valdemar Old Vines  (Rioja)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Funky aromas of animal fur and lively berry are not that inviting. In the mouth, this has a narrow feel and high acidity. Herbal, tart flavors of plum and red currant are almost sour, while the finish is on the green and herbal side.
Name: Cruz de Piedra 2013 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Tarry, stalky aromas fail to make much of a statement. This is high in acid and rugged in the mouth, with a mixture of herbal red-fruit flavors and distinct stalkiness. A grating finish is racy and hot.
Name: Bodegas Ateca 2012 Honoro Vera Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Smooth and soft, this is a restrained Grenache intense in cranberry and Rainier cherry, easy to drink and love. Made in small quantities from a Lodi producer known for its Zinfandels, it demonstrates the potential of Grenache from the right place in the right hands.
Name: McCay Cellars 2011 Grenache (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The fruit is soft and faded in this wine, which is otherwise soft-medium in body,. It's made by a longstanding producer of Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon.
Name: Concannon 2011 Reserve Grenache (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This was fermented with 50% whole clusters, which slows down and evens up the process. Along with rich flavors of black raspberry fruit, it's dense with savory herbs and marvelous details of earth and forest floor. Delicious now, but just wait until 2020–2022!
Name: Maison Bleue 2011 Boushey Vineyard Le Midi Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Fans of full-bodied, dark-fruited reds will swoon over this modern-style Garnacha from old vineyards in Aragón. Pitch black, the nose provides a pure blast of blackberry and cassis, and the palate is chewy yet fresh, with baked black-fruit flavors as well as coffee, chocolate and vanilla. A smooth, lush, layered finish with vanilla and toffee notes is the final act. Drink through 2017.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2011 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A stunner of a rosé, this wine's pale pink hue does little to indicate its action-packed reality. Nectarine, wet stone, and bubble gum occupy the aroma profile, but the flavors are what set it off. Ruby red grapefruit, strawberry shortcake, and a slight lemon chiffon element hammer home this beauty by Sta. Rita Hills-based superstar producer Kris Curran, formerly of both Sea Smoke and Foley. This is versatile enough to handle both seared scallops and grilled babyback pork ribs.
Name: Curran 2012 Rosé Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This full-bodied, ripe wine  offers blackberry and spiced plum aromas on top of a minerally base. In the mouth, it's big but fresh and free-flowing. Flavors of black plum and black cherry are lively despite some creamy oak that rises on the finish. Drink through 2016.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2011 Veraton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Made from 88% Grenache and 12% Viognier, this lilting wine abounds with dry, fruity and floral characteristics. Salmon-peach in color, it has texture and the requisite refreshment offered by its barely ripe strawberry and peach swathes. Although it delivers enough acidity and bite to pair with food, it might be hard to wait that long.
Name: Midsummer Cellars 2013 Rosé Grenache (Yolo County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep ruby pink in color, this wine begins with a nuanced nose, mixing the fun of grape soda with the elegance of purple flowers. On the palate, it's a tad boozy for pink wine, but the flavors of cherry and currant stand out in front of the alcohol. It would make a nice companion for a dish with ample flavors and actual warmth, such as chicken soup or a tuna melt.
Name: Tre Anelli 2012 Rosé Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from 100% Grenache grapes, it was made in a tiny amount of 50 cases. It offers an almost grenadine-like flavor amidst a core of peach intensity. Softly textured, it's super enjoyable and would go well with a bowl of fruit, eggs and bacon at brunch.
Name: Kobler 2013 Rosé of Grenache (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cherry and raspberry aromas are lively and inviting. This wine offers plenty of body and good balance for the price. Flavors of candied plum and berry are not complex but have support from density and weight on the finish.
Name: Jardín de Lúculo 2012 Los Bohemios Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This spunky Garnacha smells like fruit punch with some green herbs mixed in. The palate is wiry and acidic in feel, with raspberry and plum flavors. It finishes fresh and zesty.
Name: Zorzal 2012 Viña Zorzal Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: While this wine is fast losing steam and zip, what remains revolves around a soft palate and strawberry and nectarine flavors. The finish is holding steady while showing some bitterness. Best to wait for the 2013.
Name: Bodegas del Mundo 2012 Valdemoreda Rosé Garnacha (Rioja)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Stalky aromas of salad dressing and vinegar are offputting. The wine is clumsy and loud on the palate, with sour plum and bitter, stalky flavors. A zesty but blocky finish does not help.
Name: La Granja 360 2013 Rosé Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: From the cool 2011 vintage, this wine brings notes of black tea, dark raspberries and herbs. It's tangy with lip-smacking plum and cranberry flavors backed by firm tannins.
Name: Cowhorn 2011 Grenache 42 Grenache (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A sensational effort, this wine is 100% varietal, sourced from four vineyards scattered throughout the sprawling Columbia Valley. Fragrant and concentrated, its hallmarks are purity and intensity. Plum, cherry liqueur and cassis are the focus, with bright lemony acids adding lift and zip to the mouthfeel.
Name: Syncline 2011 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This small-production, single-vineyard Grenache is direct and appealing with notes of raspberry compote, strawberry, orange peel, violets and tapenade. The palate is pure silk, elegant in its styling with an extended finish.
Name: Kerloo 2011 Upland Vineyard Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: 20% whole-cluster fermented, this rich, brooding blend of Alder Ridge (86%) and Snipes Mountain Grenache brings notes of licorice, dark cherry, black pepper and mortared herbs. It's broad in feel, tart, fruit filled, and tightly wound, needing time in the cellar to unfurl.
Name: Kerloo 2011 Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This aged for 18 months in new French barriques, and the influence of that is marked. Cedary, gently sawdusty notes and a touch of nail polish are apparent on the nose, while the palate is admirably full bodied and richly textured. The finish is generally velvety, but also shows hints of varnish or paint thinner. Overall, the raw materials are impressive, but the wine comes across as a bit disjointed.
Name: Torbreck 2009 Les Amis Grenache (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A rich, full-bodied wine with notes of cherry and plum. It's sweet and tangy with a huckleberry and wood spice-filled finish.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2011 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Stalky, earthy aromas are leathery and lack freshness. The tired, heavy palate has flavors of saucy berries mixed with dill, vanilla and raw oak.
Name: Azabache 2008  Rioja

Appellation: Almansa, Central Spain, Spain
Description: The wine offers candied, medicinal aromas and a bland, fruit-juice-like palate. Grape and red-fruit flavors are tart and scouring.
Name: Bodega Tintoralba 2012 BT Spanish Inspiration Garnacha (Almansa)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An expressive, vibrantly pure wine with a complex medley of notes including dark raspberries, wet gravel, crushed flowers and cherry. Aged in five year old French oak barrels, it's vivid and focused with an initial elegance and delicacy that continues to flesh out and evolve over time. Give it some time in the cellar to see it at its best.
Name: Maison Bleue 2011 La Montagnette Upland Vineyard Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A small-production Grenache from 100-plus-year-old vines, this wine is dusty and fragrant with ripe cherry and strawberry flavors. Light in weight and easy to drink, the undercurrent whispers licorice.
Name: Horse & Plow 2012 Testa Vineyard Old Vine Grenache (Mendocino)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a midweight Grenache with fruit that's straightforward in its ripeness. The palate is more dark plum than strawberry with a tar-like character to the finish.
Name: Fenestra 2010 Estate Grenache (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Marked by aromas of raspberry liqueur, this is a sweet, listless Grenache. Sourced from a good site in Mendocino.
Name: Claudia Springs 2010 Rhodes Vineyards Grenache (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: A venture into the deep end of pricing perhaps, but the proof is in the bottle. From vines planted in 1964, this is a rich, full-bodied and creamy-textured wine, with complex notes of smoke, vanilla, plum and roasted meat. Approachable now because of its lushness, it should drink well for at least the next several years.
Name: Angove 2010 Warboys Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: For an Australian Grenache, this has an invitingly cool, herbal bouquet, hinting at dried flowers and black tea. But it's unapologetically full-bodied and rich on the palate, adding black cherries and dark chocolate to the mix. It's warm, velvety and almost fudge-like on the finish yet not raisiny at all. Drink it over ?the next few years.
Name: Chapel Hill 2010 Bush Vine Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Made in a supple, immediately approachable style, this is a nicely supple, slightly creamy, almost gulpable red. Raspberry and cherry fruit is buttressed by ample spice, then ends on a lingering note of star anise. Drink now–2018.
Name: Turkey Flat 2010 Grenache (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Like most high-end varietal Garnachas, this hits with big but straightforward berry aromas and not a lot of complexity. A jagged palate shows powerful tannins and baked, jammy flavors of blackberry. This is grabby and slightly astringent on the finish, but in general it's tasty and well made. Drink through 2016.
Name: Dinastía Vivanco 2010 Colección Vivanco Parcelas  (Rioja)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: At under 14% abv, this Grenache is the antithesis of many of its peers. It's red-fruited and only medium in body, with some dusty tannins evident on the finish. Worth holding for a few years to see if the fruit opens up a bit and better absorbs the presently toasty veneer of oak.
Name: D'Arenberg 2010 The Beautiful View Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Light in color, this is a revelation for this young growing region. The wine has complex notes of peppery spice, citrus and raspberries. It's light and delicate in style with tart cranberry flavors and fine grained tannins that still need some time to fully flesh out. An impressive effort, especially considering the challenges of the vintage.
Name: Jaxon 2011 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This medium-bodied wine isn't particularly ripe or fleshy for Grenache, but does show plenty of earthy fruit, hints of tobacco and mocha and some beet-like notes. The silky, slightly dusty tannins on the finish are especially attractive. Drink now–2018.
Name: D'Arenberg 2010 The Blewitt Springs Grenache (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Barossa, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is a herbal, spicy rendition of Grenache, with strawberry-rhubarb notes providing the foundation. The elevated alcohol shows on the warm and slightly dusty finish, but the body of the wine is deceptively medium weight—an intriguing paradox. Ready to drink now.
Name: Langmeil 2010 The Fifth Wave Grenache (Barossa)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Peppery plum and raspberry aromas lead to a crisp, snappy, juicy palate with apple skin and raspberry flavors enhanced by a splash of minty oak. With modest length and power through to the finish, this is a good and approachable everyday wine.
Name: Castillo de Monjardin 2011 Old Vines Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raisin, licorice and coconut aromas produce a ripe bouquet. This is raw and screechy in the mouth, with little in the way of a midpalate. Flavors of heavy red-berry fruits have a green leaning, while the finish is raw in feel and reedy in flavor.
Name: Dinastía Vivanco 2008 Colección Vivanco Parcelas de  (Rioja)

Appellation: Almansa, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Opaque black to the eye, this is a massive, high-alcohol, syrupy Garnacha that is more like Port than dry wine. Aromas of prune and raisin dominate, while the palate is thick as molasses, with gummy, raisiny flavors that finish with heady notes of coffee and chocolate syrup. At 16% ABV, and with outlandish weight and stickiness, this isn't what you'd call a food-friendly table wine.
Name: Atalaya 2011 Alaya Garnacha (Almansa)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Stalky aromas of compost-laden berry fruits lack clarity and freshness. This feels chunky on the palate, with herbal, salty flavors of earthy berry fruits.
Name: Zorzal 2011 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jumpy aromas suggest wet animal fur. In the mouth, there's not a lot of structure or body; flavors of buttery oak and candied berry lack continuity.
Name: Príncipe de Viana 2011 Roble Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A rusty color is a give-away that this Garnacha isn't in the best shape. The nose smells of cotton candy and Kool-Aid. The feel is flat, grabby and tannic, while the flavors are scattershot, with brown sugar notes and dry leafiness on the finish.
Name: Casa Primicia 2008 Gn  (Rioja)

Appellation: Almansa, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Minty, candied, wet-dog aromas announce that this is a young, basic wine. The mouthfeel is fresh and acidic, while the flavors of candied berry fruits come across dilute and with little depth.
Name: Bodegas Tintoralba 2011 Tintorera Higueruela Garnacha (Almansa)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Intensely fruity on the nose, with spicy flavors that follow and expand across the palate. This has excellent grip and depth, along with balancing acidity and structure. Plum, kirsch and concentrated cherry flavors pop out. It's a wine of refined power.
Name: Cayuse 2010 Armada Vineyard God Only Knows Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The No Girls Grenache, from a vineyard adjacent to Armada (the source for the Cayuse God Only Knows Grenache) is lighter, more elegant, perhaps brighter than its companion wine, with fresh blueberry and other pie berry  fruits, a streak of umami, herbal tea and impressive minerality. Almost Burgundian in style, it possesses excellent length and wonderful texture.
Name: No Girls 2010 La Paciencia Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A brightly aromatic wine with a medley of raspberry, cranberry, herbs and cherry. It's solid in feel with a good sense of concentration and freshness.
Name: Coyote Canyon 2010 Coyote Canyon Vineyard Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A spicy blend of 44% Grenache, 32% Syrah and 24% Tempranillo, all grown in Fair Play, an increasingly interesting place for Rhône varieties. With soft swirls of fruity plum amid masculine tobacco and leather, there's a lusciousness to the finish that's appealing but could use a bit more of a kick.
Name: Baiocchi Wines 2011 G minor Red (Fair Play)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: With an electric pink color and candied aromas of watermelon and cherry, this is a spunky rosé that's juicy, lively and pleasant. Flavors of raspberry and plum come and go quickly, and the finish is just acidic and crisp enough.
Name: Príncipe de Viana 2012 Rosado Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Clements Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Super light in color, this Garnacha has a pretty nose of cassis liqueur and is bunny-soft with barely any tannic imprint at all. Pair with equally light fare like not-too-pungent cheeses, breadsticks and such, or drink while cooking the main meal.
Name: Riaza 2011 Garnacha (Clements Hills)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: With slightly sharp, herbal red-fruit aromas, this representes the lighter side of Garnacha. In the mouth, it's choppy but fresh, while leafy flavors of plum, raspberry and peppery spice finish fiery and dry.
Name: El Pensador 2010 The Thinker Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Whereas once Ochoa produced some of Navarra's best rosés, lately the wines have been marginal. This is awkward, with aromas of chemicals and rubber gloves. The palate is wan in flavor and feel, while the finish tastes burnt and medicinal.
Name: Ochoa 2012 Rosado Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: For all intents and purposes, this is a red wine. It's 90% red in color, and the nose and palate are chunky and wide. Flavors of red licorice and candied berry lack snap, and the finish tastes bitter and feels flat.
Name: Señorío de Sarria 2012 Viñedo N° 5 Rose Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Spicy in aroma and mouthfeel, this is a wondrous wine, gorgeous in lovely ripe cherry and strawberry notes that are completely enveloped in thrills of white pepper. Those who love cool climate Rhônes will find much to ponder and celebrate. Racy, it is fragrant and lean, made without fining or filtering. Seek this one out.
Name: Donkey & Goat 2012 Grenache Noir Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An intoxicatingly sensual Grenache, velvety and light in cherry and strawberry fruit, smooth earth, a streak of anise and deep swirls of chocolate and caramel on the finish. The Dalton Vineyard in Calaveras County has been one to watch for in Syrah and Zinfandel; it can now add Grenache.
Name: Calavera Wines 2011 Dalton Vineyard Grenache (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: One would be hard pressed to find another California Grenache Noir of this caliber at this price. A well-made wine from high-elevation fruit, it opens with a slight nose of fennel and anise before showing off a meaty dark plum depth of flavor, firm tannins and a long finish of tobacco. It's fairly priced, too.
Name: dîner 2012 Grenache Noir Grenache (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a blockbuster-sized Grenache, intensely fragrant in charcuterie and raspberry liqueur. While meaty it is also soft, reflective of its 25% new French oak and a statement on the power of Fair Play's granite soils. Pair with robust fare for this is not a wine that will sit quietly in the corner.
Name: Baiocchi Wines 2010 Sharon's Vineyard Grenache (Fair Play)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A brightly aromatic wine with notes of candied fruit, raspberries, freshly ground herbs and cranberry. The palate has plump, ripe fruit flavors that glide on the finish.
Name: Robert Ramsay 2011 Grenache Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is Blue Plate's first red wine after a couple successful vintages of Clarksburg Chenin Blanc. It's an impressive wine and one hell of a deal. Light in color with a pretty nose of flowery raspberry and strawberry, it's softly textured and delicious with a long finish, a wine to savor but not take too seriously, simply drink and enjoy.
Name: Blue Plate 2012 Grenache (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The nose is dominated by spices and herbs, a whiff of violets, fennel and white chocolate. Complex and intriguing, it leads into fruit flavors of plum and cherry, with a hint of alcoholic heat. The wine improved substantially after being open for several hours.
Name: Ott & Murphy 2010 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A hint of veggie limits the score. It shows up as a bell pepper and jalapeño note to the cherries and currants.. High alcohol gives it some burn. Drink up.
Name: Sanguis 2010 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a bit of a disappointing follow-up to the outstanding 2009. It moves past flavors of ripe berry and on to scents and flavors of raisins. Tannins are stiff and drying, and the high alcohol carries heat through the finish. It's a bold style, but drink soon as it's not likely to age.
Name: Trio Vintners 2010 Far Away Vineyard Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Winemaker/owner Chuck Mansfield is devoted to California Grenache, offering this gem from the Sierra Foothills' subregion of El Dorado County. Light in color and fresh in taste, its layers of slightly savory rhubarb and strawberry are boosted by firm acidity and an enticing finish of spice. At under $20 this is an exceptional deal for the quality.
Name: Four Fields 2011 Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend includes a splash of Syrah, but it's essentially Grenache in flavor, with a bit of funk. Brambly, juicy berry flavors roll into raspberry pie, with a streak of composted earth. It's tart, tangy and moderately complex—a great start for this young vineyard.
Name: Tulpen 2010 Yellow Bird Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 24% Syrah all coming from Stone Tree Vineyard, the wine saw only a kiss of new oak (16%) putting the fruit front and center. There are notes of red plum and herbs with tart flavors, grainy tannins and a puckering finish.
Name: Dusted Valley 2011 Stone Tree Vineyard Grenache (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite fruity and forward, this non-vintage Grenache brings the pretty, juicy, plum and cherry flavors of the variety into good focus. It's a soft and delightful wine. It's best to drink it soon.
Name: Redd Brand NV Lonesome Spring Vineyard Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's a lot of promise in this blend of Grenache (85.5%), Syrah (10%), Mourvèdre (4%) and Roussanne (0.5%). Coming from a cool vintage, it's aromatic with notes of raspberry, white pepper, and flowers. The palate is light, tart and fresh.
Name: Lookout Point 2011 Grenache (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: It's rare to find a varietally labeled Grenache that comes in under 13% alcohol, but here you have it. Blended with 10% Syrah, it has notes of white pepper, smoked meat, savory spices and red fruit. What it lacks in terms of depth it makes up for in purity and elegance.
Name: Quady North 2011 Bomba Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Valle de Guadalupe, Mexico
Description: This fiery Grenache delivers heat, bold fruit and cured meat aromas on what amounts to a flaming bouquet. Red fruit flavors dominate this forceful wine, while the finish turns meaty and salty tasting.
Name: Hacienda La Lomita 2010 Pagano Grenache (Valle de Guadalupe)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Forward cherry and plum aromas are fresh and lively. A blocky, full-bodied palate offers tasty plum and berry flavors in front of a firm finish with chocolaty notes and length. This is basic but done well.
Name: Maximo 2011 Edicion Limitada Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe, lightly spiced black cherry and berry aromas announce a good but basic wine. The palate is a bit tough in feel but it's solidly built. Candied, generic black-fruit flavors end simply, with modest syrupy sweetness.
Name: Bodegas Navarro López 2011 Rojo Granrojo Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Spain, Spain Other, Spain
Description: This is dark but somewhat green on the nose, with currant, raspberry, beet and green herb aromas. The palate feels tight to the point of abrasive, with herbal plum flavors. A minty, forceful finish registers as hard and tannic.
Name: Real Compañia de Vinos 2011 Garnacha (Spain)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Scratchy, dusty red-berry aromas are decidedly sweet yet hollow. This semisweet Garnacha tastes of gummy red fruits. A flat, cloying finish with candied flavors confirms its sweet status.
Name: Cosecheros y Criadores 2011 Sweet Torito Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Cedarville's estate-grown, Priorat-inspired blend of 45% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 25% Cabernet Sauvignon, is well made and inclined to age. It's still soft and oaky with a hint of leathery cassis and game. Imagine a Spanish fiesta for this food-friendly wine.
Name: Cedarville 2010 Turnabout's Red (Fair Play)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine is fresh as can be, with loads of friendly black-fruit aromas upfront. The palate is juicy and bright, not the least bit hard or tannic, with huge flavors of berry fruits, baking spices, chocolate and even some bacon. This delivers a lot for the price.
Name: Bodegas Ateca 2011 Honoro Vera Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: With a hint of rubber and asphalt, the bouquet on this value wine is generous and topped with blackberry and dark plum aromas. The palate is grabby, with clampy tannins and black-fruit flavors mixed with chocolate and spice. The earthy, lightly herbal finish with rubbery nuances is nice.
Name: Tres Ojos 2011 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Valencia, Levante, Spain
Description: This is a clean, fresh style of Garnacha with floral black cherry aromas offset by a minty note. The palate has a zingy feel and crisp, fresh plum, raspberry and dry herb flavors. As a whole it's focused and uncomplicated; this is very good Garnacha from one of the Valencia region's better producers.
Name: Bodegas Rafael Cambra 2010 Soplo Garnacha (Valencia)

Appellation: Priorat, Catalonia, Spain
Description: This is a big, modern, warm Garnacha with a lot of oak and vanilla on the bouquet as well as blackberry and cassis. It's jammy on the tongue, but there's enough acidity to keep the pulse up. Dark black cherry, berry and rubbery flavors are followed by end-notes of raisin, chocolate and vanilla.
Name: Casa Rojo 2009 Fauno Organic Grapes Garnacha (Priorat)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This Garnacha is perfectly good in every way, shape and form. The nose is loaded with bright berry aromas and a hint of mint. The palate feels lively and right, while flavors of raspberry, blackberry and leather lead to a deep, long, slightly hot finish.
Name: Marqués de Montañana 2011 Selección Especial Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is straightforward, no-frills Garnacha with plum and berry aromas followed by a tight, slightly tannic palate that houses raspberry and plum flavors. The finish is smooth for the most part, with some heat and herbal flavors.
Name: Bodegas Artazu 2011 Artazuri Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Valencia, Levante, Spain
Description: ). After a slightly mossy bouquet, this unfolds in broad, chunky style. It offers good balance and mouthfeel, with lightly herbal flavors of dark berry fruits, tobacco and leather. A mildly herbal-tasting finish is plump and solid in feel.
Designation: El Miracle by Mariscal Old Vine
Name: Vicente Gandia 2010 El Miracle by Mariscal Old Vine Garnacha (Valencia)

Appellation: La Mancha, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Grassy berry and light, leafy aromas define the bouquet. The mouth is a little tangy but mostly jammy, while blueberry, lemony oak and dilution define the flavor profile. A short, choppy, jammy finish comes across slightly washed out.
Name: Finca Antigua 2010 Garnacha (La Mancha)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Prune and raisin aromas pour off the bouquet, providing more than a clue that this wine is on the overripe side. That's confirmed in the mouth, where things feel tannic and over the top; flavors of raisin, sugar beet and chocolate finish with heat and hardness.
Name: Garnacha de Fuego 2011 Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This barrel-fermented rosé is flat and smells more like apple juice than wine. Despite showing some tang, this is dull in the mouth, with bland orange and nectarine flavors. On the finish, it's washed out and has an iodine-like aftertaste.
Name: Finca Albret 2011 Rosado Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Catalunya, Catalonia, Spain
Description: This reedy, strained Garnacha features cheesy aromas, stalky fruit and chemical notes. The palate is hard in feel, with a weedy, burnt aftertaste.
Name: Bodegas 1898 2009 Ramón Roqueta Garnacha (Catalunya)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy and floral, with pretty cherry fruit concentrated at the core, this inviting Grenache combines grace and power. The flavors are complex and concentrated, with hints of green tea, cut tobacco, and a finishing streak of espresso and cocoa.
Name: Bunnell 2009 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: The translucent violet tint this gives off is as attractive as the wine's concentrated bouquet of cassis, blackberry and earthy richness. It's big and bulky in the mouth, with rubbery, exotic flavors of blueberry and Middle Eastern spices like cardamom and cumin. This is a bold wine for fans of fruit-forward reds. Drink now–2016.
Name: Pagos del Moncayo 2011 PdM Moncayo Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is violet in color, with blueberry aromas as well as notes of juniper and pine. It has a smooth mouthfeel, more than adequate weight and power, and dominant but fresh black-fruit flavors that turn syrupy as the wine breathes. Overall, it's very flavorful but jammy. Drink now–2015.
Name: Coto de Hayas 2011 Centenaria Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The Amador Zin specialist is offering its first ever Grenache here, a tremendous debut, super light in color and texture, lightly rendered to show off its layers of delicate violet and raspberry amid a meatier backbone of lurking anise and herbs. With 9% Mourvedre and 5% Syrah, this is a light red worth seeking out.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2011 Estate Bottled Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: The bouquet on this Garnacha is mildly raisiny, with cola, mint and medicinal accents. The palate has a juicy, forward feel, while the flavors trend more towards dense, sweet plum and berry, with a pinch of lemony oak. It finishes with medium intensity and rewarding, ripe flavors.
Name: Quo 2010 Premium Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Cedarville continues to make stellar, fairly priced estate grown wines, with this Grenache a prime example of the property's ability to nurture spicy, broad shouldered reds. Concentrated and intense, with dark fruit and a savory profile, the oak is prominent but defined. The oak is present, but should fall back with age.
Name: Cedarville 2010 Estate Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An aromatic estate grown Grenache with notes of sasparilla, raspberry jam, and white pepper. It's luscious and rich with succulent red fruit flavors and soft tannins, showing some heat on the finish.
Designation: Purple Reign Estate Grown Grenache Destiny Ridge Vineyards
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2010 Purple Reign Estate Grown Grenache Destiny Ridge Vineyards Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra del Bajo Aragón, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: The color may be fading but this wine is still pumping out a lot of volume. The nose features earthy, meaty, raisiny aromas. In the mouth, it's syrupy and borderline sticky, with flavors of caramel, cooked berry fruits and creamy oak. Yes, it's a touch syrupy but for $12 it's bringing a lot to the table. Drink now.
Name: Bodegas Tempore 2009 Esenzia Old Vine Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra del Bajo Aragón)
Region: Vino de la Tierra del Bajo Aragón

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Prune and blackberry aromas announce this Garnacha. The palate is aggressive and oaky, with astringency and hard tannins running side by side with black, toasty flavors of blackberry, molasses and chocolate. Things turn more sticky and ripe on the finish.
Name: Gastiago 2010 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Although the bouquet is a bit scratchy, bright, lightly candied aromas of raspberry and strawberry jam are friendly and welcoming. The wine is firm on the palate and well built, with fresh, slightly jammy tasting plum and berry flavors. And it's lasting and fresh on the finish.
Name: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2010 Menguante Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This value Garnacha is a fruity number with a no-nonsense berry character and clarity throughout. Cherry and plum aromas are vibrant, while flavors of black plum, boysenberry and medicinality are more than fine. Pepper, spice and overall warmth carry the finish.
Name: Borsao 2011 Monte Oton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: For $10 this is a serious, powerful Garnacha with concentration and purity. The palate feels both crisp and lifted as well as dense and concentrated. There's quality to the flavor profile, which offers rubbery, dense blueberry along with blackberry. Rarely does a value-priced wine show this much weight and texture.
Name: Cruz de Piedra 2011 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This young Garnacha is fresh and fruity, and entirely approachable and likable given the price. The palate is fairly smooth and medium in weight, with blackberry flavors that fade to darkness on the finish. This was made for everyday sipping.
Name: Valcantara 2011 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is a dark bomber with black cherry, kirsch, lemony oak and shoe polish aromas. The palate is creamy and big, with acid-derived lift boosting blackberry and licorice flavors. With tons of black-fruit character, this qualifies as a fruit-forward wine with sweet overtones.
Designation: El Chaparral de Vega Sindoa Old Vines
Name: Vega Sindoa 2010 El Chaparral de Vega Sindoa Old Vines Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Lively cherry and berry aromas come with a touch of prickle and snap. The palate has a wiry, energetic feel, and the flavors of berry and cherry satisfy and come with aftertastes of molasses and baked sweetness.
Name: Lelia 2011 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: You won't find many $7 wines better than this Garnacha. The bouquet of fresh berries is like a bowl of black fruit. The palate is lively and a touch creamy, with medicinal, candied flavors of plum and cherry. This wine, like most Borsao reds, delivers above its price point.
Name: Borsao 2011 Viña Borgia Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite dark in color for an unblended Grenache, this wine is full of plum and ripe raspberries with the tartness of the 2010 vintage on display. The oak—half new French—plays a bit too prominently in the show on this otherwise enjoyable wine.
Name: Apex 2010 Alder Ridge Vineyard Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is yet another good Campo de Borja wine relative to price. It's hard and dark on the nose, but there's nothing unusual or difficult about the bouquet. The palate is lively in feel, with candied raspberry and lightly herbal strawberry flavors. The finish is fresh and juicy, with medicinal notes.
Name: Crucillon 2011 Tinto Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is a big, ripe Garnacha with raisiny aromas, gumminess and green hints to the bouquet. The palate is thick and chewy, with tannic clamp and flavors of pastry, berry jelly and lactic blueberry. On the finish, things revert to raisin and prune.
Name: Acentor 2011 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: The nose on this value wine is raw and citrusy, with a note of earthy leather. The palate feel is plump and soft, with rubbery, jammy flavors of herbal berry fruit and rubber. The finish is short and jammy, but bright and forward.
Name: Beso de Vino 2010 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine is dusty on the nose, with aromas of red pepper flake, citrus and red fruits. It's fleshy in the mouth and showing grip along with flavors of pomegranate, pink grapefruit and tangerine. Solid, cleansing and dry on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Bodegas Julián Chivite 2011 Gran Feudo Rosado Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This standard Garnacha is good and honest on the nose, with fresh red-berry aromas. In the mouth, it's snappy and kind of lean, with a lightweight composition and zesty flavors of raspberry and cherry. It's quick to finish, with a note of vanilla.
Name: Bodegas San Isidro 2010 Fabla Old Vines Grenache (Calatayud)

Appellation: Penedès, Catalonia, Spain
Description: This Garnacha is maderized, with leafy aromas of burnt rubber, herbs, tea and spice more than bold fruit. The palate has a light feel, with buttery creaminess and flavors of vanilla, butter, licorice, black cherry, cassis and medicinal raisin. The finish is a bit hot and raw.
Name: Parés Baltà 2010 Indigena Garnatxa Garnacha (Penedès)

Appellation: Priorat, Catalonia, Spain
Description: This is a stewed, raisiny wine on the nose, while in the mouth it's more acidic and flush, but not quite elegant or sophisticated. The palate deals a short burst of heavy plum and berry flavor, and the finish is jammy and ripe but lacks complexity.
Name: Scala Dei 2010 Negre Garnacha (Priorat)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raspberry and milk chocolate aromas are simple and come across a bit like plastic. The wine is narrow on the palate, with herbal plum flavors, while the finish is short and doesn't elevate things. Even at $9 this is regular in overall quality.
Name: Marques de la Musa 2011 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Burnt, stalky, toasted aromas dominate this inexpensive Garnacha, and there's not much freshness to the nose as a result. In the mouth, it's more of the same; things are heavy, with fully oaked flavors of medicinal berry, hickory and barbecued meat.
Name: Lo Nuevo 2010 Sorbo a Sorbo Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine is creamy, lactic and jammy on the nose, with flat, earthy, baked berry aromas. It's grabby and sort of gummy and soft feeling, with lactic strawberry and plum flavors that set up a creamy, sticky finish.
Name: Picos Pardos 2010 Garnacha Fusión Red (Calatayud)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is a prickly, slightly raspy wine with a lean, grabby feel and briny, pickled flavors of herbal red-berry fruits. It's resiny tasting on the finish, with a snappy feel and lasting herbal flavors.
Name: Chispas 2011 Tinto Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This basic wine opens with earthy red-berry aromas. The palate offers choppiness and green-leaning flavors of berry and tea. The finish is scratchy and hollow. An OK Garnacha on its best day.
Name: Bodegas la Casa de Lúculo 2010 Cátulo Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Scratchy, candied aromas of red fruits get things off to a rough start. The wine is acidic in feel, with tart, herbal red-fruit flavors. And it finishes pickled, with an herbal sharpness.
Name: Abrazo 2011 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is a just-acceptable wine with latex, roasted berry and plastic-like aromas. It's heavy in the mouth, with jumbled, roasted flavors of rubbery fruit and forced oak.
Name: Agustín Cubero 2010 Unus Old Vine Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As excellent as this was was in 2009, the 2010 has reached an almost-ethereal level. The aromatics alone are transportive, with the concentrated essence of raspberries and blueberries at optimal ripeness. The flavors are deep and long, elegant and powerful, and they lead into a finish that's anchored in notes of mineral and dark chocolate.
Name: Maison Bleue 2010 Boushey Vineyard Le Midi Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A structured, mountain-grown Grenache, with 20% Syrah in the mix, this features cherry cola, black tea and meat flavors, plus oak tones and docile tannins. It's ready to drink, but it's built to age for another 3–5 years.
Name: Andis 2011 Grenache (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: There's not a lot of old-vine Grenache in California, so this Horse & Plow selection made from Testa Vineyard fruit is worth the hunt. It's a bright, food-friendly wine, and it offers light layers of raspberry and violet flavors.
Name: Horse & Plow 2011 Testa Vineyard Old Vine Grenache (Mendocino)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This Grenache leaps into another dimension, with more concentration, earth, umami and salinity than ever before, yet it retains its elegance thanks to a crisp finish of raspberry and rock flavors. Reminiscent in a way to high-altitude Argentine Malbec, this will cellar well for a decade or more.
Name: Cayuse 2009 God Only Knows Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Quite dark and dense, generous and ripe, this Grenache offers a mix of red and black fruits. The flavors continue onto a finish that's rich with kirsch and coffee.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2010 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This aromatic rosé is a lovely shade of pale salmon, and has mashed apple and yeasty, almost hoppy notes. Flavors are bracing and lively, hinting at pretty cherry fruit.
Name: Abacela 2011 Rosé Grenache (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is a powerful, rich, toasty Garnacha, with grit, earth and spice galore on the bouquet. It feels tough, masculine and tannic, with a mix of beefy black-fruit flavors elevated by molasses and spice. Firm and showing some burn on the finish, along with notes of black licorice and peppery spice. Only 200 cases made. Drink now–2016.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2009 Aquilon Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Clements Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This has 10% Monastrell in the mix, and it is a sublime example of what flavors of baked raspberry compote, cranberry and black licorice can do when allowed to mingle together in liquid form. Medium in body, this has a lot of earthiness. It would make a fine alternative to more expensive Pinots.
Name: Bokisch 2010 Terra Alta Vineyard Garnacha (Clements Hills)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smoky, charred and minerally on the nose, this has a balsamic berry aroma and lots of dark spice. It feels deep, pure and layered, with flavors of wild berry, toast, baked plum and dark spice. It finishes big, with hints of rubber, blackberry and lasting spice.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2009 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is intense for Garnacha, with piercing berry, spice and heat to the bouquet. This is a big, burly type of modern Garnacha, with a streak of boosting acidity. Flavors of plum, berry and cherry finish long and slightly raisiny. Big and bruising but still well balanced.
Name: Alto Moncayo 2009 Veraton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raisin and kirsch aromas are soft and rich, settling on strawberry and spice notes. The palate is lifted by firm acidity and solid tannins, while the wine's core flavors of raspberry, plum and herb serve it well. It finishes warm and sweet tasting, with licorice and molasses flavors that are tempered by a baking spice note.
Name: Terrazas del Moncayo 2009 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Châteauneuf-du-Pape, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Superripe in style, this 100% Grenache bottling boasts hints of raisined fruit and chocolaty richness but also notes of beetroot and alfalfa. This is full bodied, loaded with chewy tannins that turn drying and astringent on the finish. Its future evolution seems uncertain.
Name: Tardieu-Laurent 2009 Cuvée Spéciale Grenache (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: One's first impression is of a minty wine, with a cranberry flavor and plenty of acidity. Spicy and tart, it seems a little stiff. But retasted a full day later, the wine had retained its structure, adding some depth to the fruit and pretty baking spice to the finish.
Name: Novelty Hill 2009 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This Navarran Garnacha is more interesting, offering lemony, floral aromas that are red in nature and not very stout. The palate sizzles with racy acidity, while the flavor profile is pure and tangy, with cranberry and red plum notes. A zesty style of Grenache.
Name: Bodegas Artazu 2008 Santa Cruz de Artazu Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Proprietor's Reserve Grenache is one of a handful of Maryhill's 2010 reds that improves upon the previous vintage. Sappy and relatively substantial, this has a core of Bing cherry, along with chewy tannins and an earthy finish.
Name: Maryhill 2010 Proprietor's Reserve Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raisiny and jammy on the bouquet, this wine becomes vital in the mouth, with fresh acidity supporting the raspberry and red plum flavors. The raisiny resurfaces on the finish, with acidic bite.
Name: Campos de Luz 2008 Crianza Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This boasts a Christmas spice note on top of an earthy, baked berry aroma. It feels grabby, flat and gummy, with syrupy berry flavors along with a load of odd spices. As a whole, this is strangely oaked and doesn't show Garnacha in its best light.
Name: Coto de Hayas 2009 Fagus Selección Especial Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is dry, herbal and leathery on the nose. On the palate, this feels snappy and crisp, with flavors of peppery red fruits that are leafy, herbal and almost green. Turns hotter and sharper the longer it breathes.
Name: Castillo de Monséran 2008 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: The Gil family understands how to make fully loaded reds that are balanced and highly enjoyable. Look for a saturated, rich nose with brandied plum, blackberry pastry and toasty oak notes. The palate is both lush and racy, with dark berry and chocolate flavors. It finishes huge and masculine, almost like fudge. Drink now–2015.
Name: Bodegas Ateca 2009 Atteca Armas Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Emphatically toasty and charred on the nose, this offers chocolate and hickory aromas. It feels smooth, plush, layered and not at all simple, with baked black-fruit flavors that are draped over savory barbecue and spice accents. The toast is present but not overpowering on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Ateca 2010 Atteca Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of 90% Grenache and 10% Syrah from the Armada Vineyard, this expresses its characteristic mix of superripe fruit and organic funk. Cracker, berry, spice and earth components all seem to compete a bit in the mouth and need more bottle time to fully meld together.
Name: K Vintners 2009 The Boy Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Maury, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Aged in glass demijohns for one year and oak tuns for nine, this is a mature selection that's ready to drink now, though it can certainly keep for many more years to come. A beautiful rancio characteristic leads, with aromas of walnut shell, orange oil and earthy spice fill the bouquet. Skin-driven fruit flavors of cherry and plum dominate the gripping palate, while the complex finish reveals accents of black tea, licorice root and baking spice.
Name: Mas Amiel NV Cuvée Spéciale 10 Ans d'Âge Grenache (Maury)

Appellation: Maury, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: This is a brooding selection, with layers of dark fruits (think blackberry, plum and cherry), chewing tobacco and bay leaf alongside a hint of vanilla bean. The palate is rich and dense, with a texture like crushed satin. Tight and flavorful now, this would benefit from a bit more time in the cellar; try after 2015.
Name: Domaine de la Coume du Roy 2008 Grenache (Maury)
Winery: Domaine de la Coume du Roy

Appellation: Vin Doux Naturel Rasteau, Rhône Valley, France
Description: The 2009 vintage was a warm, dry one in the southern Rhône, lending itself to the production of rich dessert wines like this one. Plum and chocolate notes dominate, but there's also complexity in the form of cinnamon and clove. It's full bodied and softly tannic, with lingering notes of cocoa powder and dried spice on the finish.
Name: Cave de Rasteau 2009 Signature Grenache (Vin Doux Naturel Rasteau)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is dense yet fresh, with dark berry and mild earth aromas. It feels lively, forceful and solidly built, with blackberry, creamy chocolate, toast and spice flavors that are all in equal, balanced portions. Long and warm on the finish.
Name: Pago Aylés 2010 Aldeya Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy, inky, sweet and jammy on the nose, this brings just the right hint of raisin. It feels narrow and firmly tannic, with wide flavors of blackberry, prune, raisin and chocolate. It's loaded with flavor, but the mouthfeel is astringent and collapsed. A powerful country-style wine.
Name: Punto y Coma 2009 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich in layers of raspberry and bright cherry, this full-bodied Grenache surprises in its depth of structure. The finish dives deep into caramel and oak, rounding it out pleasantly.
Name: Fenestra 2009 Grenache (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dense and concentrated on the nose, this features blackberry and black cherry aromas, with hardly any perceptible oak. It feels fresh but choppy and tannic, with roasted plum, berry and savory spice flavors. It's baked in flavor and gritty in feel as it finishes.
Name: Picos Pardos 2010 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Croatia, Croatia
Description: Fermented with indigenous yeast and then aged in French oak, this has rose and raspberry perfumes, with deep black-plum and berry flavors. Striking acidity and bold, angular tannins soften on the palate, revealing a smooth, luscious finish.
Name: Bibich 2009 G6 Grenache (Croatia)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Made with 100% Grenache, this is fermented in neutral oak before being transferred to tank. It has substantial weight and spiced cherry flavor. Full bodied for a rosé, it can stand up to a variety of cured meats, pasta dishes and even salmon.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2011 Alder Ridge Vineyard  Rosé Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dense and dark, this has earthy, crusty berry aromas and a sprinkle of herb on the nose. It hits with aggression but settles down nicely to offer raspberry, plum and savory herb flavors. Lively acidity allows for a long finish.
Name: Marqués de Montañana 2010 Selección Especial Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Banyuls, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Notes of dried dark berry, leathery spice, sweet tobacco and chocolate-covered cherry fill the nose of this wine. The satiny texture pairs well with the dusty tannins, and additional flavors of prune, sweet smoke and fresh caramel linger through the medium-length finish.
Name: Les Clos de Paulilles 2009 Rimage  (Banyuls)

Appellation: Rivesaltes Rosé, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Officially launched in 2011, this is a fresh and fruity style of the classic fortified wine. Lively notes of strawberry and cream, white cherry and fresh bay leaf dance on the nose, while the palate boasts flavors of small red berry and vanilla spice.
Name: Croix Milhas 2011 Grenache (Rivesaltes Rosé)

Appellation: Vin Doux Naturel Rasteau, Rhône Valley, France
Description: A rare rosé style of VDN Rasteau, this nonvintage cuvée is pale copper in color, with aromas and flavors of peach and toasted almond. It's nicely silky in texture, with a mouthwatering finish.
Name: Cave de Rasteau NV Doré Grenache (Vin Doux Naturel Rasteau)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Although this is dense, rubbery and leathery on the nose, with airing the rubbery notes dissolve. It feels snappy and medium in body, with good concentration and flavors of raspberry, toast and herb. Dry, peppery and short on the finish.
Name: Campos de Luz 2010 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Inky and jammy upfront, this has cheesy leather and berry aromas. It feels good, with ripe tannins and a flavor profile of juicy berry and cherry that lacks some complexity. The finish is awash in ripe, powerful berry.
Name: Teorema 2009 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Vin Doux Naturel Rasteau, Rhône Valley, France
Description: The local cooperative's entry-level VDN features a soft, velvety texture and notes of chocolate, almond and dark plum. A bit of warmth shows through on the finish.
Name: Cave de Rasteau NV Grenache (Vin Doux Naturel Rasteau)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Blueberry and raisin aromas announce ripeness. This wine feels jammy but vital, with a prune flavor and a lightly roasted note. Although the wine becomes a little too soft at the end, it's flavorful and dense. A good match for a hamburger or steak sandwich.
Name: Filón 2010 Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Floral berry aromas are fresh and carry only the slightest grassy, green element. The wine feels crisp and tight, with nice red plum and raspberry flavors. Mild, focused and not very hefty or thick on the finish.
Name: Castillo de Monséran 2010 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jammy berry, blueberry and spice aromas meet the nose, followed by a narrow palate that turns softer as the wine airs out. Flavors of jammy berry and raisin end on a mellow, chewy finish. A soft Garnacha for casual consumption.
Name: Viña Alarba 2010 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's grassy plum and berry aromas have a lactic angle. It feels full but gripping, with pasty floral flavors that leave a grabby residue on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Magnífico 2010 Grenache (Cariñena)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy, rubbery aromas accompany rustic notes of stalk and leather. This feels astringent and grabby, with green berry and mint flavors. It finishes with size and power but not much agility.
Name: Las Rocas de San Alejandro 2009 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra del Bajo Aragón, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Reasonably clean, simple and steady on the bouquet, this is subsequently chunky and fairly full in the mouth, with grassy red-fruit flavors that end with tannic clamp. Perfectly drinkable for a large-production wine (38,000 cases).
Name: Evohé 2011 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra del Bajo Aragón)
Region: Vino de la Tierra del Bajo Aragón

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: . Its mouthfeel smacks hard with acidity, leaving a crisp expression of strawberry, raspberry and herb flavors. It turns warm, lactic and chocolaty on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Aletta 2010 Veraz Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A light rhubarb flavor with a dash of pepper can be found here, but the mouthfeel seems flat and the wine dries out quickly. Drink up.
Name: Thomas O'Neil Cellars 2011 Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Rubbery and fiery on the nose, this wine is then chunky, chewy and thick in the mouth. It tastes sweet, like berry syrup, but also a touch grassy and herbal. It feels full in weight and tastes slightly warm on the finish.
Name: Tapeña 2010 Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gaseous and rubbery on the nose, this is overpowered by a tire aroma and heavily reduced berry scents. It feels thick and ultrajammy, with overwhelming berry flavors in front of a heavy, hot finish.
Name: Stylo 2009 Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Flat, jammy and pasty on the nose, this wine has mildly lactic, slightly green flavors of berry and cherry. It loses its fruit on the back palate and finish.
Name: Bodegas la Aldea 2010 La Gardea Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Capay Valley, Central Valley, California, US
Description: With only one barrel made, Casey Flat's Grenache is still at the experimental level, but this vintage shows its potential: full and dense, with ripe strawberry, rich leather, smoky black tar and a smidge of black licorice. Give it 3–5 years to further complicate those flavors and open up.
Name: Casey Flat Ranch 2010 Grenache (Capay Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This lovely Grenache Noir has flavors of black tea and black pepper, softened by layers of fruit and smoky black licorice. Big, black and intense, give it another 3–5 years to mellow out. It will surely retain its gorgeous herbal and savory elements.
Name: Holly's Hill 2010 Estate Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Perfumed, floral and intriguing, this is still tight with mountain tannins. In a few years, its thick black-cherry and pepper tones will emerge, becoming rounded out with notes of violet and oaky leather.
Name: Naggiar 2009 Estate Grenache (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a pure Grenache, tart and spicy, with powerful herb components. It is not fruity or sappy-sweet by any measure, but it delivers moderately concentrated flavors highlighted by herb and earth notes, with good length and balance.
Name: Cowhorn 2010 Grenache 58 Grenache (Applegate Valley)

Description: Using Grenache sourced from the moderately cool Lonesome Springs Vineyard, this is slightly leafy, with notes of forest floor, blueberry and blackberry. This is the first pure Grenache ever made by Brian Carter. It doesn't just taste like a big bowl of berries; it has power and depth to spare.
Name: Brian Carter 2010 1 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Almansa, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This smells of baked black fruit, coconut, vanilla and char, with a palate that's ultrasaturated and almost cloying. The compact flavors are of concentrated blackberry liqueur and cassis, which narrow to berry and oak notes on the finish.
Name: Atalaya 2010 Alaya Garnacha (Almansa)

Appellation: Valencia, Levante, Spain
Description: Red berry and plum aromas form the base of this wine's fresh, uncomplicated bouquet. It feels juicy and bright, with good layering and aggressive flavors of berry and plum. The finish is dry and snappy, with mild oak and spice flavors.
Name: Rafael Cambra 2009 Soplo Garnacha (Valencia)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Raisin and heavy plum aromas suggest full ripeness and even some overripeness. It feels chewy and textured, with serious concentration and baked flavors of dark berry and roasted plum. This tips the scale in terms of weight and ripeness, delivering a deep, roasted character that calls for near-term consumption
Name: Ziries 2008 Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: La Mancha, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This is spicy and dry on the nose, with a cheesy accent. It feels medium in body, with sharp acidity that creates a semisour flavor profile of red plum and cherry. Not overly flavorful, it concludes with a crisp, cleansing finish.
Name: Finca Antigua 2009 Garnacha (La Mancha)

Appellation: Almansa, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Right from the start things are stretched thin. It smells raw and feels dilute, with flavors of sour plum and a bit of wood resin. Fiery and tart on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Tintoralba 2010 BT Tintorera Garnacha (Almansa)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône Villages, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This wine starts off with vanilla, cinnamon and dark cherry notes on the nose, with the oak-derived elements marrying nicely with the Grenache fruit. It's full bodied, liquorous and lush, with a long, velvety finish. Probably best over the next 4–5 years.
Name: LePlan-Vermeersch 2009 GT-G Grand Terroir Grenache (Côtes du Rhône Villages)

Appellation: Almansa, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Rusty in color, this has a baked fruit aromas suggestive of raisin, cherry and plum. It's thick, but it maintains freshness due to the solid acidity. This feels heavy, with robust flavors of roasted plum and blackberry, but the finish isn't cloying.
Name: Dehesa el Carrascal 2008 Dulcemar Garnacha (Almansa)

Appellation: Valle de Guadalupe, Mexico
Description: Opaque in color, with smoky aromas of bacon, berry purée, latex and dried herbs. Feels saturated and grapy, with big, plodding tannins in front of soft, stewed flavors of blackberry and prune. Darkens up on what amounts to a soft finish. Pure Grenache.
Name: La Lomita 2009 Pagano Grenache (Valle de Guadalupe)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: The candied red-fruit aroma is soft yet snappy. It tastes briny and citrusy before ending with a persistent peppery bitterness and lively acidity.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2011 Rosado Garnacha (Rioja)

Appellation: Valle de Guadalupe, Mexico
Description: Hot and heavy from first whiff, this has plastic and red pepper notes, with a sweet strawberry aroma. It's thick as syrup on the palate, with extracted, fully ripe flavors of blackberry and raisin. Maat means “the land” in a native language; but it could mean syrupy sweet. Hard to believe this is just 13.5% abv.
Name: Tres Valles 2009 Maat Grenache (Valle de Guadalupe)

Appellation: Rioja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Strawberry and raspberry aromas set up a reedy, flush palate with stemmy, candied strawberry flavors. Turns green and bitter on the finish.
Name: Bodegas del Mundo 2011 Valdemoreda Rosado Garnacha (Rioja)

Appellation: Cava, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Salmon in color, this is pulpy and perfumed on the nose, with an artificial leaning. Overly foamy on the palate, this has a bitter, herbal flavor.
Name: Unión Vinícola del Este NV Vega Medien Brut Rosé Garnacha (Cava)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first varietally labeled Grenache from Tempus, and it's lovely. Lush, with fresh raspberry scents and flavors, this is a juicy, fruit-driven wine with excellent grip and density.
Name: Tempus Cellars 2010 Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A Grenache blended with small amounts of Mourvèdre and Syrah, this may need more time in bottle to truly reveal itself. But for now, its herbal characteristics overpower the hidden notes of blueberry and vanilla trying to get out.
Name: Andis 2010 Grenache (Amador County)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This lacy, fine-tuned Grenache displays superb aromatics that are still a bit raw. One gets the feeling that as good as the juicy, young grape and berry flavors are, this wine has more complexity lurking below the surface. Berry, mineral and bright spices elevate the finish, much like a youthful Montsant.
Name: Maison Bleue 2010 La Montagnette Upland Vineyard Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jammy berry aromas come with a dense coating of milk chocolate. But in the mouth, it's snappy and juicy, with enough body to handle the acids. It tastes fresh, pointed and zesty, with plum and berry flavors that finish full and grabby. A very good old-vine Garnacha for the price.
Name: Zorzal 2010 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Navarra)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Strawberry and herbal aromas find their way to a tight, structured palate that's home to medicinal fruit flavors, accented by toast and bitter chocolate. Dark and medium-long on the finish, with freshness, depth and good complexity. Drink now.
Name: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2007 Menguante Selección Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Floral, with berry aromas, it's also quite charred and oaky, with mocha. It feels weighty despite displaying prickly acidity, and there's a resiny feel to the palate as well. The flavors of baking spice, chocolate and blackberry run aside barrel-driven flavors. This is a big, oaky Garnacha.
Name: Borsao 2010 Tres Picos Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: An impressive wine for $8. This smells savory, like a mix of smoked meats, roasted berries and leather, and it feels juicy and racy, with a good texture and honest flavors of blackberry, savory meat and spice. The finishes is mild, with mild herbal notes and tobacco.
Name: Abrazo 2010 Garnacha (Cariñena)

Appellation: Calatayud, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: With full black-cherry and bacon aromas, this affordable wine comes across well on the nose. Thick and full-bodied in the mouth, this has flavors of blackberry, creamy oak, chocolate and vanilla. It feels broad and just bright enough on the finish.
Name: Stylo 2008 Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Rubbery and gaseous smelling at first, with medicinal black-fruit aromas of blueberry and black plum. It feels syrupy and heavy, with roasted flavors of herb-tinged black fruit and mint. A full-bodied, forceful wine, with heat and herbal influences.
Name: Pagos del Moncayo 2010 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Cariñena, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Narrow and fiery on the nose, this has plum and raspberry aromas. On the palate, it feels snappy and crisp, with a mild lactic note alongside flavors of light herb, raspberry, plum and buttery oak.
Name: Gabarda 2009 Crianza Old Vine Red (Cariñena)

Appellation: Navarra, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is bulky on the nose, with meaty, rubbery aromas. It feels more snappy and acidic on the tongue, with zesty acids pushing tomato, red plum and herb flavors. Long and steady on the finish, with additional tomato-based tang.
Name: Bodegas Artazu 2010 Artazuri Garnacha (Navarra)
